Name: Vinay Aakalu
About: Dr. Aakalu is a fellowship-trained, oculofacial plastic surgeon specializing in cosmetic and reconstructive oculofacial and orbital surgery. He is also board certified in ophthalmology. He is one of a select few surgeons worldwide to have completed an American Society of Ophthalmic Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) approved fellowship. His clinical interests include diseases of the eyelids, lacrimal system and orbit. He has a particular interest in thyroid eye disease and ocular surface reconstruction. Dr. Aakalu is also engaged in various research endeavors, including understanding lacrimal (tear gland) cell biology, evaluating imaging modalities for the orbit, and developing new tools and methods to treat patients with orbital disease.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Herand Abcarian
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.-4300

Name: Khaled Abdelhady
About: Dr. Khaled Abdelhady has been trained by elite professors in the field of Cardiothoracic Surgery at distinguished universities. Dr. Abdelhady is a primary adult cardiac surgeon who has a practice focus on reconstructive cardiac valve repair surgery, as well as valve replacement and coronary bypass. He is also highly skilled to perform video assisted thoracoscopic anatomical lung resections for lung cancer patients. He is also closely working with our robotic surgeons to develop a robotic thoracic surgery program including diaphragmatic pacing for ALS patients. He will be working closely with our cardiologists, pulmonologists and oncology team to develop a cutting edge adult cardiothoracic surgery program.
Specialty: Adult Cardiovascular Surgery including Endovascular Thoracic Aortic Surgery
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Mohamad Abdulhai
About: Dr. Mohamad Abdulhai practices in the Division of Colon & Rectal Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Abdulhai aims to provide the highest quality of care to patients by educating them about their illness and offering a personalized care plan that utilizes a multidisciplinary approach and the latest in cutting-edge surgical technology and medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2061

Name: Edward Abraham
About: Dr. Edward Abraham is a board-certified orthopedic surgeon with a special interest in pediatric related problems. Dr. Abraham specializes in arthroscopic surgery, sports medicine, and treating trauma and fractures. He regularly treats club foot, pediatric fractures, scoliosis, and polydactyly. Dr. Abraham is bilingual in Arabic and English.
Location: Outpatient Care Center (OCC), Suite 2A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1300

Name: Tracy Abraham
About: Tracy Abraham is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Ms. Abraham practices at the Mile Square Health Center-Main location, and she has special interests in family planning, contraceptive management, breastfeeding, and birth alternatives. She is passionate about providing culturally sensitive, evidence-based healthcare to women throughout their lifespan, and she has a strong commitment to improving the health disparities that exist for women of color.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Charles Abrams
About: Dr. Charles Abrams is a physician scientist and neuromuscular neurologist at UI Health. Dr. Abrams' clinical practice focuses on delivering the highest level of multidisciplinary care in a single visit to patients with neuromuscular disorders, such as ALS, muscular dystrophy, Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT), myasthenia gravis, and other diseases affecting nerves and muscles. His goal is to deliver the highest level of care, including providing patients to the most up-to-date treatments for these disorders and maximizing their access to clinical trials, where appropriate. Dr. Abrams is the director of the comprehensive UIC Neuromuscular Center, which is an ALS Association-certified ALS Center of Excellence, Muscular Dystrophy Association-sponsored Clinical Care Center, and Charcot-Marie-Tooth Disease Association Center of Excellence.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Omer Acar
About: Dr. Omer Acar practices in the Department of Urology at UI Health. Dr. Acar specializes in functional and reconstructive urology to treat urologic conditions, including urinary incontinence, pelvic organ prolapse, voiding dysfunction, urethral stricture, and sexual dysfunction. He is a fellowship-trained reconstructive surgeon whose primary interest covers gender-affirming genital surgery. Dr. Acar is an active member of prestigious international societies, including the American Urological Association, the European Association of Urology, the International Continence Society, and the American College of Surgeons.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 2nd Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2779

Name: Pranshu Adavadkar
About: With more than 10 years of clinical experience in both outpatient clinic and hospital settings, Dr. Adavadkar understands how important it is for the patients and their parents to get best possible care in a timely manner. Dr. Adavadkar takes pride in providing care in a respectful, compassionate manner. He believes that the parents know their child better than anyone else and spends a significant time listening to their concerns and working with them as a team. Along with managing common medical conditions like cold, asthma, rash, ear infections etc., he has extensive experience in managing behavior disorders like ADHD, ADD etc. His special area of expertise is sleep disorders including obstructive sleep apnea, inability to fall or stay asleep, restless sleep, and non-restorative sleep which contribute to various common behavior and learning problems. He also works closely with adolescents and young adults with sleep problems.
Location: Sleep Sciences Center, Suite 104, 2242 W. Harrison St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1091

Name: Khadijat Adeniyi
About: Khadijat Adeniyi is an advanced practice registered nurse in Supportive Care Services at UI health. Ms. Adeniyi's clinical background is in community-based palliative care, complex care management, and critical care. Her primary goal is to improve quality of life of every patient by addressing their physical and psychosocial needs, and she is passionate about alleviating stressors associated with serious illnesses. Ms. Adeniyi is dedicated to supporting every patient, not only with symptom management but also by helping them understand their treatment options and goals.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.9011

Name: Roxana Aguirre Castaneda
About: Dr. Roxana Aguirre Castaneda practices in the Division of Pediatric Endocrinology at UI Health. Dr. Aguirre Castaneda's treats patients with pituitary, adrenal, and puberty disorders, and her research interests include extraskeletal benefits of vitamin D, adrenoleukodystrophy, and type 1 and type 2 diabetes in children and adolescents.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Aneet Ahluwalia
About: Dr. Aneet Ahluwalia works in primary care as part of his outpatient practice. Dr. Ahluwalia also provides some outpatient psychiatric care. He is interested in integrated healthcare of mind and body as well as medical education. His other role is director of the psychiatric consult service.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627

Name: Saba Ahmad
About: Dr. Saba Ahmad is an assistant professor of clinical pediatrics in the Department of Neurology at UI Health. She graduated from the Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis. She was an intern in Pediatrics at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia, a resident in Neurology at the Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania/Children's Hospital of Philadelphia, and a fellow in Clinical Neurophysiology at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia. Her clinical interests include epilepsy and neurogenetics/neurometabolic diseases. Her research interests include epilepsy and genetics. She is particularly interested in epilepsy management, with a focus on dietary epilepsy management and on surgical epilepsy management. She is board-certified in pediatrics and in neurology, with special qualifications in child neurology. Locations where Dr. Ahmad sees patients include the Epilepsy Center at the Children's Hospital University of Illinois (CHUI). Dr. Ahmad speaks English and Urdu.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Zohair Ahmed
About: Dr. Zohair Ahmed practices in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Dr. Ahmed specializes in advanced gastroenterology procedures, with a specific interest in endoscopic bariatric weight-loss options, including intragastric balloon placement and endoscopic sleeve gastroplasty.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3800

Name: Ibrahim Al Dasoqi
About: Ibrahim "Abraham" Al Dasoqi is an advanced practice registered nurse in the Division of Nephrology/Kidney Transplant Program at UI Health. Mr. Al Dasoqi provides individualized care to patients who have undergone kidney transplants. He also is a faculty member in the UIC College of Nursing.
Location: Ear & Eye Infirmary (EEI), Suite 1077, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6590

Name: Ali Alaraj
About: Dr. Ali Alaraj is a fellowship-trained neurosurgeon and is dually trained in open vascular and endovascular neurosurgery. Dr. Alaraj's clinical practice includes treating patients with ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke (subarachnoid hemorrhage, intracranial bleeding, acute stroke). His medical expertise includes neurocritical care, treating patients with acute stroke, intracranial bleeding, brain aneurysms, arteriovenous malformations, complex dural arteriovenous fistulas, carotid cavernous fistulas, carotid artery and intracranial vessels stenosis. He has more than 80 published peer-reviewed articles and textbook chapters and serves on the editorial board for Neurosurgery and Neurological Research journals. His research interests include outcomes of management of brain aneurysms and arteriovenous malformations; quantitative cerebral flow measures; computational quantification of intracranial flows by angiography, in addition to virtual reality simulation in neurosurgical training.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Mina Al-Awqati
About: Dr. Mina Al-Awqati practices in the Division of Rheumatology at UI Health. Dr. Al-Awqati has a deep interest in dermatomyositis, scleroderma, and vasculitis. She also has an interest in musculoskeletal ultrasound, and she performs procedures with ultrasound guidance.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Allison Albian
About: Allison Albian is physician assistant in the Department of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery at UI Health. Ms. Albian provides individualized care to patients with acute and chronic ear, nose, and throat problems. Her special interests include treatment of ear disease, vestibular disorders, and working with the hearing impaired. She is a collaborating provider with the Chicago Public Schools Office of Student Health & Wellness, working directly with children who have failed school hearing exams.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Maria Albright
About: Dr. Maria Albright is a family medicine provider at UI Health. Dr. Albright's areas of interest include adolescent health and diabetes care.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Hayfaa Aldasoqi
About: Hayfaa Aldasoqi is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Ms. Aldasoqi specializes in prenatal and postpartum care and managing women in labor. She is passionate about providing culturally sensitive care for women throughout their lifespan. Ms. Aldasoqi also works with the team in Maternal-Fetal Medicine to assist in the care of those with high-risk pregnancies.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Tamika Alexander
About: Dr. Tamika Alexander completed her residency here and wanted to stay at  UI Health largely because of its commitment to ending health disparities. Dr. Alexander spends 50% of her time at the Mile Square Health Center, which enables her to provide care to patients for whom access to care has been a significant issue. Over the next few years, Dr. Alexander plans to improve health literacy among the underserved populations she cares for by educating them about women's health. She also co-authored the article "Ambulatory Arrhythmia Monitoring in Pregnant Patients with Palpitations," published in the American Journal of Perinatology, which examined the frequency of rhythm disturbances in pregnant women following placement of a Holter monitor or an ERT. Dr. Alexander is a member of the American College of Obstetrics and Gynecology, National Medical Association, and the American Medical Association.
Location: Mile Square Health Center, Englewood, 641 W. 63rd St., Chicago, IL 60621, 312.996.2000, Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: David Allison
About: Dr. David Allison practices in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Allison supervises the performance of specialized blood procedures known as apheresis, which is a valuable tool for the treatment of diseases of blood and bone marrow, nervous and immune systems, and organ transplantation. He also provides expert consultation to physicians and other healthcare providers in best practices for blood transfusions. Dr. Allison diagnoses diseases in biopsies and surgically removed tissues, ensuring that patients receive the best possible care.
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0186

Name: Jorge Almario Alvarez
About: Dr. Jorge A. Almario Alvarez is a physician surgeon and Assistant Professor of Clinical Surgery in the Division of Transplantation at UI Health. Dr. Almario Alvarez has extensive experience and knowledge in liver, kidney, and pancreas transplantation. Passionate about his role in patients' lives, Dr. Almario thrives to treat each individual patient with respect and compassion.
Location: Ear & Eye Infirmary (EEI), Suite 1000, 1855 W. Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6771

Name: Augusto Alonto
About: Dr. Augusto Alonto practices in the Division of Infectious Diseases at UI Health. Dr. Alonto's clinical interests include HIV, hospital-acquired infections, and infection prevention. He is the medical director of infection prevention and control at the Jesse Brown VA Medical Center in Chicago.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8937

Name: Igor Altman
About: Dr. Igor Altman is a family physician at UI Health. Dr. Altman specialties include dermatology care, wound care, and treating arterial insufficiencies, pressure-related injuries, diabetes-related tissue defects, and venous diseases. He is multilingual and speaks English, Russian, and Ukrainian.
Specialty: Soft Tissue Defects Due to Diabetes
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Alexis Alvarado
About: Alexis Alvarado is a licensed social worker in Supportive Care Services at UI Health. Ms. Alvarado specializes in healthcare social work, and she has experience in both skilled nursing facility and inpatient hospital settings. She enjoys learning about her patients to help provide resources and safe discharge plans.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.2982

Name: Liliana Alvarez
About: Liliana Alvarez is a Family Nurse Practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center-Back of the Yards location. Ms. Alvarez specializes in family medicine. She provides culturally sensitive primary care services to patients of all ages.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Back of the Yards, 4630 S. Bishop St., Chicago, IL 60609, 312.996.2000

Name: Thomas Anderson
About: Dr. Thomas Anderson is board-certified in diagnostic radiology and nuclear medicine, with a subspecialty certification in pediatric radiology and neuroradiology. Dr. Anderson is a fellow of the American College of Radiology and has been in practice for more than 40 years.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6840

Name: Alexandra Anderson
About: Dr. Alexandra (Alex) Anderson is a physical therapist in Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. A former collegiate athlete, Dr. Anderson has a passion for sports and the injuries that often come with athletic activities. She played collegiate sports herself and now enjoys endurance sports including running and cycling. She is fellowship-trained in orthopaedic manual physical therapy, and she specializes sports medicine rehabilitation, postoperative rehabilitation, and orthopaedic therapy.
Location: Physical Therapy at University Village, 711 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.2626

Name: Amanda Andrews
About: Amanda Andrews is a nurse practitioner in the Department of Neurosurgery at UI Health. Ms. Andrews works in collaboration with Drs. Ali Alaraj and Gursant Atwal on the endovascular treatment of patients with stroke, arteriovenous malformations (AVM), and brain aneurysm.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Melissa Angulo
About: Melissa Angulo is a nurse practitioner in the UI Health Comprehensive Stroke Center. Melissa is involved in all aspects of care from the time stroke patients arrive at UI Health until they are transferred to the next level of care. She provides clinical care and education to patients and their families, ensuring they have all the necessary equipment and information for a seamless transition home and to return to their previous level of functioning. Melissa also is actively involved in community engagement programs to deliver stroke care and prevention education to UI Health's surrounding patient communities.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago,  IL  60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Maria Isabel Angulo
About: Dr. Maria Isabel Angulo is a primary care physician at UI Health, specializing in both Adult Internal Medicine and Pediatrics. Her clinical interests include primary care for all ages, preventive medicine, women's health, and minority health/health equity. Her academic interests include medical education, public health, and global health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA/3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627

Name: Ashish Ansal
About: Dr. Ashish Ansal is a family practice physician at the Mile Square Health Center–Englewood location. Dr. Ansal is passionate about treating patients in underserved communities, and he has a strong interest in preventing, treating, and managing chronic medical conditions, including hypertension, diabetes, and obesity. His belief is that best medicine is prevention, and he strongly encourages all patients who meet age criteria to have screenings for breast, colon, and prostate cancers.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Englewood, 641 W. 63rd St., Chicago, IL 60621, 312.996.2000

Name: Sajid Ansari
About: Dr. Sajid Ansari practices in the Division of Nephrology at UI Health. Dr. Ansari provides comprehensive, individualized care to all kidney transplant patients and patients with chronic kidney diseases. He has a special interest in kidney transplantation for obese patients, living kidney donation, and combined organ transplants.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569, Ear & Eye Infirmary, Suite 1077, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7318

Name: Inger Anthony
About: Inger Anthony is an advanced practice nurse in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Ms. Anthony provides comprehensive ambulatory services, including routine health exams and acute care visits, for patients of all ages, from infants to young adults. Keeping parents at the forefront of their child's healthcare decision making while simultaneously promoting childhood independence is at the core of her practice.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: David Anyadike
About: Dr. David Anyadike practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Anyadike specializes in pediatric primary care, and he specializes in development, diet/lifestyle, and mentoring and social support for patients. His focus is to give patients options for physical activity, nutrition, mentoring, career choices, and other issues, to help them be healthy, happy, and successful kids.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 606012, 312.996.2000

Name: Shiva Arami
About: Dr. Shiva Arami practices in the Division of Rheumatology at UI Health. Dr. Arami's specialties include rheumatoid arthritis and scleroderma.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569

Name: Amer Ardati
About: I came to UI Health to be part of its mission to "Change Medicine - For Good." I look forward to working with patients and families with heart disease and help them turn their challenges into opportunities for better health. My areas of expertise include the treatment of blockages in the heart and legs by using minimally invasive catheters, balloons and stents. I am also interested in helping patients with diseases of the heart valves. While procedures are important to me I feel that a long lasting therapeutic relationship is vital to good heart health and I look forward to being your partner.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Ahmad Aref
About: Dr. Ahmed Aref practices in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. Dr. Aref's clinical practice concentrates on cataract and glaucoma surgical therapies. Specifically, he performs trabeculectomy and glaucoma drainage implant surgery for advanced glaucomatous disease, in addition to microinvasive glaucoma surgery (MIGS) for patients with mild to moderate disease. Specific MIGS options offered by Dr. Aref include trabecular microbypass stent (iStent, Glaukos Co.) implantation; ab-interno canaloplasty; gonioscopy-assisted transluminal trabeculotomy (GATT); Kahook Dual Blade (KDB, New World Medical, Inc.) goniotomy; and endolaser cyclophotocoagulation (ECP). He has a particular interest in the management of angle-closure glaucomas.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Eduardo Arias
About: Eduardo Arias is a Board-Certified Clinical Anaplastologist who specialize in facial and ocular prosthetics rehabilitation, digital technologies, and innovation in medicine. He received his Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from the Pontificia Universidad Javeriana in Bogotá, Colombia. His education was followed by graduate clinical training in facial prosthetics at The Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine, Department of Art as Applied to Medicine in Baltimore, Maryland. Eduardo has a Master of Science (MSc) in Maxillofacial Rehabilitation at King's College London in London, England, UK. He received clinical experience at the JHU Facial Prosthetics Clinic, The Johns Hopkins Hospital and has worked in private practice at WCBL in Tampa, FL. He currently practices as a Clinical Anaplastologist and Ocularist at Craniofacial Center, University of Illinois at Chicago Department of Plastic, Cosmetic and Reconstructive Surgery, and is the director of the 3D Printing Lab at CFC and the Surgical Innovation Training Lab (SITL). Eduardo has been a member of the International Anaplastology Association since 2013.
Location: Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Wasiu Ariyo
About: Wasiu Ariyo is a family nurse practitioner who practices patient-centered care to all ages. His clinical interests are in diabetes and hypertension management.
Location: Mile Square Health Center, Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Emelia 'Mimi' Arquilla
About: Dr. Emelia "Mimi" Arquilla practices in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Arquilla provides primary care to patients of all ages. They have special interests in LGBTQ+ inclusive healthcare, gender-affirming care, addiction medicine, family planning, chronic disease management, and preventative medicine. In their spare time, they can be found tending to their houseplants, trying new recipes, and working to reduce inequality for marginalized populations.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Christian Ascoli
About: Dr. Christian Ascoli is a pulmonologist at UI Health. Dr. Ascoli specialize in pulmonary and critical care medicine, with a focus on lung diseases. His clinical interests include sarcoidosis, interstitial lung diseases, pulmonary tuberculosis, and mycobacterial disease.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3300

Name: Ukamaka Atueyi
About: Dr. Ukamaka Atueyi practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Atueyi utilizes a number of imaging techniques to diagnose medical issues, and she collaborates with other healthcare providers to provide effective patient care.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 2nd Floor, 1740 West Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Alex Auseon
About: Dr. Alex Auseon is a general cardiologist and sees patients with all forms of heart disease. Dr. Auseon spends much of his time supervising and interpreting all major types of cardiac imaging studies — echocardiograms, nuclear stress tests, cardiac CT, and cardiac MRI. He is the director of the cardiology fellowship training program at the University of Illinois at Chicago College of Medicine, which provides the opportunity to help future cardiologists work towards reaching their full potential as physicians after they graduate. Dr. Auseon values the opportunity to meet patients and their families and looks for ways to improve their quality of life as they live with heart disease.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Kelsie Avants
About: Dr. Kelsie Avants is a pediatrician and internal medicine physician at UI Health. Dr. Avants specializes in primary care for patients of all ages, preventative health, and chronic disease management. Her academic interests include community public health and advocacy, mental health, global health, and medical education.
Location: South Loop Physicians Group, Suite 100, 2600 S. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60616, 312.492.0025

Name: Boaz Avitall
About: An internationally known pioneer and inventor, Dr. Avitall's interests include heart rhythm monitoring and management, ablation of cardiac arrhythmia, pacemakers and defibrillators, and cardiac electrophysiology ablation technologies. He holds numerous patents in cardiac arrhythmia ablation and has published extensively on the subject.  The first researcher to test endocardial atrial fibrillation ablation, he introduced linear ablation technology to the field of atrial fibrillation ablation.  He also invented and was the first to examine the applicability of cryoballoon technology to the treatment of atrial fibrillation, which led to this technology becoming a commonly used approach to ablate atrial fibrillation. Dr. Avitall has done extensive work on the long-term harmful impact of chronic atrial fibrillation.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Jacob Avraham
About: Dr. Jacob Avraham is a trauma and critical care surgeon at UI Health. Dr. Avraham specializes in the treatment of surgical ICU patients, including those with a broad range of acute or life-threatening conditions from trauma, operations, burns, infections, acute inflammation, ischemia, and many other etiologies. His clinical interests include injury epidemiology, student and resident education, and the role of multidisciplinary care teams in providing optimal care to complex surgical patients. Dr. Avraham has authored numerous peer-reviewed publications and has presented his work at surgical conferences across the country.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Nathalie Azar
About: Dr. Nathalie Azar is director of the Pediatric Ophthalmology and Adult Strabismus Services in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. Dr. Azar specializes in eye movement disorders, Graves' disease, and paralytic and restrictive strabismus.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937), Millennium Park Eye Center, Suite 410, 30 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60602, 312.996.2020

Name: Siavash Azarnia
About: Dr. Siavash Azarnia is a palliative care physician in Supportive Care Services at UI Health. Dr. Azarnia's focus is on helping patients live their best lives for as long as possible. He considers working with patients who have a serious illness and helping them and their loved ones navigate the difficulties that come with it is to be his life's work. Dr. Azarnia is  honored to serve the UI Health community and advocate for his patients.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.8728

Name: Michelle Bain
About: Dr. Michelle Bain is the director of pediatric skin diseases at UI Health. Dr. Bain has special expertise in atopic dermatitis, acne vulgaris, moles, birthmarks, alopecia, vitiligo, and warts. She has been practicing dermatology for more than 30 years.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8666

Name: Daniel Bakston
About: Dr. Daniel Bakston practices in the Department of Occupational and Environmental Medicine at UI Health, where he performs post-offer, fitness-for-duty, and return-to-work employment physicals. As a certified Medical Review Officer, he also sees acute work-related injuries and poisonings and conducts independent medical evaluations. Dr. Bakston is the Program Director for the Occupational Medicine residency program at UI Health. He is board-certified in Preventative Medicine.
Location: Occupational Health & Workers' Compensation Clinic, Suite E144, 835 S. Wolcott Ave., Chicago, IL 60612, 312-443-0369

Name: Purnima Balachandran
About: Dr. Purnima Balachandran practices in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Dr. Balachandran's clinical practice is based on careful listening and establishing trust with her patients. She focuses on understanding their concerns and expectations, helping them understanding potential therapies and treatment options, and working toward achieving the best possible outcomes.
Location: Back To Top

Name: Mariah Balinski
About: Mariah Balinski is a physical therapy specialist in Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Ms. Balinski is a board-certified clinical specialist in Orthopaedic Physical Therapy, and she enjoys treating a wide variety of patients - from orthopaedic diagnoses to chronic pain to oncology rehabilitation. She is fluent in Spanish and enjoys working with Spanish-speaking patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Brian Baranyi
About: Dr. Brian Baranyi sees patients in the Physical Therapy Faculty Practice at UI Health and is a part of the Concussion Management Program. Dr. Baranyi specializes in the evaluation and treatment of orthopedic conditions, and he has additional interests in injury prevention, sports medicine, concussions in sports, chronic pain, and academics.
Location: Physical Therapy Faculty Practice, Room 336, 1640 W. Roosevelt Rd., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.413.8043

Name: Vanessa Barbosa
About: Vanessa Barbosa practices in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Ms. Barbosa specializes in developmental pediatric therapy. She evaluates and treats developmental problems, including a variety of medical diagnoses that lead to interruption on developmental skills acquisition, or problems including but not limited to prematurity, cerebral palsy, surgeries, and developmental delay. Ms. Barbosa performs standardized developmental testing, including TIMP, GMA, Bayley, AIMS, and intervention to promote the acquisition of developmental skills, activities of daily living performance (self-care, feeding), play, and social participation. She also works with education for both patients and their caregivers and assists in discharge planning, including recommendations for equipment needs, early intervention, and outpatient services.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Owen Barmada
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2 South, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.3060

Name: Michelle Barnes
About: Dr. Michelle M. Barnes is board-certified in Pediatrics and Internal Medicine, and she provides care for children from the newborn period through young adulthood at UI Health. Dr. Barnes is an associate professor of Clinical Pediatrics and Internal Medicine at UIC and associate director of the Pediatrics residency program. Her research interests include medical education and family-centered communication. She directs the community pediatrics and advocacy experiences for the pediatric residents where she collaborates with community partners to train future pediatricians to work with community organizations.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Lynnea Barnes
About: Lynnea Barnes practices in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Ms. Barnes primarily works with patients in the acute care setting with varying degrees of acuity/complexity, and she has a special interest in the neurological population. She works to help patients restore mobility and function and uses an interdisciplinary approach. Ms. Barnes is the site clinical coordinator of education for inpatient physical therapy and has teaching responsibilities in UIC's Physical Therapy Program.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Eve Baron
About: For over 10 years, the primary focus of Eve Baron's clinical practice has been in treating patients with pelvic floor disorders in the hospital outpatient and private practice setting. She has completed extensive coursework in evaluation and treatment techniques for women, men, pediatrics, transgender, and non-binary people, with pelvic floor dysfunction, in addition to serving as a lab assistant in the beginner level courses. In addition, Eve has participated in health fairs and lectured to the community on pelvic health and physical therapy. During the past year, she completed her certification through the Herman and Wallace Pelvic Institute as a certified pelvic practitioner. She received her physical therapy degree in 1986 from Washington University in St. Louis.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Leigh Batts
About: Leigh W. Batts is a staff chaplain and advance directives specialist in Supportive Care Services at UI Health. Mr. Batts provides spiritual and emotional support to patients and families as they journey through health difficulties. He offers support to patients, families, and staff in all aspects related to advance directives. Mr. Batts uses his military training in Moral Injuries and Grief/Loss in order to provide spiritual/emotional hope and recovery for patients and staff.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.0296

Name: Rena Beckerly
About: Dr. Rena Beckerly believes in a multimodal, balanced, and evidence-based approach to pain management, starting with conservative therapy and escalating to injection therapy as necessary. She has expertise in performing advanced interventional pain treatments for neck and lower back pain. She is particularly interested in neuromodulation and intrathecal drug delivery systems for pain that has not been relieved by other modalities. Dr. Beckerly has authored several chapters on spinal cord stimulators, intrathecal drug delivery systems, and management of Complex Regional Pain Syndrome.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Gerry Bedore
About: Gerry Bedore is a nurse practitioner in the Department of Occupational & Environmental Health at UI Health. Mr. Bedore specializes in work injuries, occupational exposures, and DOT/CDL physicals. He is certified by the National Registry of Certified Medical Examiners (NRCME), and his goal is to provide comprehensive, compassionate, and patient-centered care to every patient.
Location: Occupational Health & Workers' Compensation Clinic, Suite E144, 835 S. Wolcott Ave., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7420

Name: Patrick Belvitch
About: Dr. Patrick Belvitch provides patient-centered care to individuals with a wide range of lung disease in both the outpatient clinical setting and the hospital and intensive care unit during periods of acute illness.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3300

Name: Enrico Benedetti
About: Dr. Enrico Benedetti is a transplant surgeon at UI Health. Dr. Benedetti is a prominent leader in organ transplantation and in the use of robotic-assisted techniques in transplantation. He has to his credit many successful surgical firsts, including the first robotic donor nephrectomy for a living-donor kidney transplant, the first combined living-donor liver and bowel transplant from an adult to an infant, the first robotic combined kidney and pancreas procurement for a living-donor transplant, and the largest series of living-donor intestinal transplants in the world. Dr. Benedetti is Professor and Head of Surgery and the Warren H. Cole Chair in Surgery.
Location: Ear & Eye Infirmary (EEI), Suite 1000, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6771

Name: Dale Benton
About: Dale Benton is a family nurse practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center-Englewood location. Mr. Benton has a clinical background in critical care and emergency medicine settings, and he provides care for patients of all ages. He believes care should be delivered in a calm and therapeutic environment to help nurture the healing and wellness processes, and as a result, he enjoys playing jazz music during patient visits.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Englewood, 641 W. 63rd St., Chicago, IL 60621, 312.996.2000

Name: Reed Berger
About: Dr. Reed Berger-Fleishman is a Bariatrician in the subspecialty of Internal Medicine. She is also a Physician Nutrition Specialist and is board-certified in both Internal Medicine and Nutrition. Currently, she practices primarily Bariatrics at UI Health in the Nutrition and Wellness Center and Surgery Center. She is the Medical Director of the medically supervised weight loss programs. Her expertise is in following the nutritional needs and comorbidities (presence of two chronic diseases or conditions in a patient) for preoperative and postoperative bariatric surgery patients. She also specializes in Obesity Pharmacotherapy management.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Jamie Berkes
About: Dr. Jamie Berkes is the Director of Hepatology and Medical Director of Liver Transplantation at UI Health. Dr. Berkes specializes in all liver diseases with special attention to end-stage liver disease and the management of pre- and post-liver transplant patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4316

Name: James Berman
About: Dr. James Berman practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Berman specializes in pediatric gastroenterology and sees children with a wide variety of conditions, including those with Crohn's disease and colitis, and children with disabilities.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Kelsey Bernardin
About: Dr. Kelsey Bernardin is an orthopaedic physical therapist in Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Dr. Bernardin's primary specialties include treating patients in orthopaedics, spine, sports medicine, and chronic pain, and she has a focus in hands-on treatment of musculoskeletal dysfunction and pain.
Location: Physical Therapy at University Village, 711 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.2626

Name: Karen Bernstein
About: Dr. Karen Bernstein provides care for adolescents and young adults ages 12–21.  She believes that all children and adolescents have a right to quality, confidential care with a provider who is truly concerned for their health and well-being. She works with her patients to achieve success in their healthcare.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Pooja Bhat
About: Dr. Pooja Bhat's primary focus is inflammatory diseases of the eye. Dr. Bhat specializes in the diagnosis and management of infectious and non-infectious ocular inflammatory conditions, such as scleritis, anterior, intermediate, and posterior uveitis. Her main areas of interest are posterior uveitidies that includes Vogt-Koyanagi-Harada (VKH) disease, Behcet's, sarcoidosis, infectious retinopathies, and white dot syndromes, such as birdshot chorioretinopathy.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Gifty Bhat
About: Dr. Gifty Bhat is an Assistant Professor of Clinical Pediatrics in the Division of Genetics at UI Health. Dr. Bhat is board-certified in Pediatrics and board-eligible in Clinical Genetics. She specializes in Pediatric Clinical Genetics, with special interests in congenital malformations, dysmorphology, and neurogenetics. Her research interests include single-gene pediatric neurodevelopmental disorders and the implementation of next-generation genomic medicine to clinical practice.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Francesco Bianco
About: Dr. Francesco Bianco earned his medical degree from the College of Medicine, G. D’Annunzio University in Chieti, Italy, where he also finished his general surgery residency and obtained his board certification. He completed a minimally invasive and robotic surgery fellowship at “Misericordia” Hospital in Grosseto, Italy as part of the largest program of robotic general surgery in the world. Dr. Bianco has been deeply involved in the development and teaching of robotic surgery since 2003. As coordinator of the International School of Robotic Surgery in Italy and director of the Advanced Robotic Surgery Lab at UI Health, he has trained more than 150 surgeons from around the world in advanced robotic surgery techniques. He has published over 60 peer-reviewed publications and 4 book chapters related to minimally invasive and robotic-assisted surgery.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Alana Biggers
About: Dr. Biggers specializes in general internal medicine of adults and older adults. Her particular areas of interest include preventive health, chronic disease management, health maintenance and prevention, women's health services, and adult cancer survivors.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Leanna Blanchard
About: Leanna Blanchard is a physical therapy specialist in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Dr. Blanchard enjoys working with patients that have pain or injuries in the spine, temporomandibular joint (TMJ), and other joints. She also enjoys working with patients throughout their treatment for breast cancer. Dr. Blanchard has advanced training in orthopaedic and manual physical therapy, in addition to certification in lymphedema therapy. In addition to her clinical practice, Dr. Blanchard participates in teaching physical therapy students, residents, and fellows.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60692, 312.355.4394

Name: Susan Bleasdale
About: Dr. Susan Bleasdale, medical director of infection prevention and control at UI Health, specializes in diagnosing and treating infections. Dr. Bleasdale also provides care for patients with HIV.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337

Name: Allison Blood
About: Allison Blood is a nurse practitioner in the Department of Neurosurgery at UI Health. Working in collaboration with Dr. Sergey Neckrysh, Ms. Blood treats patients with cervical, thoracic, and lumbar pain; degenerative disc disease; spinal stenosis; myelopathy; scoliosis; and congenital and degenerative deformity.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Rachel Blumenthal
About: Rachel Blumenthal is a nurse practitioner in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, Sleep, and Allergy at UI Health. She cares for patients in the Medical Intensive Care Unit (MICU).
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 6th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612

Name: Julia Bodnya
About: Dr. Julia Bodnya practices in the Department of Neurology & Rehabilitation at UI Health. Dr. Bodnya specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of epilepsy and seizures. Her interests include treating complex epilepsy patients using vast array of therapies, including medications, diet modifications, neuromodulation, as well as epilepsy surgery. Dr. Bodnya has a special interest in ketogenic diet as a therapy for seizures and epilepsy. She is an assistant professor at the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Ryan Bolton
About: Dr. Ryan Bolton's clinical interests includes providing general medical care to adult patients. He specializes in diabetes, hypertension, and chronic disease management.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Scott Borgetti
About: Dr. Scott Borgetti practices in the Division of Infectious Diseases at UI Health. Dr. Borgetti provides care for a range of infections with a particular focus on organ transplant recipients and other immunocompromised patients who develop infectious complications.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337

Name: Martin Borhani
About: Dr. Martin Borhani utilizes a variety of techniques to treat vascular disease including open surgery, robot-assisted surgery and endovascular approaches. Dr. Borhani is the Theodore and Joanna Drugas Endowed Chair in Vascular Surgery.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Shane Borkowsky
About: Dr. Shane Borkowsky is the Associate Chief Health Information Officer at UI Health. Dr. Borkowsky specializes in internal medicine, and her clinical interests include providing general medical care to adult patients, including chronic disease management and health maintenance.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA (Primary Care Plus Clinic), 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627

Name: Claudia Boucher-Berry
About: Dr. Boucher-Berry has worked extensively with children and adolescents with type 1 and type 2 diabetes. Working with the families and the patients to ensure a smooth transition after diagnosis is important. Regular follow-up and monitoring of their progress to ensure compliance is also important for their general health and well-being.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Brian Boulay
About: Dr. Brian Boulay is a board-certified gastroenterologist at UI Health. Dr Boulay specializes in therapeutic endoscopy, including treatment of pancreaticobiliary disease (including pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer) and evaluation of the small intestine. His clinical focus is on ERCP, endoscopic ultrasound, endoscopic mucosal resection (EMR) of polyps and masses, double-balloon enteroscopy for small intestinal disease, and treatment of gastrointestinal cancers.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 4th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3800

Name: Gregory Branen
About: Gregory Branen is a licensed clinical social worker in Palliative Care Services at UI Health. Mr. Branen works on the interdisciplinary team for the development and delivery of treatment plan and discharge plans for palliative care patients. He completes psychosocial assessments, provides emotional support, attends family meetings, offers bereavement support, and assists with complex care transitions.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0293

Name: Alexis Braverman
About: Dr. Alexis Braverman is an obstetrician/gynecologist at UI Health. She provides obstetric care for low and moderate risk pregnancies.  She also specializes in gynecologic care, including contraception, abnormal uterine bleeding, and the management of other complex gynecological conditions. Dr. Braverman performs benign gynecological surgery, in addition to in-office gynecologic procedures.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Michael Bresler
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Christie Ann Brillante
About: Dr. Christie Brillante is a pulmonologist at the UI Center for Lung Health. Dr. Brillante provides individualized care to patients with a variety of pulmonary diseases, and she has special interest in minority healthcare.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2740

Name: Joan Briller
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Steven Brint
About: Dr. Steven Brint practices in the Department of Neurology at UI Health. He specializes in treating cerebrovascular diseases of brain, including stroke and aneurysm.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Maximo Brito
About: Dr. Maximo Brito specializes in treating infectious diseases. Dr. Brito is expert in caring for patients infected with HIV. He has been practice for more than 14 years.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337

Name: Russell Brown
About: Dr. Russell Brown practices in the Department of Gastroenterology at UI Health. Dr. Brown sees patients with a range of gastrointestinal conditions, and he has special expertise in diseases of the pancreas and bile duct, and in the evaluation of gastrointestinal bleeding. His specialties include advanced endoscopy, endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP), and double-balloon enteroscopy (DBE).
Location: Back To Top

Name: Julia Brown
About: Dr. Julia Brown practices Internal Medicine and Nephrology at UI Health. Dr. Brown's clinical interests include treating patients with acute and chronic kidney diseases; fluid and electrolyte disorders; high blood pressure; and glomerular diseases. She provides patient care in the inpatient and outpatient settings, and at the Dialysis Center. Dr. Brown is one of two peritoneal dialysis doctors at UI Health and works to keep UI Health as a leader in advancements in peritoneal dialysis and kidney care. She is involved in research about chronic kidney disease and peritoneal dialysis, and she has an interest in educating medical students and residents.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569

Name: Andrea Brown
About: Andrea Brown is a nurse practitioner in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Ms. Brown provides individualized care to patients with liver conditions. Her special interests are in patient education and disease prevention and treatment.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7598

Name: Susan Buchanan
About: Dr. Susan Buchanan, Clinical Associate Professor and Associate Director of the Occupational and Environmental Medicine Residency Program, is dual-certified in Family Medicine and Preventive Medicine/Occupational Medicine. She practiced primary care for over a decade prior to joining the department, adding teaching and research to her active Occupational and Environmental Medicine practice. She directs the Great Lakes Center for Children's Environmental Health, a ATSDR/EPA funded Pediatric Environmental Health Specialty Unit, which is a referral center for physicians, parents, and concerned communities in the Midwest.
Location: Occupational Health & Workers' Compensation Clinic, Room E-144, 835 S. Wolcott Ave., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7420

Name: Alan Buchman
About: Dr. Alan L. Buchman practices in the Division of Gastroenterology at UI Health. Dr. Buchman is an internationally recognized expert in inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, celiac disease, and autoimmune enteritis), short bowel syndrome, nutritional support, intestinal failure/transplant, and parenteral/enteral nutrition. He has been at the forefront of the development of new medications, devices, and foods to treat patients with complex gastrointestinal disorders.
Specialty: Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, celiac disease, and autoimmune enteritis)
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Sultan Budhwani
About: Sultan Budhwani is a physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Dr. Budhwani specializes in orthopaedic physical therapy, and he uses advanced modalities to help patients achieve optimum function, including dry needling, manual therapy, and myofascial release. He also focuses on sports medicine rehabilitation, postoperative rehabilitation, and treating chronic pain. Dr. Budhwani is a passionate about helping the less fortunate and working to train the next generation of therapists at UIC.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Catalin Buhimschi
About: Dr. Catalin Buhimschi practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Buhimschi specializes in Maternal-Fetal Medicine, including preterm labor, pre-eclampsia, and other complications of pregnancy. His research interests include translational clinical and basic science research focusing on addressing pregnancy complications.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: James Bui
Specialty: Peripheral Vascular Occlusive Disease - Endovascular Treatment
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Room 2483, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3737

Name: Alexus Bushëe
About: Alexus Bushëe is a certified physician's assistant in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Ms. Bushëe specializes in urogynecology, pelvic floor disorders, and urodynamic testing. She runs the preoperative clinic to ensure that any medical issues are resolved before surgery and participates in our case review conference to ensure that all patient concerns and issues have been addressed. Ms. Bushëe serves as a liaison to help solve any issues coordinating care with other providers and services, and she helps coordinate referrals with patients' primary care provider to ensure primary care teams remain appraised of our recommendations and treatment plans. This coordination between physicians, nurses, physician's assistants, and primary care teams ensures patients will receive the best possible outcome for pelvic floor disorders.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5096

Name: Robert Cabay
About: Dr. Robert J. Cabay practices in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Cabay is a cytopathologist and surgical pathologist with a special interest in head and neck pathology. His diverse healthcare background enables Dr. Cabay to bring a broad perspective and valuable professional experience to the examination of pathologic tissues and fluids. Dr. Cabay embraces his role as an educator and relishes his participation in the training of fellows, residents, and students. He is involved in internal and external collaborations with renowned clinicians and researchers that have resulted in numerous publications in a wide variety of peer-reviewed medical and dental journals.
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.5529

Name: Gabrielle Cager
About: Dr. Gabrielle Cager has practiced audiology in a variety of settings, from hospitals to private practice. Prior to joining UI Health, she worked for seven years at Children's Hospital in New Orleans and was a member of their Craniofacial/Cleft Lip and Palate Team. Her specialty area is pediatric audiology, which includes diagnostic audiological evaluations, cochlear implants and hearing aid fittings. She is nationally known for her work with auditory osseointegrated implants. She is also globally known for her work in improving hearing health in Ethiopia.
Location: Eye & Ear Infirmary, Suite B46, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6522

Name: Nicholas Callahan
About: Dr. Nicholas Callahan is a surgeon in the Department of Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Callahan specializes in treating patients with both benign and malignant pathologies of the head and neck. He specializes in both removal of tumors and reconstructions of the defects, and he also manages maxillofacial trauma. Dr. Callahan is educated both in medicine and dentistry, and he is fellowship-trained in head and neck oncologic surgery and microvascular surgery.
Location: College of Dentistry, Room 110, 801 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7460

Name: Sally Campbell-Lee
About: Dr. Sally Campbell-Lee is the Director of Transfusion Medicine at UI Health. Her research is focused on the use of red blood cell transfusions in sickle cell disease and the immune effects of transfusion, especially red blood cell sensitization.
Location: Clinical Sciences North, Room 130, 840 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6970

Name: Julie Carbray
About: Dr. Julie Carbray is the administrative director of the Pediatric Mood Disorder Clinic at UI Health. Dr. Carbray is nationally known for helping families of children with mood disorders. She is a clinical expert in the areas of psychotherapy, diagnostic evaluations, and medication management.
Location: Institute for Juvenile Research/Colbeth Clinic, 1747 W. Roosevelt Road, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7723

Name: Melissa Carlucci
About: Melissa Carlucci is a nurse practitioner at the UI Health Sleep Science Center. Ms. Carlucci provides individualized care to patients with sleep apnea and other sleep disorders. Her special interest is educating patients about sleep apnea and helping them to successfully use their CPAP devices. She also is a faculty member at the UIC College of Nursing and teaches in the graduate clinical programs.
Location: Sleep Science Center, Suite 104, 2242 W. Harrison St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7708

Name: Michael Carrithers
About: Dr. Michael Carrithers has provided specialized care for patients with multiple sclerosis and related diseases since 1997. Dr. Carrithers' basic science and translational research program focuses on human innate immune responses in viral and autoimmune diseases and on the development of individualized treatments for multiple sclerosis. The goal of his translational and clinical research program is to develop novel and affordable approaches for the treatment of multiple sclerosis and viral illness. He received his MD and PhD from the University of Illinois and completed subsequent residency and fellowship training at Yale New-Haven Hospital and Yale University.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Robert Carroll
About: Dr. Robert Carroll is board-certified in Internal Medicine and Gastroenterology. Dr. Carroll has special expertise in treating acid reflux disease (gastroesophageal reflux), constipation, irritable bowel syndrome, and ulcerative colitis. He has over 30 years of experience. He is bilingual in English and Spanish.
Location: Back To Top

Name: Ashley Carter
About: Ashley Carter is a board-certified nurse practitioner in the Heart Center at UI Health. Ms. Carter treats patients with a variety of cardiac conditions, and she specializes in the care of patients who need minimally invasive valve replacement procedures, pregnant women with new or known cardiac conditions, and cardiac evaluation prior to transplant.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Ana Carvalho do Amaral
About: Dr. Ana Carvalho do Amaral practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Amaral provides care for patients of all ages and genders, and her specialties focus on contraception, prenatal care, and deliveries. She also has special interest in LGBTQ+ inclusive care and gender-affirming care. Dr. Amaral is involved in improving care for migrants and other underserved populations, including travel-related healthcare.
Location: Pilsen Family Health Center Lower West, 1713 S. Ashland Ave., Chicago, IL 60608, 866.600.2273

Name: Stacy Cash
About: Stacy N. Cash is a speech-language pathologist at the Craniofacial Center at UI Health. Ms. Cash has an extensive background in pediatric speech therapy, including work with pediatric clients with autism spectrum disorder and those with medically complex needs. Stacy has practiced speech-language pathology in a variety of settings, including private practice and school-based settings, and is she an active member of the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA).
Location: Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Rachel Caskey
About: Dr. Rachel Caskey is board-certified in both pediatrics and internal medicine and provides primary care for all ages. Dr. Caskey is a health services researcher with an interest in improving national vaccination efforts. She has an appointment at UIC School of Public Health and is a member of the UIC Cancer Center where she collaborates on efforts to improve HPV vaccination rates to reduce the incidence of HPV-related cancers.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Fidel Castillo
About: Dr. Castillo Diaz specializes in comprehensive geriatric assessment, dementia, and falls.
Location: South Loop Physicians Group, Suite 100, 2600 S. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60616, 312.492.0025

Name: Lauren Castro
About: Lauren Castro is a nurse practitioner and researcher at the Breathe Chicago Center© and in the Population Health Science Program at UI Health. Ms. Castro provides oversight and clinical consultation for several research protocols that aim to improve the health for those in our surrounding communities, while giving special attention to improving health inequities at all levels.
Location: Miles Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.413.4244

Name: Wadih Chacra
About: Dr. Wadih Chacra's clinical practice focuses on the care and guidance of patients with liver disease. He is involved in the pre-transplant evaluations and the post-transplant care. His clinical interests include hepatitis B and renal failure in liver disease.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7598

Name: Aaron Chaise
About: Dr. Aaron Chaise practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Chaise focuses on primary care and chronic disease management.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Lawrence Chan
About: Dr. Lawrence Chan practices in the Department of Dermatology at UI Health. Dr. Chan cares for patients with atopic dermatitis and blistering skin diseases. His clinical interests also include immunodermatology and autoimmune bullous diseases. He is expert in treating psoriasis, acne, tinea pedis, and pemphigus. Dr. Chan has over 30 years of experience. He is also honored with the Dr Orville J. Stone Professorship in Dermatology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8666

Name: R. V. Paul Chan
About: Dr. R. V. Paul Chan is director of the Pediatric Retina and Retinopathy of Prematurity Service at UI Health and professor of ophthalmology at the University of Illinois College of Medicine. Dr. Chan is board certified in ophthalmology and a fellow of the American College of Surgeons. His clinical focus is in medical and surgical vitreoretinal disease, with a particular interest in the diagnosis and management of pediatric retinal disease and retinopathy of prematurity (ROP). His research interests include investigations into new methods to diagnose and manage pediatric retinal disease and ROP; identification of risk factors and genetic markers for pediatric retinal disease; telemedicine; computer-facilitated image analysis, and tele-education to improve the quality of care for pediatric retinal conditions and ROP. Dr. Chan is also the John H. Panton, MD Professor of Ophthalmology.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Huan Chang
About: Dr. Hung Chang practices in the Division of Rheumatology at UI Health. Dr. Chang specializes in treating lupus and scleroderma. Dr. Chang believes healthcare is most successful when the patient and physician work together as a team, and she is interested in providing care that integrates into a patient's lifestyle and worldview - without sacrificing quality of care.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569

Name: Fady Charbel
About: Dr. Fady Charbel is head of the Department of Neurosurgery at UI Health. Dr. Charbel is an internationally recognized clinical expert, researcher, and educator in the areas of stroke; brain aneurysm and cerebrovascular diseases; cerebral blood flow metabolism; and complex cerebral tumors.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Taylor Charest
About: Dr. Taylor Charest practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Charest manages routine healthcare, including cancer screenings; chronic disease management (high blood pressure, diabetes); prenatal care; and reproductive health care (birth control, pap smears). She sees patients of all ages, and also treats patients seeking medical care for addiction.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL  60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Michael Charles
About: Dr. Michael Charles is an internal medicine physician and pediatrician at UI Health. Dr. Charles specializes in primary care, the management of complex health issues, and preventive healthcare for all ages. His medical interests include chronic disease management, global health, and medical education.
Location: South Loop Physicians Group, Suite 100, 2600 S. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60616, 312.492.0025

Name: Elizabeth Charney
About: Dr. Elizabeth Charney is the Director of the Child Psychiatry Consult/Liaison Service at UI Health. She is Associate Medical Director of the DCFS supported Inpatient Adolescent Psychiatry Unit which specializes in comprehensive treatment of traumatized youth. She is currently hospital-based and does not see outpatient clients.
Location: Institute for Juvenile Research/Colbeth Clinic, 1747 W. Roosevelt Road, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7723

Name: Felix Chau
About: Dr. Chau joined the Retina Service as an attending in 2010. His practice focuses on retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) and medical-surgical retina. He is a co-investigator on a number of clinical trials to develop new treatments for diabetic retinopathy and age-related macular degeneration (AMD).
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Vivek Chaudhry
About: Dr. Vivek Chaudhry is a board-certified surgeon specializing in general surgery, and colon and rectal surgery. Dr. Chaudhry's areas of interest includes treating colon and rectal cancer, anal dysplasia and cancer, condyloma, and anal fistula. He is an expert in performing laparoscopic colorectal surgery, high resolution anoscopy, colonoscopy, and anorectal ultrasound.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Stephanie Chen
About: Dr. Stephanie Chen practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Chen has special interests in complex contraception, complex gynecologic conditions, pregnancy, and postpartum care. She speaks Mandarin and takes pride in providing culturally competent care to the Chinese immigrant community.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Euna Chi
About: Dr. Euna Chi specializes in internal medicine. Her areas of interest include preventative medicine, women's health, and chronic disease management.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627

Name: Samuel Chmell
About: Dr. Samuel J. Chmell practices in the Department of Orthopaedics at UI Health. Dr. Chmell specializes in orthopaedic surgery.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1300

Name: Rani Chovatiya
About: Dr. Rani Chovatiya practices in the Department of Anesthesiology at UI Health. Dr. Chovatiya specializes in pain management, and she focuses on implementing several therapeutic approaches to managing pain, including medication management, physical rehabilitation, behavioral therapies, and interventional pain treatments. Dr. Chovatiya believes that chronic pain is a complex phenomenon that can take severe physical and emotional tolls on patients and significantly impair their quality of life. As a pain specialist, her goal is to approach the problem from all aspects and effectively treat the human body, mind, and spirit. She also is interested in neuromodulation and alternative treatments for other chronic pain disorders.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Mark Chwajol
About: Dr. Mark Chwajol practices in the Department of Neurosurgery at UI Health. Dr. Chwajol uses cutting-edge technology and a variety of surgical approaches to treat patients of all age groups with conditions of the brain and spine, including brain aneurysms, brain tumors, spinal tumors, back pain, stenosis, and degenerative disease of the spine. In addition to performing surgeries of the brain and spine, Dr. Chwajol is trained in the management of neurological conditions, including stroke, aneurysms, and arteriovenous malformations.
Specialty: Stenosis and Degenerative Disease of the Spine
Location: Neuropsychiatry & Psycological Services, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.4842

Name: Kate Ciancio
About: Kate Ciancio is the coordinator of Inpatient Occupational Therapy Services at UI Health. Ms. Ciancio's clinical experience includes acute care, acute rehabilitation, chronic disease self-management, early mobility, and critical care mobility. She also holds a teaching appointment in the Department of Occupational Therapy at UIC.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Matthew Clinger
About: Matthew Clinger is an occupational therapist that works with clients in both the inpatient and outpatient settings at UI Health. Matthew provides occupational therapy services to clients along the care continuum experiencing orthopedic, neurological, and complex medical conditions.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3701

Name: Mimis Cohen
About: Dr. Mimis Cohen is a Professor and the chief of the Division of Plastic, Reconstructive, and Cosmetic Surgery at UI Health, where he also serves as the director of the Craniofacial Center. Dr. Cohen is world-renowned for his work in the field of cleft lip and palate surgery.  He has published extensively on the topic and lectured throughout the world.  Dr. Cohen received his medical degree from the University of Athens, Greece before coming to UI Health for special training in General and Plastic Surgery.  He is board certified in Plastic Surgery.  As a University Professor with extensive clinical and teaching experience, Dr. Cohen is in the forefront of the specialty.  He brings to his patients the knowledge and experience of the state of the art procedures, as well as the emerging new techniques in reconstructive and cosmetic surgery.  Dr. Cohen is a member and former president of several professional organizations.  He has published more than 160 articles in peer-reviewed journals and has edited several textbooks.  He has been recognized as one of the best doctors in Chicago for the last 25 years.
Specialty: Cleft lip and palate and pediatric plastic surgery
Cosmetic surgery and body contouring after weight loss
Aesthetic surgery of the face, breast, body, and extremities
Facial rejuvenation with Botox® and fillers
Liposuction of the body and extremities
Body contouring after weight loss surgery
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300, Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Geisel Collazo
About: Dr. Geisel Collazo is a general pediatrician at Mile Square, an Attending Physician at Children's Hospital University of Illinois (CHUI) Outpatient Center and Pediatric Consultant for Craniofacial Center. Dr. Collazo graduated from Medical School at Universidad Central de Venezuela and completed her Pediatrics training at University of Illinois in Chicago. She specializes in primary healthcare of children all ages, from newborn to 18 years old. Her clinical interests include skull deformities, pediatric asthma and obesity. Dr. Collazo is board-certified in Pediatrics. In addition to English, she speaks fluent Spanish.
Location: Mile Square Health Center, Back of the Yards, 4630 S. Bishop St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Edwin Cook
About: Dr. Edwin Cook is the Director of Center for Neurodevelopmental Disorders and the Director of Division of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry at UI Health. Dr. Cook is board certified in both Psychiatry and Neurology. He specializes in treating ADHD, Autism, Bipolar Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder and Stuttering. Dr. Cook is also the Earl M. Bane Professor.
Location: Institute for Juvenile Research/Colbeth Clinic, 1747 W. Roosevelt Road, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7723

Name: Julia Corcoran
About: Dr. Julia Corcoran practices in the Division of Plastic, Reconstructive, and Cosmetic Surgery at UI Health, where she focuses on the reconstructive needs of young adults up to age 25. As part of the Cleft Team at the Craniofacial Center, Dr. Corcoran cares for patients and families on their journeys with cleft lip and palate, from birth to facial maturity in the early 20s. She also works in the realm of chest reconstruction, including asymmetric breasts, oversized breasts (female macromastia and male gynecomastia), and Top surgery. Dr. Corcoran provides a full range of pediatric reconstructive services, including care for birth marks, vascular lesions, prominent ears, trauma, burns, and scarring. She is a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons and the American Academy of Pediatrics, a board member of the Illinois Society of Plastic Surgery, and does committee work for the American Council of Academic Plastic Surgeons.
Location: Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Miriam Correa
About: Miriam Correa is an advance practice registered nurse in Palliative Care Services at UI Health. Ms. Correa provides symptom management, assistance with goals-of-care discussions, and advance care planning to patients with life-limiting illnesses. She also provides psychosocial support and assists patients with conflicts as they navigate treatment options. Ms. Correa is committed to helping patients understand the information they receive from providers and how it affects their lives, and she strives to ensure the entire treatment team is aware of patients' priorities.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Edmundo Cortez
About: Dr. Edmundo P. Cortez is the Chief of the Division of Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at UI Health. As part of the multidisciplinary Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU) at UI Health, Dr. Cortez provides specialized care to patients with acute and chronic illnesses, and those who have undergone major surgical procedures.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 5th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.1197

Name: Maria Cortina
About: Dr. M. Soledad Cortina is the director of the Comprehensive Ophthalmology Faculty Practice, the General Eye Clinic, and the Keratoprosthesis Artificial Cornea Program at UI Health. Dr. Cortina has clinical interests in corneal transplantation, refractive surgery, cataracts, and anterior segment disease.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Karen Cotler
About: Dr. Karen Cotler is a family nurse practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center-Humboldt Park location. Dr. Cotler provides primary care healthcare services to patients of all ages, from infants to the aging population. Her clinical interests include improving health outcomes of sexual- and gender-minority individuals, and she is passionate about health promotion and disease prevention across the lifespan.
