In addition to her clinical practice, Dr. Cotler is an instructor educating the next generation of family nurse practitioners at UIC College of Nursing.
Specialty: Primary Care for Sexual and Gender Minority People
Care of the Aging population/Alzheimer and Dementia Care
Location: Mile Square Health Center-Humboldt Park, 3240 W. Division St., Chicago, IL 60615, 312.996.0067

Name: Caitlin Couture
About: Caitlin Couture is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Ms. Couture practices at the Mile Square Health Center-Back of the Yards location, and she provides prenatal, postpartum, and gynecologic care, and she also manages women during childbirth. She has a special interest in integrative and holistic health and clinical homeopathy.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000, Mile Square Health Center–Back of the Yards, 4630 S. Bishop St., Chicago, IL 60609, 312.996.2000

Name: Simone Crivellaro
About: Dr. Simone Crivellaro practices in the Department of Urology at UI Health. Dr. Crivellaro specializes in robotic, minimally invasive procedures to treat urologic conditions, including prostate cancer, kidney cancer, and kidney congenital obstruction. He also treats benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and kidney stones in an outpatient setting via endoscopic techniques, including laser enucleation of the prostate and ureteroscopy. UI Health is a worldwide leader in robotic surgery and one of the first institutions worldwide to offer single-incision robotic urological procedures, allowing Dr. Crivellaro to deliver the excellent clinical outcomes with a faster recovery. He is an expert in uro-oncology and reconstructive urology via laparoscopic and robotic procedures, and he has published multiple scholarly articles on minimally invasive surgery, reconstructive urology, and related areas.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 2nd Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2779

Name: Maggie Crowley
About: Dr. Maggie Crowley is a licensed clinical psychologist in the Department of Psychiatry at UI Health. Dr. Crowley works with adults facing various challenges, including anxiety, depression, bereavement, relationship issues, and difficult transitions. She uses an integrative approach to therapy, working closely with her clients to not only address current challenges and concerns but also to utilize one's values, strengths, and resources. Dr. Crowley enjoys working with people individually and in groups, and she hopes people leave her office feeling heard, understood, and valued.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Katya Cruz Madrid
About: Dr. Cruz Madrid is an Associate Professor of Medicine in the Division of Academic Internal Medicine and Geriatrics. Her clinical practice focuses in the care of elderly patients, diagnosis and treatment of dementia, frailty, falls, mood disorders, incontinence, hearing problems and other chronic diseases. She finds also important a pro-active communication with patient and family, as well as education of different health issues are related with better adherence, decrease hospital admissions, reduction of number of medications and adverse outcomes.
Location: South Loop Physicians Group, Suite 100, 2600 S. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60616, 312.492.0025

Name: Nexhip Cuca
About: Nexhip Cuca is an occupational therapist in the Concussion Management Program at UI Health. Nexhip specializes in the evaluation and treatment of patients with a wide array of neurological conditions, including but not limited to stroke, Parkinson's disease, multiple sclerosis, spinal cord injury, traumatic brain injury, and post-concussion syndrome.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Kimberlee Curnyn
About: Dr. Kimberlee M. Curnyn is a board-certified ophthalmologist at UI Health. Dr. Curnyn specializes in treating cataract, glaucoma and, is an expert in performing cataract surgery, eye muscle surgery, Lasik, retractive laser, and strabismus surgeries.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Raymond Curry
About: Dr. Raymond Curry is the senior associate dean for educational affairs for the University of Illinois College of Medicine. Dr. Curry is a physician and medical educator with over 30 years of professional experience. His scholarly and educational interests include physician/patient communication; curriculum development; and promoting access to health-professions education for students under-represented in medicine, including students with disabilities. He is a Fellow of the American College of Physicians and has been listed annually in Best Doctors in America since 1999.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Andrea Cyr
About: Dr. Andrea Cyr practices in the Department of Orthopaedics at UI Health. Dr. Cyr is a sports medicine physician with a background in physical medicine and rehabilitation, and she provides patients leading-edge, nonoperative orthopaedic care for a variety of musculoskeletal issues, including neck and back pain, various joint pain, and chronic injuries such as tendinopathies or overuse injury. An accomplished cyclist, she brings her dedication and discipline of a professional athlete into every patient encounter. She values fitness as medicine and will work with her patients to get them back on track toward their health and better quality of life through meaningful activity or sport. Dr. Cyr also performs diagnostic musculoskeletal ultrasound, ultrasound-guided injections, and EMG nerve conduction studies. In addition, she is published in ultrasound diagnostics, cycling medicine, and is involved in ongoing research on female athletes. Her holistic and disciplined patient-centered approach make her an integral part of the clinical team available for patient care.
Specialty: Platelet Rich Plasma Regenerative Injection Technique
Location: Sports Medicine and Human Performance Center, Suite 102, 839 W. Roosevelt Rd., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.4404

Name: Kimberly Czech
About: Dr. Kimberly Czech is experienced in a broad range of Pediatric Nephrology services, including hypertension, kidney stones, recurrent urinary tract infections, renal anomalies, chronic kidney failure management, dialysis, cystic kidney disease, and kidney transplant. Her expertise is in Pediatric Nephrotic Syndrome and FSGS.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Dorota Czernecki
About: Dorota Czernecki is a board-certified nurse practitioner in the Department of Neurosurgery at UI Health. Ms. Czernecki's clinical focus is on providing care to patients hospitalized for a number of neurosurgical conditions, including degenerative spine diseases, spinal stenosis, spinal deformities, spine tumors, brain tumors, brain aneurysms, and hemorrhagic and ischemic strokes. She also is assistant director of Advanced Practice Providers for the Neurosurgery Department.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Ahmad Daher
About: Dr. Ahmad Daher practices in the Department of Neurology & Rehabilitation at UI Health. A neuro-oncologist, Dr. Daher helps manage the care of patients with various primary brain tumors, including gliomas (GBM, astrocytoma, oligodendroglioma); meningioma; CNS lymphoma; pilocytic astrocytoma; ganglioglioma; hemangioblastoma; pituitary tumors; and pineal tumors, among others. He also helps diagnose and treat leptomeningeal carcinomatosis; neurological complications of cancer; and cancer therapy, including radiation, chemotherapy, and immunotherapy. Dr. Daher clinical interests include finding unique targeted therapies and/or immunotherapy, and/or clinical trial options, for all patients. His research interests are in understanding the molecular makeup of brain tumors and how it impacts the disease's behavior and treatment, in addition to performing comprehensive drug screening and analysis on brain tumor samples in the lab setting to identify new therapies.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Oana Danciu
About: Dr. Danciu is practices in the Division of Hematology/Oncology at UI Health. After receiving her Medical Degree at Carol Davila University in Bucharest, Romania, she completed a postdoctoral fellowship in cancer biology at Northwestern University in Chicago. Dr. Danciu specializes in the treatment of breast cancer patients. Her research interests include development of clinical trials using experimental therapeutics. Dr. Danciu is an active member of the American Society of Clinical Oncology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Dawood Darbar
About: Dr. Dawood Darbar is the Chief of the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Darbar is an experienced clinical electrophysiologist who has built a robust academic-clinical electrophysiology practice. His particular area of expertise relates to the assessment and management of patients with inherited heart rhythm disorders, including long QT syndrome and Brugada syndrome. Dr. Darbar provides state-of-the-art therapies, including atrial fibrillation ablation, to patients with arrhythmias. He also specializes in the genetics and ablation of arrhythmias, insertion of pacemakers and defibrillators, and cardiac rhythm monitoring. Dr. Darbar earned his medical degree (M.B.Ch.B.) from the University of Dundee in Dundee, Scotland. He completed his early medical training in the UK before embarking on a Clinical Pharmacology Fellowship at Vanderbilt University. Dr. Darbar completed residency training at the same institution and cardiology and electrophysiology fellowships at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota. He is board-certified in Internal Medicine, Clinical Pharmacology, Cardiology, and Clinical Electrophysiology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Jared Davis
About: Dr. Jared Davis practices in the Department of Neurology & Rehabilitation at UI Health. Dr. Davis specializes in neurocritical care, including the in-hospital care of critically injured neurology patients and patient in the Epilepsy Monitoring Unit. He also has a focus on the interpretation of encephalography (EEG).
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Sharrone Davis
About: Sharone Davis is an outpatient physical therapist in Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Ms. Davis specializes in orthopaedic therapy, manual therapy, postoperative rehabilitation, cardiopulmonary therapy, and wheelchair evaluations. She focuses on patient-centered treatment and is committed to helping patients attain their functional goals. Ms. Davis also is the coordinator of clinical education for the Physical Therapy Program, and she is proud of the strong student internship program that supports the teaching mission of the University of Illinois Hospital.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312-355-4394

Name: Myriam Davis
About: Myriam Davis assists in caring for patient who need or have had surgery. She provides preoperative and postoperative care and collaborates with physicians to assist in the patient's surgical needs.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Jose de la Cruz
About: Dr. Jose de la Cruz practices in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. Dr. de la Cruz specializes in refractive surgery (LASIK), advanced technology intraocular lens implantation, laser-assisted cataract and cornea surgery, and complex corneal transplant surgery. At the Illinois Eye & Ear Infirmary, Dr. de la Cruz developed the Artificial Cornea and Keratoprosthesis (KPro) Program, considered the top artificial cornea service in the Midwest. A trusted authority in the field, Dr. de la Cruz has co-authored several papers and book chapters comprising topics including keratoprosthesis surgery, refractive surgery in presbyopic age group, infections in refractive surgery, and outcomes of laser-assisted cataract surgery. He is certified in the use of the LenSx® Femtosecond Laser System for cataract surgery.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937), Millennium Park Eye Center, Suite 410, 30 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60602, 312.996.2020

Name: Brianna DeBiasi
About: Dr. Brianna DeBiasi practices in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Dr. DeBiasi enjoys working with patients with musculoskeletal, vestibular, and neurological impairments. She has an interest in pain science and its application to surgical and nonsurgical patients. Dr. DeBiasi's focus is to empower patients to achieve their rehabilitation goals and live their lives to the fullest.
Location: Outpatient Physical Therapy at Maxwell Street, 711 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.2626

Name: Kristen DeCarlo
About: Dr. Kristen DeCarlo practices in the Division of Endocrinology, Diabetes, and Metabolism at UI Health. Dr. DeCarlo specializes in treating older adults with endocrine disorders, and she focuses on bone health, diabetes, thyroid disorders, and obesity in the aging population. She has a special interest in medical education, including graduate-level curriculum development; teaching assessment and feedback; and as mentorship.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Carolyn Dickens
About: Carolyn Dickens is a board certified Nurse Practitioner who specializes in heart failure and cardiovascular disease. She is also adjunct faculty at the College of Nursing.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Laura DiGiovanni
About: Dr. Laura DiGiovanni is an expert in fetal diagnosis and in the management of pregnancies complicated by high-risk conditions. Dr. DiGiovanni enjoys all aspects of Maternal-Fetal Medicine (MFM) clinical care, and education of medical students, residents and fellows, and teaching ethics in obstetrics and gynecology. Dr. DiGiovanni is an Associate Professor of Obstetrics and Gynecology in the Division of Maternal-Fetal Medicine. She completed her medical degree at Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine, followed by a residency in OBGYN at the University of Illinois at Chicago. She completed a Maternal-Fetal Medicine fellowship at University of Chicago in 1990, and has been on faculty at Advocate Christ Hospital and the University of Chicago. From 2008–09, Dr. DiGiovanni completed a fellowship in Medical Ethics at the University of Chicago. Subsequently, she was appointed to the faculty at the MacLean Center for Clinical Medical Ethics.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Vassilios Dimitropoulos
About: Dr. Vassilios Dimitropoulos is a board-certified dermatologist at UI Health. Dr. Dimitropoulos specializes in skin cancer and is fellowship-trained in Mohs surgery as a treatment for skin cancer.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8666

Name: Tatiana Dixon
About: Dr. Tatiana K. Dixon works extensively with patients in the UI Health ENT Clinic, both in general Otolaryngology and Facial Plastic Surgery. She has done extensive research in and has published on various aspects of Facial Plastic Surgery. Dr. Dixon has received numerous awards and honors for her research and clinical work, and she has served on medical missions in Costa Rica and Guatemala. She joined UI Health in July 2013 as Assistant Professor of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

He is a leading expert on ocular surface reconstruction and has developed innovations in the surgical techniques for limbal stem cell transplantation. He regularly performs all types of corneal transplantation and cataract surgery with intraocular lens implant. Dr. Djalilian can speak English and Persian fluently.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Therese Doyle
About: Therese Doyle is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Specialty: Sexually Transmitted Disease - Diagnosis and Treatment
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Diane Drugas

About: Dr. Alison Duncombe is a physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. She has expertise in working with patients with musculoskeletal conditions, including TMJ, spinal disorders, and chronic pain. She also enjoys working with patients during and after treatment for breast cancer. She has a passion for helping patients not just improve function but to re-establish a sense of self. Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Yuval Eisenberg
About: Dr. Yuval Eisenberg strives to connect with his patients and provide top quality medical care. He believes strongly that a good patient/doctor relationship is the backbone for successful medical practice. His goal with each visit is to listen, inquire, and educate and to assist you with making important medical decisions. Although he practices General Endocrinology, Dr. Eisenberg has a special interest in pituitary and adrenal disorders. He looks forward to working with you and your primary providers in the course of your care.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Amir El Shami
About: As a physical medicine and rehabilitation and sports medicine specialist, Dr El Shami focuses on the diagnosis and non-operative management of orthopaedic and neurologic conditions. He evaluates and treats all musculoskeletal and sports related injuries, back pain, neck pain, work injuries, arthritis, and pain management including joint, trigger point, and prolotherapy injections. In addition, Dr. El Shami performs diagnostic musculoskeletal ultrasound or ultrasound-guided injections and EMG nerve conduction studies. He is dedicated to providing you with the most comprehensive, conscientious and innovative care available to help you improve your daily functioning and return you to the activities you enjoy.

Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500, Mile Square Health Center, Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Chawki Elzein
About: Dr. El-Zein is a pediatric cardiovascular surgeon whose work includes partnerships with The Heart Institute for Children, Hope Children's Hospital & Advocate Lutheran General Hospital.

Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: William Ennis
About: Dr. William Ennis is the chief of the Section of Wound Healing & Tissue Repair at UI Health. Dr. Ennis specializes in wound care, diabetic foot care, lower extremity wounds, pressure ulcers, apligraf therapy, and venous ulcers, and his current research interests include microcirculation, regenerative tissue mechanisms, and healing outcomes. Dr. Ennis serves as the President of the American College of Wound Healing and Tissue Repair, a nonprofit organization that brings wound care to the level of a formal medical specialty, and he founded the first wound healing and tissue repair fellowship in the United States. He is the Catherine and Francis Burzik Professor of Wound Healing and Tissue Repair in the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Specialty: Advanced Modality Treatments for Wound Care
Arterial Ulcers and Peripheral Vascular Disease
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Jennifer Ennis

Name: Sodabeh Etminan
About: Dr. Sodabeh Etminan is the dental director for Mile Square Health Center-South Shore. Dr. Etminan's clinical focus is on general dentistry and interdisciplinary care. Mile Square offers general dentistry care for the whole family, including extractions, crowns, and dentures. The clinic works closely with other UI Health providers to offer oral health services prior to transplant surgery and cancer treatment, in addition to co-treating dental needs that arise with other medical conditions.

Name: Aileen Eviota
About: Aileen Eviota works with populations across all medical settings including inpatient hospital, inpatient rehabilitation, and outpatient services. As a neurological specialist, she enjoys working with populations that have a neurologic involvement such as, stroke and brain injury. She is also an active participant in the stroke support group here at UI Health. Aileen Eviota teaches acute care management and stroke management in the UIC Doctor of Physical Therapy program.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Ste C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Suzanne Falck
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Erin Farah

Name: Marwah Farooqui
About: Dr. Marwah Farooqui practices in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. Dr. Farooqui is passionate about caring for patients with challenging diseases. In classical hematology, her clinical focus is sickle cell disease; within medical oncology, she specializes in genitourinary cancers and rare malignancies, including sarcoma. Dr. Farooqui has expertise in pain management and supportive care, which are often the most important issues for her patients and their families. She highly values a team approach to the patient-physician relationship and strives to help her patients understand their clinical diagnoses and treatment plan. Dr. Farooqui prides herself on holistic care. Her research focus includes expanding treatment options for sickle cell disease and increasing clinical trial options within her specialty. In addition to direct patient care and research, Dr. Farooqui also has a strong passion for medical education to help improve current gaps in healthcare.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Kaia Feggestad
About: Kaia Feggestad is a speech-language therapist in Otolaryngology at UI Health. Ms. Feggestad specializes in aural rehabilitation and speech-language therapy for patients who have hearing loss.
Location: Eye & Ear Infirmary, Suite B46, 1855 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6522

Name: Lawrence Feldman
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1 E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

She is supportive of vaginal birth after cesarean (VBAC) and birth plans.

Name: Christopher Fernandes

Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, Il 60612

Name: James Fields III
About: James Fields III is an occupational therapist in Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. He utilizes a variety of intervention methods for treatment, including custom splint fabrication; joint mobilization/manual therapy; ADL and IADL retraining; and exercise.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Evelyn Figueroa
About: Trained at UI Health, Dr. Figueroa practices traditional family medicine caring for patients of all ages. Dr. Figueroa has additional expertise in women's health and maternity care and has been a faculty member at UIC since 2005.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Michael Fischer
About: Dr. Michael Fischer is a nephrologist at UI Health. Dr. Fischer's specialties include treating acute and chronic kidney diseases, end-stage kidney diseases, fluid and electrolyte disorders, geriatric nephrology, and hypertension.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Jonah Fleisher
About: Dr. Jonah Fleisher practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Fleisher provides comprehensive family planning services and contraceptive counseling for patients with complex medical problems.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.8681

Name: William Flick
About: William G. Flick is a clinical professor of Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery at the UIC College of Dentistry. Dr. Flick currently is director of the Pre-Doctoral Oral Maxillofacial Surgery Clinic, and he has taught in both the pre-doctoral DMD Curriculum and the post-graduate Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery Residency. He is director for the UIC continuing education courses in dental sedation, local anesthesia for the dental hygienist, and the anesthesia assistant monitoring course, and he also serves as content expert for courses in pharmacology, local anesthesia and advanced pain control. Dr. Flick maintained a private practice in Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery in the Chicago suburbs for more than 30 years, in addition to his teaching activities, including appointments at Andrews Air Force Base in Maryland, Cook County Hospital, Loyola University Chicago, the Jesse Brown VA Medical Center, and UIC. Dr. Flick has been very active in organized dentistry, having served the profession as past-president of both the Illinois Society of Oral Maxillofacial Surgeons and the Illinois Dental Society of Anesthesiology.  He served on the Illinois State Board of Dentistry from 2011-18. He is a regular speaker at professional meetings, and he has authored numerous contributions to scientific literature with articles in the area of dental anesthesia/sedation and the public health implications on the removal of impacted third molars.
Location: College of Dentistry, Room 110, 801 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7460

Name: Jamie Forbes
About: Jamie Forbes has experience working with a broad range of upper extremity injuries resulting from trauma as well as repetitive motion disorders, chronic, neurological, and congenital conditions.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Catherine Ford
About: Dr. Catherine Ford practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Ford provides obstetrical care for low- and moderate-risk pregnancies. She also provides gynecological care including contraception, the management of complex gynecological conditions, and surgery for benign gynecological conditions. Dr. Ford has a strong interest in global women's health, and she has ongoing research focused on the prevention of mother-to-child transmission of HIV and women's empowerment in Zambia.
Specialty: Gynecological surgery for complex medical conditions
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Dustin Fraidenburg
About: Dr. Dustin R. Fraidenburg practices in the Division of Pulmonary and Critical Care at UI Health. Dr. Fraidenburg treats a wide range of respiratory disease both in the hospital and outpatient settings. He has clinical expertise is in the areas of pulmonary hypertension and advanced lung diseases.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3300

Name: Arthur Frank
About: Dr. Arthur Frank is a pediatric specialist at UI Health. Dr. Frank is an expert in treating pediatric infectious diseases. He has been in practice for 45 years.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Leon Frazin
About: Dr. Leon Frazin practices in the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Frazin specializes in non-invasive cardiology and echocardiography.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: John Frederiksen
About: Dr. John Frederiksen practices in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Frederiksen specializes in the diagnosis and subclassification of malignant and non-malignant disorders of the hematolymphoid organs (lymph nodes, spleen, blood, and bone marrow). This is achieved through a combination of microscopic examination of fixed specimens (blood/aspirate smears or tissue sections); immunophenotyping by immunohistochemistry or flow cytometry; cytogenetic analysis (metaphase karyotyping and/or fluorescence in situ hybridization techniques); and molecular genetic testing. Dr. Frederiksen's clinical interests also include the optimal utilization of clinical tests, such as flow cytometry.
Location: Department of Pathology, Suite 130, 840 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7312

Name: Po Ling Fung
About: Po Ling Fung is a Family Nurse Practitioner at Mile Square Health Center. She focuses on serving the underserved in a primary care setting for all ages. Her clinical interests include preventive health and diabetes.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Ron Gaba
About: Dr. Ron C. Gaba practices in the Division of Interventional Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Gaba is active in clinical service and patient care; trainee education; and clinical and translational research. His federally funded research interests include interventional oncology — including transarterial chemoembolization; drug delivery; animal models of disease; and precision medicine and genomics — and portal hypertension, including transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunts (TIPS) and variceal therapy with embolization or obliteration. Dr. Gaba is a professor at the University of Illinois College of Medicine, where he also is the division head of Interventional Radiology, vice head for research in Radiology, and assistant dean for Joint Degree Programs & Student Research.
Specialty: Radiofrequency ablation, microwave ablation, cryoablation (liver, kidney, lung, bone)
Celiac plexus block and other nerve blocks
Peripheral vascular occlusive disease: endovascular treatment
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Room 2483, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3737

Name: VK Gadi
About: Dr. VK Gadi is a physician and researcher in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. As a medical oncologist, Dr. Gadi is focused on providing expert care to eliminate breast cancer of all stages with a team approach – the patient, family, doctor, nurses, and other providers are all working together with one voice. He practices "precision medicine" by delivering the right drug to the right patient with the fewest side effects possible. As a researcher, Dr. Gadi develops and conducts clinical trials of new medicines, diagnostic tools, and supportive care to improve outcomes for patients with breast and other types of cancers, and his laboratory has made critical discoveries in cancer biology, immunology, and diagnostics.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625, 55th & Pulaski Health Collaborative, 5525 S. Pulaski Rd., Chicago, IL 60629, 312.355.1625

Name: Sujata Gaitonde
About: Dr. Sujata Gaitonde is a transplant immunologist at UI Health. Dr. Gaitonde provides comprehensive and patient-individualized immunologic consultation for kidney transplant and stem cell transplant patients. As director of the Transplant Laboratory, she has made significant contributions to the internal kidney transplant paired donation program. Dr. Gaitonde also is a hematopathologist and plays an important role in hematology-related diagnostics.
Location: Department of Pathology, Suite 130, 840 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.4206

Name: William Galanter
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Carlos Galvez
About: Dr. Carlos Galvez practices in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. Dr. Galvez is a malignant hematologist who specializes in the treatment of blood cancers, with a focus on lymphoma, cellular therapy, including CAR T-cell therapy, and clinical trials. He continuously keeps up with the latest cancer literature and serves as an advocate for patients to ensure they can receive the most up-to-date medical care. During clinic visits, all potential management options are carefully and thoroughly discussed with each patient and all questions are answered. Dr. Galvez firmly believes that high-level medical care is a fundamental human right, and he enjoys working with patients from all nationalities and socioeconomic backgrounds. It is his true privilege to be able to establish long-term relationships with patients and work together with the shared goal of improving both their health and quality of life.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1 E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Shriya Gandhi

Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

About: Dr. Antonio Gangemi has a broad experience in minimally invasive and robotic general and bariatric surgery with special focus on foregut surgery, hernia repair and cholecystectomy as well as sleeve gastrectomy, gastric bypass and lap-band. Dr. Gangemi performs the majority of surgical procedures either robotically or laparoscopically using and Single Incision Laparoscopic Surgery (SILS).
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Amitha Ganti
About: Dr. Amitha Ganti practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Ganti provides general gynecologic care for patients of all ages, and she has a special interest in caring for children and teenagers. She is trained to provide both medical and surgical treatment of gynecologic condition, including minimally invasive therapies. Dr. Ganti also provides general prenatal care and performs deliveries.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Gerald Gantt Jr.
About: Dr. Gerald Gantt Jr. is a surgeon in the Division of Colon & Rectal Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Gantt specializes in the treatment of colon and rectal cancer, inflammatory bowel disease, anorectal disorders, and diverticulitis. Dr. Gantt has numerous publications in peer-reviewed journals and has presented his work at national meetings. His research interests include colorectal cancer genomics, innovative surgical techniques, and health disparities.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2061

Name: Belsy Garcia Manrique
About: Dr. Belsy Garcia Manrique practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Garcia Manrique treats patients of all ages , and she has a special interest in immigrant and reproductive health. She enjoys doing in-office procedures and keeping patients healthy with preventative healthcare.
Location: Pilsen Family Health Center Lower West, 1713 S. Ashland Ave., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.413.4179

Name: Olga Garcia-Bedoya
About: Dr. Olga Garcia is an internal medicine specialist at UI Health. Dr. Garcia is an expert in caring for people with chronic illness, diabetes, and hypertension. Her interests also include preventive medicine and women's health. Dr. Garcia can also speak Spanish fluently.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Daniel Garvey
About: Dr. Daniel Garvey evaluates and treats a wide variety of urologic diseases in men and women. The most common problems that are brought to his clinic are hematuria (blood in the urine), urinary tract infections, inflammatory conditions of the urinary tract (such as interstitial cystitis), kidney stones, prostate related problems (such as benign prostatic hypertrophy), voiding disorders (such as urinary incontinence), and erectile dysfunction. He evaluates a comprehensive spectrum of treatment alternatives including education, physical therapy, medical therapy, and surgical therapy with attention to minimally-invasive treatment options. He also performs male sterilization (specifically vasectomy).
Location: Specialty Care Building, 2nd Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2779

Name: Margeaux Gastala
About: Margeaux Gastala is a Family Nurse Practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center Primary & Immediate Care location. Margeaux specializes in family medicine and primary care services. She strives to provide a well-rounded approach to patient care, emphasizing the importance of preventative health for all ages. Margeaux believes it is extremely important for patients to be engaged in their healthcare decisions, and she works with them to achieve their best selves.
Location: Mile Square Health Center Primary & Immediate Care, 839 W. 79th St., Chicago, IL 60620, 312.996.2000

Name: Nicole Gastala
About: Dr. Nicole Gastala practices in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Gastala focuses on preventative healthcare and chronic disease management for pediatric, adolescent, adult, and OB/GYN patients. She has an interest in addiction medicine, including medication-assisted treatment for opioid-use disorder.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Katie Gebhardt
About: Katie Gebhardt is a pediatric nurse practitioner in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Ms. Gebhardt provides primary care for children from birth through late adolescence. She enjoys supporting families through all aspects of care for their children, with particular interests in preventative medicine, childhood development, nutrition, and breastfeeding support.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Jessica George
About: Dr. Jessica George practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. George provides routine obstetrical care, preventive gynecological screening, surgical procedures for benign gynecology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Benoy George
About: Dr. Benoy George works in the Community Reintegration Program, an intensive outpatient day program, at UI Health. Dr. George also provides outpatient psychiatric care for mental health evaluation and medication management. He is interested in mood and anxiety disorders as well as individual and group psychotherapy. His research interests include the effect of patient engagement on continuity of psychiatric care.
Location: Neuropsychiatric Institute, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6945

Name: Philip Giampietro
About: Dr. Philip Giampietro is a clinical geneticist in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. As part of a team of genetic counselors, Dr. Giampietro provides clinical genetics consults for patients with concerns regarding inherited disorders, including disorders affecting growth; autism; cognitive disability; birth defects; craniofacial disorders; neurocutaneous disorders; auditory and visual disorders; inherited renal and cardiac disorders; and disorders of connective tissue. The genetics team uses state of the art genomic technology to assist with obtaining diagnoses for our patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Pier Giulianotti
About: Dr. Pier Cristoforo Giulianotti is the Chief of General, Minimally Invasive, and Robotic Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Giulianotti is a pioneer and world-renowned surgeon in the field of robotic surgery. He was the first surgeon in the world to perform a significant series of robotic procedures to treat complex diseases and cancers, and he has performed thousands of robot-assisted surgeries. He is the Lloyd Nyhus Chair in General, Minimally Invasive, and Robotic Surgery at the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Gelila Goba
About: Dr. Gelila Goba practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Goba's clinical interests include obstetric care for moderate-risk pregnancies, vaginal birth after cesarean (VBAC), operative vaginal delivery, abnormal pap smear, colposcopy, loop electrosurgical excision procedure (LEEP), minimally invasive gynecologic surgery, fibroids, menopause, complex gynecologic conditions, and complex contraception. Dr. Goba has a significant commitment to women's health both in Chicago and across the globe. She is the director of the Global Women's Health Fellowship at the University of Illinois College of Medicine and a core faculty of the Global Medicine (GMED) Program. She also is creator of The Mela Project, a medical residency peering program that seeks to establish an "OB/GYN Center of Excellence" at Mekelle University in Ethiopia, with expansion into South Sudan, Uganda, and Somaliland. Prior to residency, Dr. Goba was the Ethiopia Country Director for EngenderHealth, a global women's health organization, where she obtained grant and private-donor funds to support maternal health and HIV/AIDS efforts in Ethiopia. She completed both a fellowship in Population & Leadership and a master's degree in Public Health at the University of Washington.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Priyanka Gokhale
About: Dr. Priyanka Gokhale practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Gokhale provides expert obstetrical care for low- and moderate-risk pregnancies. She also specializes in gynecologic care, including contraception, management of abnormal uterine bleeding, and menopause. Dr. Gokhale performs benign gynecological surgery, including minimally invasive surgery, in addition to in-office gynecological procedures.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Benjamin Goldberg
About: Dr. Benjamin Goldberg is a board certified Orthopedic surgeon. Dr. Goldberg specializes in diagnosis and treatment of shoulder, elbow and knee disorders, as well as providing general orthopedics and fracture care. From treating rotator cuff tears to elbow joint replacement, he believes in working with patients to find the most effective path to recovery. Click here for more information on Dr. Goldberg.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1300

Name: Quinn Golinske
About: Quinn Golinske is a physician assistant in the Department of Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery at UI Health. Ms. Golinske provides individualized care to patients with acute and chronic ear, nose, and throat problems. Her special interests include the treatment of head and neck cancer, ear disease, vestibular disorders, and working with the hearing impaired. She is a collaborating provider with the Chicago Public Schools Office of Student Health & Wellness, working directly with children who have hearing problems.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Christy Gomez
About: Christy Gomez is a board-certified nurse practitioner in the Department of Neurosurgery at UI Health. Working in collaboration with Dr. Konstantin Slavin, Ms. Gomez treats patients with movement disorders, facial pain, and brain tumors. Her other areas of interest include deep brain and spinal cord stimulation, and cancer pain.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Mark Gonzalez
About: Dr. Mark H. Gonzalez is a surgeon in the Department of Orthopaedics at UI Health. Dr. Gonzalez's orthopaedic specialties include hand surgery, peripheral nerve surgery, and hip and knee replacement. As a native Chicagoan, Dr. Gonzalez is honored to treat the communities in his hometown. He understands the concern patients have about orthopaedic injuries — if patients cannot walk or use their hand, they may not be able to do their jobs or provide for their families, and do the things they enjoy. Dr. Gonzalez is committed to restoring patients' function, so that they can return to doing what is most important to them and their families. Dr. Gonzalez is the Riad Barmada Professor and Chair in the Department of Orthopaedics at the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1300

Name: Frank González
About: Dr. Frank González practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. González specializes in reproductive endocrinology and infertility, and he is a global expert on polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), the most common cause of female infertility. He heads a National Institutes of Health-funded research program studying the effects of nutrient-induced inflammation in the development of ovarian dysfunction, insulin resistance, B-cell dysfunction, and atherogenesis in PCOS.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.2634

Name: Colin Goodman
About: Dr. Colin Goodman practices in the Division of Internal Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Goodman specializes in primary care, preventive healthcare, hospital medicine, and the management of chronic and complex health issues for adults. His medical interests include patient-centered care, health equity, and medical education.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3000

Name: Victor Gordeuk
About: Dr. Gordeuk specializes in treatment of patients with sickle cell disease and in conducting research to understand new ways to prevent complications of this condition. He has expertise in treating disorders of iron metabolism, including iron overload and iron deficiency. He also has a research and treatment interest in patients with congenital or unexplained polycythemia.
Location: University Of Illinois Hospital, 5th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Christina Gordon
About: Christina Gordon is a family nurse practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center-Cicero location. Ms. Gordon provides personalized care to patients of all ages, from infants to elderly adults. Her clinical background is in immediate and primary care, with special interests in adolescent health, hypertension, and diabetes. Ms. Gordon has a strong interest in prevention and promoting education with her patients. She believes everyone deserves quality healthcare, and she is passionate about treating patients in underserved communities.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Cicero, 4747 W. Cermak Road, Cicero, IL 60804, 312.996.2000

Name: Kiranmai Gorla
About: Dr. Gorla is a Pediatric Gastroenterologist that joined our team after completing a fellowship at Rainbow Babies & Children's Hospital in Cleveland, Ohio. She speaks four languages: English, Telugu, Hindi, & Kannada, and she is committed to providing exceptional care and working in collaboration to define the best treatment for each of her patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Emily Graber
About: Dr. Emily Graber practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Graber provides primary care clinic services for preventive and routine healthcare; acute and chronic illnesses and injuries; and has a special interest in full-spectrum reproductive and LGBTQ+ healthcare, including caring for all pregnancy outcomes and managing childbirth. She also provides care for individuals with severe illnesses while they are in the hospital, and she is passionate about caring for patients of all ages.
Location: Pilsen Family Health Center Lower West, 1713 S. Ashland Ave., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.413.1479

Name: Lauren Green
About: Dr. Lauren Green specializes in breast imaging, body imaging, and diagnostic imaging.

Name: Richard Green

Location: University Of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Bret Greenberg
About: Dr. Bret Greenberg is a physical therapist in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Dr. Greenberg's primary specialties include sports medicine, orthopaedics, manual therapy, foot and ankle care, and chronic-pain management. He is fellowship-trained in Orthopaedic Manual Therapy, and his background includes return-to-sport physical therapy for high school- and college-level athletes.
Location: Outpatient Physical Therapy at Maxwell Street, 711 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.2626

Name: Jamie Greenstein
About: Jamie Greenstein is a registered dietitian in the Bariatric Surgery Program at UI Health. Jamie is passionate about helping patients develop healthy habits for life. She believes nutrition is individualized, and she strives to help patients make sustainable yet effective changes.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312-996-5100

Name: Lauren Grieco
About: Lauren Grieco is an outpatient physical therapist in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Dr. Grieco treats patients with a variety of acute and chronic orthopaedic and postsurgical conditions. She has a passion for patient-centered care that includes specific manual therapy and exercise prescriptions based on reaching each individual's needs and goals.
Location: Outpatient Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Andrew Griffin
About: Dr. Andrew Griffin's academic concerns relate to the interplay of critical care medicine, economics, and medical ethics, increasingly important as health care undergoes its current evolution. He has been with the University of Illinois for the last decade and has served as the Chief of Pediatric cardiology at Loyola School of Medicine and Rush University. He is the past chairperson of Pediatrics at Advocate/Illinois Masonic, and was Director of the Heart Institute for Children at Hope Children's Hospital prior to his return to the University of Illinois.  The Pediatric Cardiology Program at UI Health covers all aspects of Pediatric Cardiology from care for the fetus with congenital heart issues through adults with Congenital Heart Disease.

Name: Sheila Harmon
About: As the Director of Provider Practice of the University of Illinois Mile Square Office of Community Engagement & Neighborhood Health Partnerships (OCEAN-HP) School Based Health Centers, Sheila Harmon oversees five of Mile Square's school-based health centers. She has been a Certified Diabetes Educator (CDE) since 2005. Her passion to educate and help people with diabetes prompted her to contribute to the Improving Diabetes Care and Outcomes on the South Side of Chicago project where she helps to raise awareness, reduce widely documented disparities about diabetes, and empower the South Side of Chicago to use knowledge, collaborators and resources to battle diabetes. She also serves as a Community Board Member of the Chicago Chapter of the American Diabetes Association and a media relations spokesperson for the American Association of Diabetes Educators (AADE). Harmon earned a bachelor's degree in Nursing from Chicago State University in 1988. She earned her master's degree from Governors State University in Nursing as a Clinical Nurse Specialist in 2007 and as a Family Nurse Practitioner in 2013.  She worked for the University of Chicago Medical Center from 1998 to 2008 as a Nurse Manager, Diabetes Research Nurse and Diabetes Educator. In 2009, she joined ACCESS Community Health Network and served as a Regional Operations Manager. She continues a partnership there as a Diabetes Consultant/Educator. Harmon has worked through the University of Illinois Hospital and Health Sciences System Mile Square OCEAN-HP since 2014.

He is an expert in using the most advanced diagnostic tests to make a personalized treatment plan for every patient. Dr. Heiferman provides a comprehensive, team-based approach to the care of patients with retinal disease, and he has an active interest in clinical trials and advanced surgical techniques. His interests also include the management of diabetic retinopathy; macular pucker and macular holes; central serous chorioretinopathy; and complications following cataract surgery.

Dr. Heiman listens carefully to patients to help them identify and achieve their health goals, and she believes in the importance of shared decision making. She enjoys helping patients sort through the pros and cons of medical decisions so that they — provider and patient — can decide on a course of action together.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627

Henley is a clinical pastoral educator with training in crisis intervention, psychotherapy to families, biblical counseling in mental health, and youth counseling. As an educator, she focuses on communication, ethics, and professionalism.

Name: Zulma Hernandez-Peraza
About: Dr. Hernández-Peraza's interest is to understand racial and ethnic differences in Multiple Sclerosis (MS) patients, such as presentation and treatment response, and establish a comprehensive MS clinic at UI Health.  She has also worked with the translational research team to create a bridge between current laboratory work being done and the bedside to bring better care to MS patients. Dr. Hernández-Peraza completed her doctorate in Medicine at Universidad Central del Caribe in her native Puerto Rico. She then attended Northwestern Memorial Hospital in Chicago for her neurology residency, where she also served as chief resident . She was honored by the National Multiple Sclerosis Society and The Ken & Ruth Davee Department of Neurology to be the first MS trained Fellow at Northwestern University. She also earned a Masters of Science in Clinical Investigation at Northwestern University.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

About: Dr. Jesica Herrick trained in Internal Medicine at UI Health and completed an Infectious Disease Fellowship at the National Institutes of Health. While at the NIH, she spent 2.5 years conducting research in the Laboratory of Parasitic Diseases, focusing on the host immune response to Loa loa infections as well as post-treatment responses to diethylcarbamazine and ivermectin therapy for loiasis. In addition, she worked on the development of new diagnostic tests for Loa loa infection. While at the NIH, she treated numerous patients with helminth infections, echinococcus, and neurocysticercosis. Dr. Herrick's current research interest is on the mechanisms of seizure development in neurocysticercosis.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337

Name: Christopher Holden
About: Dr. Holden is the Director of Addiction Psychiatry in the Department of Psychiatry. He works with patients in the outpatient mental health clinic as well as the hospital's inpatient medical, surgical, and psychiatric units. Dr. Holden believes in taking an integrated approach to the treatment of psychiatric conditions. Patients are most likely to recover from psychiatric and addictive disorders when they are addressed simultaneously, in particular with multiple complementary approaches, which can include medication and psychotherapy. He is published in the fields of addiction medicine and basic biomedical research.

Name: Kent Hoskins
About: Dr. Hoskins's clinical interests include counseling women who are at high risk for developing breast cancer due to a family history of the disease, and providing genetic testing services for women and their family members who are at risk for hereditary forms of breast cancer.  This is the primary activity of the Familial Breast Cancer Clinic. He is also interested in helping women develop an individualized plan for reducing their chance of getting breast cancer, and in providing comprehensive care for women who have been diagnosed with breast cancer.
Specialty: Breast Cancer Risk Assessment and Prevention
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Sheryl Hoyer
About: Dr. Sheryl Hoyer practices in the Department of Dermatology at UI Health. Dr. Hoyer specializes in general medical dermatology and cosmetic dermatology. Her interests include systemic medications for psoriasis and eczema; skin cancer prevention and treatment; actinic keratosis (AK) prevention and treatment, including good field treatment for AKs, such as traditional topical prescriptions, PDT, and chemical peels; isotretinoin for acne; and cosmetic filler/neurotoxin treatments.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8666

Name: Lewis Hsu
About: Dr. Hsu is a pediatric hematologist who is dedicated to finding cures for sickle cell disease, and to improving treatment and education until cures can be found. He joined UIC as director of the Sickle Cell Center and Professor of Pediatrics in July 2011. He led large pediatric sickle cell programs at Emory University, St. Christopher's Hospital for Children, and Children's National Medical Center. His clinical and translational research experience include multicenter landmark clinical trials of sickle cell stroke prevention and bone marrow transplantation, and contributing to understanding of inflammation and nitric oxide in mouse models of sickle cell disease. He has published over fifty peer-reviewed papers, mentored numerous physicians and graduate students, and contributed to four sickle cell websites devoted to patient education. He has also co-authored a book, now in its third edition, entitled "Hope and Destiny: The Patient and Parent's Guide to Sickle Cell Disease and Sickle Cell Trait." In addition to sickle cell disease, his clinical interests include thalassemia and adolescent transition. Among his research interests are sickle cell disease, health education, bone marrow transplantation, and inflammation and vasculopathy, and health disparities. In addition to English, Dr. Hsu speaks Spanish, Chinese (Mandarin), and a little Portuguese.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6195; 312.413.2589

Her research interests focus on developing novel therapeutic agents for breast cancer and addressing breast cancer disparities nationally and globally.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Khalil Ibrahim
About: Dr. Khalil Ibrahim practices in the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Ibrahim specializes in structural and coronary interventions, including transcatheter aortic valve replacement (TAVR); transcatheter mitral valve repair and replacement (MitraClip, TMVR); left atrial appendage closure; and interventions for congenital defects, such as patent foramen ovale (PFO) and atrial septal defects (ASD). In addition to structural heart interventions, he specializes in the diagnose and treatment of complex blockages in the coronary arteries using minimally invasive techniques. Dr. Ibrahim also has a clinical interest in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and its treatment, and the diagnosis and treatment of coronary artery disease in women.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

About: Dr. Ikuyo Imayama practices in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, Sleep, and Allergy at UI Health. Dr. Imayama's clinical interests include sleep apnea, obesity, and lung disease. Her goal is to assist each patient with finding treatment regimens that fit their needs.
Location: Sleep Sciences Center, Suite 104, 2242 W. Harrison St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7708

Name: Jessica Ittner
About: Jessica Ittner is an advanced practice registered nurse in the Childhood Cancer Survivorship Clinic at UI Health. Ms. Ittner provides long-term follow-up for pediatric and adult survivors of childhood cancers to screen for late effects from their treatments. She focuses on patient education and preventive strategies to help cancer survivors be as healthy as possible after their therapies. Ms. Ittner enjoys taking care of children and adults and guiding adolescents and young adults through the transition from pediatric to adult healthcare.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.6143

Focusing on what provides meaning and comfort to a patient or families, she uses active listening to aid people in processing their experiences with illness, and assists them in relief of spiritual and emotional suffering.

Name: Sandeep Jain
About: Dr. Sandeep Jain is Director of the Dry Eye & Ocular GVHD Clinic at UI Health Dr. Jain is an NIH-funded clinician scientist and is Board certified in Ophthalmology. His clinical focus is on the treatment of Dry Eye Diseases, with a particular interest in Ocular Graft-Vs.-Host Disease and Sjogren's Syndrome. Dr. Jain's clinical practice and basic laboratory research are highly integrated around this focus area, which has allowed him to discover new mechanisms of inflammation in dry eyes and develop novel therapies for treating dry eyes. Dr. Jain has been recognized among the Castle Connolly Top Doctors in Chicago and has received several awards, including UIC Inventor of the Year, UIC Faculty of the Year, American Academy of Ophthalmology's Achievement Award, and Research to Prevent Blindness Physician-Scientist Award. Dr. Jain has published 75 papers in scientific journals and made more than 100 presentations in Ophthalmological meetings. After receiving his medical degree, Dr. Jain joined the Wilmer Ophthalmological Institute at The Johns Hopkins University as a pre-residency fellow and completed his residency training in Ophthalmology at the Harkness Eye Institute at Columbia University, New York, followed by a subspecialty fellowship in Corneal Diseases at the Massachusetts Eye & Ear Infirmary/Harvard Medical School. He is the BA Field Professor of Ophthalmology at the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Eye and Ear Infirmary, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Shikha Jain
About: Dr. Shikha Jain practices in the Department of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. A medical oncologist, Dr. Jain specializes in colorectal cancer, neuroendocrine tumors, and hepatocellular carcinoma (liver cancer). She works with her patients as a team to treat the disease and helps them move through an often difficult process together with as little stress as possible. Dr. Jain believes in personalized and individualized care, and she feels the more knowledge a patient has about their own disease, the more informed a decision they are able to make. She is an assistant professor of Medicine and the director of Communication Strategies in Medicine in the University of Illinois College of Medicine, and the associate director of Oncology Communication & Digital Innovation at the University of Illinois Cancer Center.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Olamide Jarrett
About: Dr. Olamide Jarrett practices in the Division of Infectious Diseases at UI Health. Dr. Jarrett specializes in treating patients infected with HIV and other general infectious diseases.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337

Name: Brittney Jarvis
About: Brittney Jarvis is a registered dietitian and board-certified nutrition support clinician specializing in cancer services. She works collaboratively with the Hematology & Oncology teams to provide patient-centered nutrition-counseling services for patients and their families. Brittney aims to help patients improve their overall nutrition and enhance overall well-being and quality of life.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.0236

Name: Ian Jasenof
About: Dr. Ian Jasenof is an obstetrician and gynecologist at the Mile Square Health Center-Cicero location. Dr. Jasenof's care philosophy - "exceptional care, one patient at a time" - reflects his promise to provide the highest quality care and service in a positive and meaningful environment. His interests include general obstetrics & gynecology, contraception, abnormal bleeding, and STD screening and treatment. Dr. Jasenof is an advocate for patients, and he will assist patients in incorporating a holistic approach to their care with a team-based approach with behavioral health and primary care.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Cicero, 4747 W. Cermak Road, Chicago, IL 60804, 312.996.2000

Name: Alexander Javois
About: Dr. Alexander J. Javois practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. A pediatric cardiologist, Dr. Javois specializes in catheter-based treatment of congenital heart disease in both children and adults with birth defects of the heart, including atrial septal defect (ASD), ventricular septal defect (VSD), patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), and coarctation of the aorta. He also implants new valves in the pulmonic position and stents in pulmonary arteries and aorta.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.6605

Name: Aswathi Jayaram
About: Dr. Aswathi Jayaram practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Jayaram specializes in Maternal-Fetal Medicine, including pre-eclampsia, fetal anomalies, and other complications of pregnancy. Her research interests include translational, clinical, and basic science research focusing on pregnancy complications.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 West Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Kyle Jennette
About: Dr. Kyle Jennette practices in the Department of Psychiatry at UI Health. Dr. Jennette's clinical interests include neuropsychological assessment of adults with dementia; complex neurological/medical disorders; cerebrovascular disease; epilepsy; and traumatic brain injury (TBI). He also has a special interest in working with older adults with memory concerns and candidates for solid organ transplant surgery. Dr. Jennette's research is broadly focused on memory across the lifespan. He is particularly interested in the relationship between health behaviors (e.g., aerobic exercise, sedentary behavior, medical treatment adherence), brain connectivity, and cognitive functioning.
Location: Neuropsychiatric Institute, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6217

Name: Pim Jetanalin
About: Dr. Pim Jetanalin practices in the Division of Rheumatology at UI Health. Dr. Jetanalin treats all rheumatologic conditions, and her special areas of interest include gout and systemic lupus erythematosus. She believes in patient-centered care and shared decision making.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Kimberly Jezek-Tisch
About: Kim Jezek-Tisch is a Certified Nurse- Midwife at Mile Square Englewood. She has a special interest in care before, during, and after pregnancy, pelvic care, and contraceptive services.   She specializes in health promotion through education, family planning, and natural birth process.
Location: Mile Square Health Center, Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Masahito Jimbo
About: Dr. Masahito Jimbo practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI health. Dr. Jimbo's clinical interests include all aspects of wellness, prevention, and screening; hypertension; chronic kidney disease (CKD); and heart failure. He sees patients of all ages in both inpatient and outpatient settings, and his research interests include cancer screening, patient/physician communication, and shared decision-making. Dr. Jimbo has a bicultural background and is bilingual. He strives to actively listen to patient concerns and clearly explain what is going on and what should happen.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Ming Jin
About: Dr. Ming Jin is the director of Clinical Chemistry Laboratory at UI Health. Dr. Jin's clinical interests include biomarkers in the diagnosis of metabolic diseases and liver diseases, and better utilization of laboratory testing in patient care and safety.
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1625

Name: Stephanie Joe
About: Dr. Stephanie Joe is board-certified in Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery. Dr. Joe is an expert in addressing anatomic nasal problems to improve nasal breathing, including septal deviation, nasal deformities and nasal fractures. Her expertise is in the minimally invasive surgical treatment of nasal and sinus problems.
Specialty: Minimally Invasive Treatment of Sinus / Nasal Conditions
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Jobin John
About: Dr. Jobin K. John is surgeon in the Section of Wound Healing & Tissue Repair at UI Health. Dr. John specializes in wound care, tissue repair, regeneration of wound beds, and the development of scarring and ulcers. He works with patients to recover from the social, psychological, physiological hurdles that chronic wounds become. Dr. John collaborates with a team of nutritionists, therapists, social workers, and various medical and surgical specialists to develop management plans and reassess goals as progress and regress occurs. His team focuses on helping patients keep active, regain dignity, and facilitate their return to their lives and work.
Specialty: Development of Scarring and Ulcers of Various Etiologies
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Rachael Johnson
About: Rachael Johnson is a physician assistant in the Department of Surgery at UI Health. Rachael specializes in gender-affirming surgery and perioperative care. She is the primary clinical contact for patients from the time of their initial surgical inquiry through their postoperative course.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Suite 240, Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.6600

Name: Brooke Johnson
About: Dr. Brooke Johnson practices in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. A neurology-trained neuro-ophthalmologist, Dr. Johnson specializes in treating idiopathic intracranial hypertension, extraocular motility deficits, and visual field deficits. She also treats patients in the General Neurology Clinic, including headache management with Botox.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937), Millennium Park Eye Center, Suite 410, 30 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60602, 312.996.2020

Name: Emilie Johnson
About: Dr. Emilie Johnson practices in the Department of Urology at UI Health. Dr. Johnson specializes in pediatric urology, working with patients of all ages, from birth to young adults. She is certified by the American Board of Urology in both Urology and Pediatric Urology. She completed her medical and general urology training at University of Michigan and her fellowship in pediatric urology at Boston Children's Hospital. She also received her Master of Public Health in public health and health outcomes at the Harvard School of Public Health, giving her a more global picture of how both the whole family and the healthcare system affect patients with urologic issues.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6378

Name: Andrew Johnstone
About: Dr. Andrew Johnstone is a palliative care physician in Supportive Care Services at UI Health. As part of the Supportive Care team, Dr. Johnstone provides care of patients with serious illnesses, and his goal is to help control symptoms and support patients and their families as they navigate difficult decisions throughout the course of their disease. His focus is always on helping patients achieve the highest possible quality of life and making sure that the care patients receive is in line with their goals and values.
Specialty: Palliative Medicine in the Emergency Department
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.413.8728

Name: Min Joo
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3300

Name: Charlotte Joslin
About: Charlotte E. Joslin, OD, PhD, FAAO is Director of the Contact Lens Service, Professor of Ophthalmology, Department of Ophthalmology and Visual Sciences, College of Medicine and Departmental Affiliate, Epidemiology & Biostatistics, School of Public Health at University of Illinois at Chicago.  Dr. Joslin is a clinician-scientist and epidemiologist, and currently leads the Study of Latinos "SOL" Ojos (eyes), a National Eye Institute (NEI)-funded ancillary project to the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL), a comprehensive, longitudinal, multicenter cohort study that began in 2008 and is the largest longitudinal epidemiologic study of Latinos ever fielded.  SOL Ojos, a cohort study designed to assess the prevalence of chronic eye disease and its associations with risk factors across participants of diverse Hispanic/Latino backgrounds, will yield important insights into how best to preserve eye health in this rapidly growing and diverse segment of the U.S. population.  Dr. Joslin also works with Ali Djalilian, MD in the design and coordination of early clinical trials related to regenerative corneal translational research projects funded by the Department of Defense and NEI.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Gina Juliano
About: Gina Juliano is a pediatric nurse practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center-Humboldt Park location. Ms. Juliano provides well-child and acute care visits for pediatric patients of all ages - from newborns to young adults. She focuses on providing the most up-to-date, evidence-based care for her patients and believes in creating an environment where families and children are in partnership with their provider. Ms. Juliano is an International Board Certified Lactation Consultant and has helped many families achieve their breastfeeding goals. She is on faculty at the UIC College on Nursing, and she enjoys teaching families and students how to take care of themselves and anticipate the upcoming changes that occur during a child's growth and development.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Humboldt Park, 3240 W. Division St., Chicago, IL 60651, 312.413.7425

Name: Lyn Sue Kahng
About: Dr. Lyn Sue Kahng sees patients with a broad range of gastrointestinal conditions. Dr. Kahng has a particular interest in colon polyps, colorectal cancer screening and management, and training of future gastroenterologists.
Location: Back To Top

Name: Andre Kajdacsy Balla
About: Dr. Andre Kajdacsy-Balla practices in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Kajdacsy-Balla's clinical interests include the interpretation of microscope slides for the diagnosis of cancer, transplant rejection, and inflammation. His areas of diagnostic special interest are gynecologic cancer, prostate cancer, liver diseases, and transplant rejection, and his research interests include prostate cancer and new instruments to help making diagnosis in tissues.
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5639

Name: Mayank Kansal
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Christopher Kapp
About: Dr. Christopher Kapp practices in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, and Sleep at UI Health. Dr. Kapp's clinical expertise involves the diagnosis and management of pulmonary nodules, and minimally invasive procedures in the lungs, pleural space, and airways for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes. He treats patients both in inpatient and outpatient settings.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4244

Name: Joshua Katz
About: Dr. Joshua Katz practices in the Division of Endocrinology, Diabetes, and Metabolism at UI Health. Dr. Katz is an endocrine generalist, seeing all types of endocrine issues. He also specializes in gender-affirming care for transgender and gender diverse patients. Dr. Katz firmly believes in patient-centered care that emphasizes communication to build a clinical relationship based on trust and mutual understanding.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Lawrence Kaufman
About: Dr. Lawrence Kaufman is a Pediatric Ophthalmology and Adult Strabismus Service specialist at UI Health. Dr. Kaufman also treats double vision, eye muscle disorders. pediatric cataracts, and pediatric neruo-ophthalmology.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Tanjeev Kaur
About: Dr. Kaur specializes in elderly care, with an emphasis on geriatrics assessments. She is also board certified in hospice and palliative medicine. She is proficient in English, Hindi, and Punjabi. Her specialty of interest is geriatric medicine with associated conditions like dementia, depression, dizziness, urinary incontinence, and falls. She also helps patients and families make decisions for palliative or hospice care when transition needed.
Location: South Loop Physicians Group, Suite 100, 2600 S. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60616, 312.492.0025

Name: Laura Kavoliunaite
About: Laura Kavoliunaite is a nurse practitioner in the Sickle Cell Center at UI Health. Ms. Kavoliunaite specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of acute vaso-occlusive episodes - commonly called pain crises - in sickle cell patients.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite 516E, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.8666

Name: Yevgenya Kaydanova
About: Dr. Yevgenya Kaydanova is board-certified in neurology and in clinical neurophysiology. Dr. Kaydanova is known as a national leader in epilepsy management. She specializes in the treatment of patients with intractable epilepsy and developmental disabilities, as well as the management of seizures during pregnancy. She has been in practice for more than 20 years.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W.  Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Kathleen Kelley
About: Dr. Kathleen Kelley practices in the Department of Psychiatry at UI Health. Dr. Kelly specializes in child and adolescent psychiatry and is an expert in the treatment of somatoform disorders.
