She is director of the Pediatric Embedded Clinic and program director of the Child and Adolescent Fellowship Training Program (CAP). Dr. Kelley is a member of the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry and the American Psychological Association.
Location: Institute for Juvenile Research, Colbeth Clinic, 1747 W. Roosevelt Road, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7723

Name: Kristen Kenan
About: Dr. Kristen Kenan practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health, both at the Child & Youth Center and the Mile Square Health Center-Englewood location. Dr. Kenan provides general pediatric care to children of all ages, from birth through adolescence, and she has experience in asthma management, mental/behavioral health, autism, developmental delay, and obesity. Dr. Kenan's research interests include the effects of childhood trauma exposure through the H3: Healthy Minds, Healthy Children, Healthy Chicago Project, an integrated pediatric primary care/mental health model at Mile Square-Englewood. A Chicago native, Dr. Kenan has committed her career to serving the underserved areas of the city in a way that not only lets her patients truly feel cared for but also empowers them to care for themselves.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416, Mile Square Health Center–Englewood, 641 W. 63rd St., Chicago, Illinois 60621, 312.996.2000

Name: Megan Kennedy
About: Megan Kennedy is a physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Ms. Kennedy is the inpatient physical therapy coordinator, leading the team of physical therapists that serve patients admitted to the University of Illinois Hospital. She is a dedicated leader and compassionate healthcare provider, and she enjoys assisting patients in realizing their goals and achieving optimum function. Ms. Kennedy is a board-certified neurologic clinical specialist, and she has a special interest in vestibular rehabilitation.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Ste C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Asra Khan
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Irum Khan
About: Dr. Khan received her medical degree from the Aga Khan University in Karachi, Pakistan. She completed a residency in Internal Medicine at the University of Cincinnati in Ohio, before moving on to complete a fellowship in Hematology/Oncology at Northwestern University in Chicago. Dr. Khan specializes in the treatment of myeloproliferative neoplasms and other hematologic malignancies. During her fellowship Dr. Khan spent her time in the lab studying novel pathways to target in the treatment of Myeloproliferative Neoplasms. She intends to use her lab research experience to help develop early phase clinical trials in hematologic malignancies.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Yasaman Kianirad
About: Dr. Yasaman Kianirad practices in the Department of Neurology at UI Health. Dr. Kianirad's clinical interests include Parkinson's disease and atypical parkinsonian syndromes, tremors, dystonia, chorea, Huntington's disease, tic disorders, functional movement disorders, and gait disorders. She performs botulinum toxin injections for patients with dystonia, spasticity, and migraine headache. Dr. Kianirad also uses deep brain stimulation (DBS) to treat patients with these neurologic conditions, when applicable. She is the associate clerkship director for the medical students at UIC College of Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Yvette Kimble
About: Yvette Kimble is a nurse practitioner in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. Ms. Kimble specializes in home health visits, and her areas of interest include geriatric care and wound care. Her practice focuses on health promotion and maintenance, and she value's patient input in their plan of care.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Nathan King
About: Dr. Nathan King practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. King specializes in the medical and surgical management of complex gynecologic conditions, such as endometriosis, fibroids, and abnormal uterine bleeding. He has advanced training in minimally invasive surgical techniques that allow for effective treatment, safer surgery, and quicker recovery. Dr. King provides patient-centered care and strives to make sure all his patients feel heard, validated, and empowered in making their healthcare decisions. He also aspires to create a welcoming space for patients of all gender and sexual identities. Dr. King understands that gynecologic conditions can be scary, painful, and debilitating, and they often can be misunderstood or brushed aside - his goal is to guide patients through their journey to recovery.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Rachael King
About: Dr. Rachael King is an internal medicine physician at UI Health. Dr. King specializes in the care of adults and older adults. Her areas of interests include women's health, general internal medicine, healthcare maintenance and prevention, and serving Chicago's diverse communities.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627, South Loop Physicians Group, Suite 100, 2600 S. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60616, 312.492.0025

Name: Alexandra King
About: Dr. Alexandra King is board certified in pediatrics and specializes in primary care for children of all ages. She is an advocate for breastfeeding and vaccinations, and her clinical interests include nutrition/obesity and the promotion of healthy lifestyles for all. She is a clinical instructor in Emergency Medicine and General Pediatrics, and she is Assistant Clinical Director of the Child and Youth Center. Dr. Alexandra King received her MD from the Ohio State University College of Medicine and completed her pediatric residency at the University of Illinois at Chicago.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Charles Kinnaird
About: Dr. Charles Kinnaird delivers comprehensive eye care at Mile Square Health Center. In addition to prescriptions for glasses, routine eye care for the detection, and in most cases treatment, of ocular diseases is delivered to all patients by Dr. Kinnaird.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Jesse Klein
About: Dr. Jesse Klein is a clinical child psychologist who specializes in treating children and adolescents who have difficulties with focus, concentration, hyperactivity, oppositional and disruptive behavior, and/or conduct problems. He is the Director of the Institute for Juvenile Research's Disruptive Behavior Disorders Clinic. Dr. Klein received his Ph.D. from Northwestern University's Feinberg School of Medicine in 2008.
Location: 1747 W. Roosevelt Rd., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7723

Name: Jonathan Klein
About: Dr. Jonathan D. Klein practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Klein specializes in adolescent medicine, and he has a focus on adolescent preventive health services, including smoking cessation, eating disorders, and public health programs. Dr. Klein focuses on faculty and research program development for the department, and he is scientific director of the American Academy of Pediatrics Julius B. Richmond Center of Excellence, a national center dedicated to preventing children's exposure to tobacco and secondhand smoke.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Jocelyn Ko
About: Jocelyn Ko is a nurse practitioner in the Division of Nephrology at UI Health. Ms. Ko provides specialized care to patients with chronic kidney disease and stable acute kidney disease, and to hemodialysis patients. Her special interest is management and education of patients with CKD stages 2-5 and assisting pre-ESRD patients prepare and transition to dialysis and/or kidney transplantation.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569

Name: William Kobak
About: William Kobak, MD specializes in the diagnosis and management of urinary incontinence and female pelvic floor disorders. He is fellowship trained and has advanced training in surgical approaches to the treatment of these disorders, and is skilled in minimally invasive and robotic techniques. Dr. Kobak is Board Certified in Obstetrics & Gynecology and Female Pelvic Medicine and Reconstructive Surgery (Urogynecology). Dr. Kobak is an Associate Professor of Obstetrics and Gynecology, and also serves as Director of Urogynecology. Call 312.413.5096 to get in touch with a Women's Pelvic health provider.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Karl Kochendorfer
About: Dr. Karl M. Kochendorfer practices in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Kochendorfer has particular interested in family-centered maternity care and the use of technology to improve patient care. He also serves as UI Health's Vice Chancellor for Health Affairs, Chief Health Information Officer, and Associate Chief Medical Officer.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Melissa Koehl
About: Dr. Melissa Koehl is a physical therapist in Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Dr. Koehl specializes in manual therapy and vestibular rehabilitation, and she uses an integrative approach to provide individualized care for a variety of musculoskeletal conditions, including chronic pain, dizziness, post-concussion, and imbalance. A former competitive gymnast, she also is a Pilates and yoga instructor.
Location: Outpatient Care Center (OCC), Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Pius Kokose
About: The Rev. Pius Eusebius Kokose is a chaplain in Pastoral Care Services at UI Health. Fr. Kokose is a Roman Catholic sacramental priest and focuses on the spiritual needs of Catholic patients of every background. He is multilingual, speaking Ewe, English, Spanish, and Guaranie, and he also reads and understands Italian and Portuguese. Fr. Kokose is the pastor of St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr Parish in Posen, Illinois.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.0296

Name: Heidi Kolodziejczyk
About: Heidi Kolodziejczyk is a board-certified Adult Nurse Practitioner who specializes in the care of patients with liver disease. She evaluates and treats patients with cirrhosis, hepatitis B and C, autoimmune hepatitis, primary biliary cholangitis, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, and liver cancer. She also performs paracentesis in the liver clinic.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7598

Name: George Kondos
About: Dr. George Kondos is the Vice Chair for Clinical Affairs of the Department of Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Kondos has special interests in treating valvular heart disease, Coronary Artery Disease, lipid disorders, and heart failure. He has over 40 years of experience and speaks Greek and Spanish as well.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Matthew Koshy
About: Dr. Matthew Koshy is an expert in radiation therapy of brain and lung malignancies. His clinical interests center around the use of highly targeted treatments for the most effective minimally invasive therapy. Dr. Koshy maintains a strong interest in clinical research and is a co-investigator on studies designed to improve radiation therapies for the treatment of brain tumors. His research has been funded by the National Institutes of Health (NIH).
Location: Outpatient Care Center (OCC), Concourse (Lower Level), North Tower, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3631

Name: Adam Kosloff
About: Dr. Adam Kosloff is an internal medicine physician at UI Health. Dr. Kosloff's clinical focus in on general internal medicine in the hospital setting, and he has a special interest in bedside ultrasound.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.4242

Name: Janey Kottler
About: Dr. Janey Kottler is a family nurse practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center-Humboldt Park location. Dr. Kottler provides primary care services for medical and mental health needs to individuals across the entire lifespan. Her experiences and interests include adolescent health, women's health, family planning, immunizations, preventative services, nutrition counseling, and medication-assisted treatment for opioid-use disorder. In addition to her clinical practice, Dr. Kottler teaches in the UIC College of Nursing.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Humboldt Park, 3240 W. Division St., Chicago, IL 60651, 312.413.7425

Name: Kevin Kovitz
About: As one of the leading interventional pulmonologists in the country, Dr. Kovitz offers a unique expertise that includes minimally invasive, diagnostic, and therapeutic interventions for the lung and pleura including: Advanced Diagnostic and Therapeutic Bronchoscopy, Complex Airway Management, and Pleural Disease Management.    The focus is on tailoring a unique approach to each patient that minimizes both the number and invasiveness of procedures to best diagnose and treat the underlying condition. Patients with thoracic tumors-most commonly lung cancer-are seen and diagnosed and then directed to the best therapy quickly and efficiently. Those with tumors or scars narrowing their airways can be opened with stents. Research focuses on minimally invasive procedures for COPD/Emphysema and Asthma as well as developing new technologies. The goal is to efficiently provide state-of-the-art care to all of our patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4244

Name: Danielle Kraessig
About: Danielle Kraessig is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Ms. Kraessig specializes in low-risk pregnancy, birth, and women's health. She has special interests in lactation, contraception, and health promotion, and she seeks to educate, empower, and learn from her patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Alina Kraft
About: Alina Kraft is a licensed registered dietitian in the Bariatric Surgery Program at UI Health. Alina has a passion for food and nutrition education. She enjoys helping patients set goals according to their lifestyle to achieve positive health outcomes before metabolic and bariatric surgery. She also helps prepare patients for short/long-term success post operatively.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312-996-5100

Name: Andrew Kreppel
About: Dr. Andrew Kreppel, Assistant Professor of Clinical Pediatrics, was previously a medical officer in the US Air Force. Dr. Kreppel served as chief resident at the Children's Medical Center of Dayton, OH. He earned his Master of Public Health degree with an emphasis in Global Health and then received subspecialty fellowship training in pediatric infectious diseases. He is board certified in pediatrics and pediatric infectious diseases. His clinical interests include pediatric hospital medicine and pediatric infectious disease consultation. The main academic interests of Dr. Kreppel involve understanding data so that they can be used appropriately to improve healthcare systems and patient outcomes. He employs quality improvement techniques to test small changes so that measureable effects can be obtained at the patient and population levels. His efforts are focused mainly on infection prevention and patient safety. In addition to English, Dr. Kreppel speaks some Spanish.
Location: Outpatient Care Center (OCC), 1801 West Taylor St, Suite 2E, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Hema Krishna
About: Dr. Hema Krishna practices in the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Krishna treats a wide range of cardiac conditions with particular clinical and research expertise in valvular heart disease and cardiomyopathies. She has additional specialization in echocardiography and provides imaging support of percutaneous and surgical heart procedures. Dr. Krishna's practice philosophy focuses on high-quality, evidence-based medicine and a collaborative approach with her patients to create the right treatment plan for each individual. She is board-certified in internal medicine, cardiovascular diseases, echocardiography, nuclear medicine, and cardiac computed tomography (CT).
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Jerry Krishnan
About: Dr. Jerry Krishnan is a physician-scientist with expertise in the care of patients with asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), and other complex obstructive lung disorders. He is an investigator in Patient Centered Outcomes Research, American Lung Association, and National Institutes of Health (NIH)-sponsored research networks and is conducting studies to identify new treatment strategies for patients with asthma, COPD, and COVID-19. He serves as a faculty member in the American Thoracic Society Methods in Epidemiologic, Clinical, and Operations Research (MECOR) program and on the board of directors for the Global Initiative for Asthma (GINA) and the Respiratory Health Association. He also is on the Medical and Scientific Advisory Committee for the COPD Foundation. Dr. Krishnan has authored more than 250 peer-reviewed publications in major medical journals, including JAMA, the New England Journal of Medicine, and the American Journal of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3300

Name: Subhash Kukreja
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Harsha Kumar
About: Harsha Vardhan Kumar, MD, has joined pediatrics as Assistant Professor of Clinical Pediatrics in the Division of Allergy/Immunology/Pulmonology. Dr. Kumar graduated from St. John's Medical College, in Bangalore, India. He completed his Pediatric Residency at the University of Illinois at Chicago and his Pediatric Pulmonary Medicine Fellowship at Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago (formerly Children's Memorial Hospital). His clinical interests include asthma, bronchopulmonary dysplasia, and chronic cough. He treats lung and breathing related conditions and diseases in children and newborn infants, offering pulmonary function testing in children and bronchoscopy services. His main research interests are asthma and pediatric obstructive sleep apnea. He is board certified in pediatrics. He speaks English, Hindi, and Kannada.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6714

Name: Mark Kushner
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Stephanie LaBedz
About: Dr. Stephanie LaBedz practices in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, and Sleep at UI Health. Dr. LaBedz treats patients with a variety of lung diseases, with a special interest in obstructive lung diseases, such as COPD and asthma. She places a high value on providing personalized, patient-centered care to each of her patients. Her research interests include addressing social factors that contribute to poor health in patients with chronic lung disease.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3300

Name: Jessica Lai
About: Dr. Jessica Lai practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Lai specializes in the interpretation of breast imaging and performance of breast-related, image-guided procedures in the modalities of mammography, including tomosynthesis, ultrasound, and MRI.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite 2600, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900, Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Lisa Landers
About: Lisa Landers is a board-certified Adult Nurse Practitioner who specializes in the care of patients with liver disease. Her clinical practice focuses on the care of patients with cirrhosis, hepatitis B and C, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, hepatocellular carcinoma, and patients who have had liver transplantation.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7598

Name: James Lash
About: Dr. James Lash is board certified in Internal Medicine and Nephrology. Dr. Lash is a specialist in treating chronic kidney diseases and hypertension.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569

Name: Stacy Laurent
About: Dr. Stacy M. Laurent is board-certified in pediatrics and specializes in health care of children of all ages, from newborn to 18 years old. Her clinical interests are primary care and treatment of acute illness and injury. Dr. Laurent is an assistant professor of clinical pediatrics at UIC and assistant program director for the Pediatrics residency program. She graduated from medical school at Midwestern University in Glendale, Arizona. She completed her pediatrics residency at the Children's Hospital University of Illinois at Chicago (CHUI).
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Catalina LaVerne
About: Catalina LaVerne is a registered clinical dietitian in the Transplant Program. Catalina specializes in transplant nutrition, and she provides patient-specific nutrition counseling for all recipients and donors throughout the transplantation process including presurgical, inpatient, and postsurgical.
Location: Transplant Clinic, Suite 1077, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7318

Name: Brian Layden
About: Dr. Brian Layden is the chief of the Diabetes Center & Endocrinology Clinic at UI Health. Dr. Layden is a clinician-scientist who studies the relationship between diabetes and obesity, and his clinical expertise is in treating patients with type 1 and type 2 diabetes, including those with advanced diabetes and/or insulin resistance, and patients with prediabetes. He also focuses on genetic disorders, adrenal disorders, general endocrinology, and obesity linked to genetic traits that impact metabolism. His lab focuses on uncovering metabolic pathways that contribute to obesity and diabetes and identifying small molecules or drugs that can be used to target those pathways to prevent and treat disease. Some of his current research examines the contribution of the gut microbiome to diabetes and obesity and how it may be "repaired" as part of treatment for these diseases. He is an associate professor and the chief of the Division of Diabetes, Endocrinology and Metabolism in the UIC College of Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Claudia Lee
About: As a wound care physical therapist, Claudia Lee works with patients who have wounds that have not been improving with only dressing changes. Some wounds need additional treatment which would include energy based physical therapy modalities such as electrical stimulation, ultrasound, ultraviolet light, negative pressure wound therapy, pulsed lavage, and debridement. Claudia has experience with all types of wounds ranging from post-operative disruptions to chronic wounds. Many patients are referred to her by the wound clinic.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Victoria Lee
About: Dr. Victoria Lee is a board-certified otolaryngologist and rhinology and skull base surgeon in the Department of Otolaryngology - Head and Neck Surgery at UI Health.  She completed her subspecialty training at Johns Hopkins and otolaryngology residency at the University of Washington.  She was born and raised in Wisconsin and earned her medical degree from Northwestern University.  Her areas of expertise include nasal obstruction, allergy, sinusitis, nasal polyps, and sinonasal tumors.  She is experienced with the latest technological advances in the field and specializes in minimally invasive endoscopic approaches to treat sinonasal as well as skull base and orbital pathology, including pituitary and other tumors, cerebrospinal fluid leaks, blocked tear ducts, and thyroid eye disease. Dr. Lee has co-authored numerous publications and received grant funding as well as several awards for her research in rhinologic clinical outcomes. She strives to achieve a patient-centered approach to her medical and surgical care.  She will work tirelessly to get to the bottom of any problem her patients may have, no matter how complicated.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Yannek Leiderman
About: Dr. Yannek Leiderman is a board-certified ophthalmologist and specialist in diseases and surgery of the retina and vitreous. Dr. Leiderman's practice focuses on complex retinal detachment, proliferative vitreoretinopathy, diabetic eye disease, macular surgery (including macular hole and macular pucker), eye trauma, retinal vascular disorders, macular degeneration and other medical and surgical disorders of the vitreous, retina and macula. He enjoys working closely with other team members to provide personalized and comprehensive care for patients.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Ariel Leifer
About: Dr. Ariel Leifer provides care for people throughout their life cycle including Pediatrics, prenatal care, and management of chronic diseases such as diabetes and hypertension.
Location: University Village Clinic, Suite 235, 722 West Maxwell Street, Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Vania Leung
About: Dr. Vania Leung is a primary care physician at UI Health. Dr. Leung provides individualized care to patients of all ages, and she has a specialized focus on geriatric patients.
Location: South Loop Physicians Group, Suite 100, 2600 S. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60616, 312.492.0025

Name: Julie Leung
About: Julie Leung is a Certified Nurse-Midwife in the Center for Women's Health and University Village who specializes in care before, during, and after pregnancy, pelvic care, and contraceptive services.  She believes health care should be a trusting partnership and empowers patients and families to make informed choices and decisions while acknowledging individual and family cultural preferences.
Specialty: Natural, Unmedicated Labor and Birthing Management
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Jerrold Levine
About: Dr. Jerrold Levine practices in the Division of Nephrology at UI Health. Dr. Levine's clinical interests include autoimmunity, macrophage dysfunction in autoimmune diseases, and innate apoptotic immunity. Some of Dr. Levine's specialties include antiphospholipid syndrome, glomerular diseases, and systemic lupus and other autoimmune diseases. He also is skilled in treating hyponatremia and fluid and electrolyte disorders.
Specialty: Systemic Lupus and other Autoimmune Diseases
Location: Eye & Ear Infirmary, Suite 2028, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569

Name: Laura Lewis
About: As a pediatric occupational therapist at UI Health Hospital, Laura Madlinger Lewis specializes in working with children who are recovering from injury or illness, or who require hospitalization in the neonatal intensive care unit after birth. She works with children and their families to help facilitate developmental milestones and return of function. She has a special interest and advanced training in neonatal/pediatric feeding.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital & Health, 1740 W. Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.4217

Name: Melani Lighter
About: Dr. Melani Lighter is a board-certified general surgeon at UI Health. Dr. Lighter's clinical interests include minimally invasive and robotic surgery for the management of reflux disease, abdominal wall hernias, and diseases of the gastrointestinal tract. Her interests also include interventional and minimally invasive techniques to diagnose and treat lung cancer. Dr. Lighter performs an array of general surgical procedures, in addition to endoscopy, interventional pulmonary, and thoracic procedures, and she is passionate about providing quality and compassionate surgical care to her patients. She has authored a surgical textbook chapter and has written several papers.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300, 55th & Pulaski Health Collaborative, 5525 S. Pulaski Road, Chicago, IL 60629, 312.355.4300

Name: Jennifer Lim
About: Dr. Jennifer Lim is the Director of the Retina Service at UI Health. Dr. Lim is involved in both the clinical treatment and research aspects of retinal and vitreous diseases, such as diabetic retinopathy, retinal detachment, and age-related macular degeneration, and she has been the principal investigator in dozens of clinical trials for various retinal diseases. Dr. Lim has performed more than 6,000 vitreoretinal surgeries, and she is one of the few surgeons in the United States to perform implantation surgery for the Argus II retinal prosthesis, which can restore vision in patients with retinitis pigmentosa (RP), a rare eye disease that causes damage to the retina, resulting in loss of vision. She is the Marion Schenk Chair for Research of the Aging Eye at the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Specialty: Macular diseases, including Central Serous Choroidopathy
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Winnie Lin
About: Dr. Winnie Lin practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Lin provides pediatric primary care at the Mile Square Health Center-Englewood location for all ages of pediatric patients, from infants through adolescents. A Chicago native, Dr. Lin is committed to providing high-quality, equitable care for children and families on the South Side of Chicago. She is an assistant professor in the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Englewood, 641 W. 63rd St., Chicago, IL  60621, 312.996.2000

Name: Janet Lin
About: Dr. Janet Lin practices in the Department of Emergency Medicine at UI Health. An expert in disaster preparedness and response, Dr. Lin has developed a number emergency response plans at the University of Illinois Hospital & Clinics for situations including virus outbreaks and weather events. She was a leading physician on UI Health's Incident Command Structure during the COVID-19 pandemic, helping to guide care, policies, and operations related to COVID-19. Dr. Lin travels extensively to help international communities prepare for and respond to disasters, and she investigates ways to improve access to care in resource-limited settings. She is a professor at the University of Illinois College of Medicine and the director of health systems development in the Center for Global Health at UIC.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 866.600.2273

Name: Andrew Lipnik
About: Dr. Andrew Lipnik specializes Interventional Radiology and is a board certified Radiologist from the American Board of Radiology. He completed his fellowship in Vascular and Interventional Radiology at Northwestern Memorial Hospital, and completed his residency in Diagnostic Radiology at Northwestern Memorial Hospital.
Location: UI Hospital, Room 2483, 1740 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0241

Name: Anna Lipowska
About: Dr. Anna Lipowska practices in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Dr. Lipowska specializes in the care of patients with esophageal disorders, including Barrett's esophagus, eosinophilic esophagitis, achalasia, heartburn, and other swallowing problems. She also evaluates patients with constipation, inflammatory bowel disease, colon cancer, and other gastrointestinal diseases.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000, Specialty Care Building, 4th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3800

Name: Thom Lobe
About: Dr. Thom E. Lobe practices in the Division of Pediatric Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Lobe has a focus on minimally invasive surgery, and he specializes in treating neonatal cancers and pediatric urologic conditions. He developed one of the earliest programs applying laser therapy to treat pediatric diseases, and throughout his career has acquired a great understanding of advanced nutrition, metabolism, hormone therapy, skin care, and regenerative wound healing. Dr. Lobe has decades of experiences training pediatric surgery residents, and has been integral in many innovations and advances in cancer care.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Ann-Marie Lobo
About: Dr. Ann-Marie Lobo is Co-Director of Uveitis Service in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. Dr. Lobo's clinical and research efforts are focused on the diagnosis and treatment of ocular inflammatory and infectious diseases, including anterior, intermediate, and posterior uveitis and scleritis. Her research interests also include factors related to the development and severity of infectious uveitis, the morbidity of childhood uveitis, and the use of biologic response modifier therapies in uveitis treatment. She has served as the principal investigator for several multicenter, international clinical trials involving the use of novel therapies for the treatment of noninfectious uveitis.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937), Millennium Park Eye Center, Suite 410, 30 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60602, 312.996.2020

Name: Jeffrey Loeb
About: Dr. Loeb is the head of the Department of Neurology and Rehabilitation. His major subspecialty interest is in epilepsy. He is a pioneer in developing new treatments, not only for epilepsy, but for other brain disorders. He has long-standing research interests in many diseases including epilepsy, MS, neuromuscular disease such as ALS, and cancer. He has published many important research articles and is funded for his research programs by the National Institutes of Health, many private foundations, and local donors. Dr. Loeb is also the John S Garvin Endowed Chair in Neurology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Mark Lones
About: The Rev. Mark E. Lones is the director of Pastoral Care Services at UI Health. Rev. Lones has been in ministry since 1987 and has served as a senior pastor, educational administrator, and healthcare chaplain. In his role at UI Health, he has grown Pastoral Care into a robust service providing 24/7/365 spiritual care to patients, families, and staff. He also has provided interim leadership for the clinical ethics consult service, re-established the Clinical Pastoral Education Center, and led in the launch of the Advance Directives Initiative at UI Health.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite 2009, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.0296

Name: Melvin Lopata
About: Dr. Melvin Lopata is a pulmonologist with expertise in critical care, respiratory control and muscles, and sleep disordered breathing.
Location: UI Hospital Sleep Science Center, Suite 104, 2242 West Harrison Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7708

Name: Claudia Lora
About: Dr. Claudia Lora practices in the Division of Nephrology at UI Health. Dr. Lora specializes in chronic, kidney disease, fluid electrolyte abnormalities, and hypertension. She also is fluent in Spanish.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569

Name: Julie Loza
About: Dr. Julie Loza practices in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Loza provides preventative care to patients of all ages, and her clinical interests include chronic disease management, women's health, geriatrics, and adolescent medicine.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Milena Lyon
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8666

Name: Peter MacIntosh
About: Dr. Peter MacIntosh practices in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. Dr. MacIntosh is dual fellowship-trained in neuro-ophthalmology and oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. His interests include evaluation of optic nerve abnormalities; idiopathic intracranial hypertension; optic neuritis; ischemic, inflammatory, and compressive optic neuropathies; diplopia; facial paralysis; blepharospasm. Dr. MacIntosh also is the director of the Ophthalmology Residency Training Program, and he has a special interest in education and curriculum development. He is an associate professor of Ophthalmology at the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Shannon MacLaughlan
About: Dr. Shannon MacLaughlan practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. MacLaughlan is a gynecologic oncologist with extensive experience in state-of-the-art surgical and medical interventions for women with cancers of the ovary, uterus, cervix, vulva, and vagina, including minimally invasive surgery, surgical cytoreduction, chemotherapy, immunotherapy, hormonal therapy, and innovative treatment on clinical trials. She puts the patient - not the disease - at the center of cancer care, and embraces a holistic approach to caring for women with gynecologic cancers, recognizing the importance of treating a patient in the context of her own life, and that survivorship begins at the time of cancer diagnosis.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.9874

Name: Gautam Malhotra
About: Dr. Gautam Malhotra is an orthopaedic surgeon in the Department of Orthopaedics at UI Health. Dr. Malhotra specializes in treatment of the upper extremity (from the shoulder to fingertips), including rotator cuff surgery; shoulder replacement; fractures and trauma involving the shoulder, wrist, and hand; and peripheral nerve- and tendon-related issues. His treatment paradigm starts with understanding his patient's needs and demands; educating them about their problem; and then jointly creating an effective, individualized treatment plan. For some patients, this involves conservative measures, such as therapy, injections, and medications, and for others this involves surgery. Dr. Malhotra uses the most advanced surgical techniques, including traditional open surgery, arthroscopy, and microsurgery. He strives to treat all his patients with compassion and respect and help them return to work, sports, and their regular activities as safely and soon as possible.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Clinic 2A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1300

Name: Khalid Malik
About: Dr. Khalid Malik is the Division Chief of Pain Medicine at UI Health and is a national leader in the field of Pain Medicine. He has over twenty years of clinical expertise and has authored numerous text books, and has trained many residents and fellows at major academic institutions. Dr. Malik is a highly trained surgeon and has expertise in all areas of interventional pain medicine including spinal cord stimulators and intrathecal pumps. His primary area of research is spinal pain and he utilizes minimally invasive techniques to treat these pain syndromes. He is serving as an editorial member of several reputed journals and routinely presents his work at national meetings.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Bernice Man
About: Dr. Bernice Man specializes in internal medicine. Her clinical interests include chronic disease management, health maintenance, and prevention
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627

Name: Nikita Maniar
About: Dr. Nikita Maniar practices in the Department of Neurology & Rehabilitation at UI Health. Dr. Maniar's clinical interests include myasthenia gravis, learning disorders, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, epilepsy, and stroke.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.355.0510, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Patrick Manrique
About: Patrick Manrique is a physical therapist in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Mr. Manrique specializes in the rehabilitation of patients after a surgery, including knee replacements, rotator cuff repairs, and ACL Repairs, and he has background in helping amputees, soldiers, and athletes return to active lifestyles. He also has a focus on balance and gait training, assisting patients with balance problems improve their confidence and safety awareness, with the goal of reducing their risk of falls.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Deborah Manst
About: Dr. Deborah Manst is part of the Cancer Survivorship Program at UI Health. Dr. Manst provides comprehensive clinical care to cancer survivors and participates in various research projects at the University of Illinois Cancer Center. She has a background in public health and preventive medicine, and she has a specific interest in cancer prevention through the identification of gene mutations that elevate cancer risks.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Winnie Mar
Location: 7 North, 2nd Floor, 1740 West Taylor, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Stefania Maraka
About: Dr. Stefania Maraka practices in the Department of Neurology & Rehabilitation at UI Health. Dr. Maraka specializes in primary brain tumors, such as gliomas; brain metastasis; leptomeningeal disease; and neurological complications of cancer. She serves as the director of the Adult Neurofibromatosis Clinic. Dr. Maraka's clinical research interests focus on finding new treatment strategies for patients diagnosed with primary brain tumors, brain metastasis or leptomeningeal disease, and neurofibromatosis disease.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: David Marder
About: Dr. Marder, dual certified in Internal and Preventive (Occupational) Medicine, is the Director of the University Health Services the primary medical service for faculty, staff, and students at the University of Illinois at Chicago. In this role he directs programs to provide preventive, surveillance, return to work, and acute injury/illness care for the over 6,000 members of the university community. In addition he serves as Associate Director of the UIC Occupational Health Institute providing consultative services to corporate clients and individuals concern with exposures in the workplace and communities. He has over 30 years experience in the field, having served as Medical Director, Environmental/Occupational Health, of the City of Chicago Department of Public Health, and as an Internal Medicine Attending Physician at Cook County Hospital prior to his current appointment. Over these years he has continued to perform Independent Medical Evaluations on a referral basis serving both as expert witness and  final arbiter for companies, lawyers, pension boards, and unions in the Chicago land area. Dr. Marder's particular interests include occupational asthma, medical center surveillance for blood borne pathogens, and quality assurance.
Location: Occupational Health & Workers' Compensation Clinic, Suite E144, 835 S. Wolcott Ave., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7420

Name: Lisa Mariano
About: Lisa Mariano is the liver transplant clinical coordinator at UI Health. A board-certified nurse with an extensive and diverse adult critical care background, Ms. Mariano coordinates all aspects of care for the patient undergoing evaluation for liver transplantation. From referral through workup and, ultimately, transplantation, she works as the nurse liaison between the patient and the transplant team, utilizing her advanced clinical expertise and genuine compassion her patients. Once a patient is approved for organ listing, she maintains the patient's status on the UNOS liver transplant wait list. Additionally, Ms. Mariano coordinates the care for all patients undergoing living-donor liver transplantation and serves both as educator and advocate to the patients and families under her care. Ms. Mariano has advanced leadership skills in management of acute care settings related to adult critical care, including Level 1 Trauma, cardiovascular-thoracic, and surgical intensive care units.
Location: Ear & Eye Infirmary (EEI), Suite 1077, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4035

Name: Sherie Marshall
About: Sherie Marshall is a family nurse practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center-South Shore location. Mrs. Marshall specializes in preventative health services and the management of chronic and acute illnesses, and her clinical interests include reducing health disparities among minorities, health promotion/education, and disease prevention. She enjoys serving the South Shore community and strives to make a positive impact on her patients' health.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–South Shore, 7037 S. Stony Island Ave., Chicago, IL 60649, 312.996.2000

Name: Molly Martin
About: Dr. Molly Martin is a practicing pediatrician and researcher. Dr. Martin's research has been continuously funded by the NIH since 2004. Her research addresses health disparities using community-based interventions and implementation science methods. She obtained her medical degree from the Medical College of Wisconsin and then completed her pediatrics residency and the Robert Wood Johnson Clinical Scholars Program at the University of Chicago. Dr. Martin spent nine years at Rush University Medical Center before moving to the University of Illinois Hospital & Health Sciences System in February of 2014. She is located in the College of Medicine Department of Pediatrics and the Institute for Health Research and Policy. Dr. Martin currently serves as the Associate Head of Research for the College of Medicine Department of Pediatrics, the Director of UIC Center for Clinical and Translational Science Pilot Grant Program, and the Associate Director for Community Engagement for the UIC Center for Dissemination and Implementation Science. Dr. Martin speaks Spanish and sees patients at the Mile Square Health Center.
Location: Mile Square Health Center, Main, 1220 South Wood Street, Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Robert Marvin
Location: Neuropsychiatric Institute, 1st floor, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2200

Name: Rhapsody Mason
About: Ms. Mason is a Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry. Ms. Mason is dedicated to serving children and their families with unique social and emotional needs in a variety of capacities. She has experience working in early intervention, pediatric offices,  therapeutic schools and  preschool programs as well as group residential programs.  As a Social Worker with UI Health, Ms. Mason is continuing her commitment to the promotion of children's mental health by providing therapy to children and  their families. She has a particular interest in working with  young children and their families facing various challenges such as disruptive behavior, anxiety, trauma, parenting challenges, and developmental delays. Ms. Mason introduces a variety of techniques in therapy  depending on the family's needs and preferences.  In 2010 she received her Masters degree in Social Work from The University of Chicago School of Social Service Administration.
Location: Institute for Juvenile Research, 1747 West Roosevelt Road, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7723

Name: Mario Masrur
About: Dr. Mario Masrur provides care to patients with Gastrointestinal diseases and morbidly obese patients. He earned his medical degree from the College of Medicine of Universidad Nacional de Cuyo in Mendoza, Argentina. He completed his general surgery residency in the Hospital Italiano de Mendoza in Argentina. Then he moved to Chicago to start his trip on Minimally invasive and Robotic Surgery. He completed a Minimally invasive and robotic surgery fellowship at University of Illinois at Chicago and then completed a year of Fellowship in Advance GI surgery at the same institution, after which he joined the Division of Minimally Invasive and Robotic Surgery at UI Health. He has published over 30 peer-reviewed publications and 2 book chapters related to minimally invasive and robotic-assisted surgery.
Specialty: Bariatric, Upper GI and Solid organ
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Malek Massad
About: Dr. Malek Massad is a thoracic and cardiac surgeon at UI Health. Dr. Massad is also a Sara Smart Mansueto Professor in Cardiothoracic Surgery.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 3F, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Joyce Masterton
About: Joyce Masterson is a pediatric nurse practitioner in both the Pediatric Neurology Clinic and the Developmental & Behavioral Clinic. Joyce provides evidence-based care for children experiencing pediatric neurologic problems, including headaches and seizures, and her clinical expertise focuses on the relationship between brain disorders and child developmental and behavioral challenges, such as ADHD, learning problems, autism spectrum disorders, and other developmental delays. She enjoys teaching families to embrace their child's differences and how to advocate for their children by partnering with community resources and school districts.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, Suite 235, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Nikolas Mata Machado
About: Dr. Nikolas Machado practices in the Department of Pediatric Neurology at UI Health. Dr. Machado specializes in treating patients with neurofibromatosis (NF), epilepsy, and headaches, and he also sees patients with developmental delay, autism, and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). He is director of the multidisciplinary Neurofibromatosis Clinic at UI Health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Benjamin Mathew
About: Dr. Benjamin Mathew is a General Pediatric Ophthalmologist at UI Health and Assistant Professor of Clinical Ophthalmology at the University of Illinois College of Medicine. Dr. Mathew is Diplomate of the American Board of Ophthalmology and a Fellow of the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada. His research interests include ophthalmic optics and automated measurement of strabismus.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Deanna Matusik
About: Dr. Deanna Kattah Matusik is the Assistant Director of the Department of Audiology at UI Health. Dr. Matusik is a specialty board-certified audiologist who focuses on cochlear implants, and she assesses and manages adult and pediatric patients with hearing loss and tinnitus.
Specialty: Auditory brainstem implant (ABI) evaluations and management
Hearing aid selections, fittings, and management
Location: Eye & Ear Infirmary, Suite B46, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6522

Name: Stockton Mayer
About: Dr. Stockton Mayer practices in the Division of Infectious Diseases at UI Health. Dr. Mayer specializes in treating patients infected with HIV and infectious agents acquired in tropical regions. He also treats patients who experience infections in the setting of other immunocompromising conditions.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.3785

Name: Mark McCauley
About: Dr. McCauley is a cardiologist and electrophysiologist that specializes in heart rhythm management. He treats patients with atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter, heart failure, and ischemic heart disease.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Megan McCray
About: Megan McCray practices in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Ms. McCray is an occupational therapist who works with a variety of upper-extremity conditions and injuries, including fractures, tendon injuries, nerve injuries, and postsurgical rehabilitation. She also treats cumulative trauma or repetitive-use disorders in adults and children.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Catherine McGinty
About: Catherine McGinty is a physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. She specializes in neurological physical therapy; balance and gait training; rehabilitation following lower-extremity amputation; and vestibular therapy. She has worked in a wide range of settings during her career including acute care, day rehab, LTACH, and outpatient, and she has a special interest in working with the neurological and medically complex population and assisting people in maximizing their independence and quality of life.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Timothy McMahon
About: Dr. Timothy McMahon's principal research interests are the pathobiology, genetics, and clinical management of keratoconus, a degenerative disease of the cornea. Dr. McMahon's multi-center clinical trials are supported by numerous grants from the National Eye Institute, including the Collaborative Longitudinal Evaluation of Keratoconus (CLEK) Corneal Topography Reading Center. He is a member of the Board of Directors of the American Academy of Optometry and is a Diplomate in the Section on Cornea, Contact Lenses and Refractive Technologies. The National Academies of Practice, an organization of outstanding health care practitioners dedicated to quality healthcare for all, named him a Distinguished Clinical Fellow. Dr. McMahon sees patients at the Illinois Eye and Ear Infirmary and the Millennium Park Eye Center.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937), Millennium Park Eye Center, Suite 410, 30 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60602, 312.996.2020

Name: Maureen McNamee
About: Maureen McNamee is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Ms. McNamee specializes in individualizing patient care in family planning, prenatal care, and well-woman gynecology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Ankit Mehta
About: Dr. Ankit Indravadan Mehta is an American Board of Neurological Surgeons board-certified neurosurgeon who practices in the Department of Neurosurgery at UI Health. Dr. Mehta specializes in the surgical treatment of complex spinal conditions, including spinal tumors and degenerative spine diseases. As the director of Spinal Oncology, Dr. Mehta leads a laboratory specifically examining animal models of spinal tumors, both primary and metastatic, to apply his findings to new treatments for patients; in addition, he leads a team focusing on spinal cord injury and traumatic brain injury. Dr. Mehta's research efforts focus on patients with complex spinal conditions, most notably spinal tumors and spinal deformity, and his involvement with national and international study groups examining outcomes for patients with such conditions reflects his focus on patient care and his clinical concentration on treating patients with spinal tumors. His contributions have earned him numerous awards, including the 21st Century Research Grant from the Cervical Spine Research Society and the journal Spine's Young Investigator of the Year Award, among others. Dr. Mehta was recognized by the North American Spine Society's "20 Under 40" Leaders in Spine list, and he received a Rising Star Award from the UIC College of Medicine. He is fellowship trained in enfolded stereotactic radiosurgery, complex spine surgery, and spinal oncology, and he has published more than 160 peer-reviewed articles, 7 book chapters, and has presented his research at numerous national conferences. Dr. Mehta is a Fellow in the American Association of Neurological Surgeons (FAANS) and Fellow of the American College of Surgeons (FACS).
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Vikas Mehta
About: Dr. Vikas Mehta practices in the Division of Anatomic Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Mehta's areas of expertise include genitourinary pathology, gynecologic pathology, and oncologic surgical pathology. His primary role is to establish accurate diagnoses and guide treatment decisions by incorporating the latest molecular testing assays. His research interests include understanding the molecular and genetic mechanisms of germ cell tumors of testis, in addition to renal cell carcinoma. Dr. Mehta has authored more than 50 peer-reviewed publications.
Location: Department of Pathology, Suite 130, 840 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2921

Name: Alfonso Mejia
About: Dr. Alfonso Mejia specializes in hand surgery and microsurgery as well as general orthopedics and fracture care. Dr. Mejia is a bilingual in English and Spanish.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2A, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1300

Name: Anis Mekhail
About: Dr. Anis Mekhail is an Orthopedic physician at UI Health. Dr. Mekhail has special interest in Scoliosis and Spine surgery.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2A, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1300

Name: Anders Mellgren
About: Dr. Anders F. Mellgren is the Chief of the Division of Colon & Rectal Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Mellgren's interests include pelvic floor disorders, colon and rectal cancer, inflammatory bowel disease, minimally invasive robotic surgery, and innovative treatment options for fecal incontinence, in addition to surgical research and teaching. He has an extensive list of original scientific publications on the topic of colorectal diseases and their treatments, and he frequently presents at national and international meetings. Dr. Mellgren is the Turi Josefsen Chair in Colon-Rectal Surgery at the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.9646

Name: Katie Mena
About: Dr. Katie Mena specializes in primary care, general internal medicine, and pediatric general care.
Location: South Loop Physicians Group, Suite 100, 2600 S. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60616, 312.492.0025

Name: Alfredo Mena Lora
About: Dr. Mena Lora is a Clinical Assistant Professor in the Department of Medicine and Medical Director of Infection Control at Saint Anthony Hospital. His clinical interests include HIV/AIDS, infections in immunocompromised hosts and general infectious diseases.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8937

Name: Martha Menchaca
About: Dr. Martha Menchaca practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Menchaca specializes in diagnostic radiology, and she certified by the American Board of Radiology.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0276

Name: Joseph Mendoza
About: Joseph Mendoza has been part of the UI Health team since 2010. He coordinates outpatient occupational and physical therapy. Joseph has clinical experience working in the continuum of care including inpatient acute care, acute rehabilitation, outpatient, and clinics. His outpatient expertise focuses on neurological and oncological rehabilitation. He enjoys spending time with his children and playing soccer.
Location: UI Health Occupational and Physical Therapy, 1740 W. Taylor St., Suite C100, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Renzo Mendoza
About: Dr. Renzo Mendoza is an outpatient physical therapist in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Dr. Mendoza is a board-certified orthopaedic clinical specialist whose background includes chronic pain conditions, comprehensive spine care, and cardiovascular health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Alice Merrill
About: Alice Merrill is an occupational therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI health. Alice is passionate about providing affirming care to patients of all backgrounds and improving the healthcare experience for LGBTQ+ individuals. Alice specializes in helping people return to the things they want and need to do in their lives following injury, surgery, or dysfunction of their hands, wrists, and elbows.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60692, 312.355.4394

Name: Sisay Mersha
About: Dr. Sisay Mersha is an acute care nurse practitioner in the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Mersha specializes in the management of patients with cardiovascular diseases. He is the Director of Advanced Practice Providers at UI Health and has an adjunct faculty appointment in the UIC College of Nursing.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Sarah Messmer
About: Dr. Sarah Messmer specializes in both pediatrics and internal medicine and provides primary care to both adults and children. Dr. Messmer cares for patients in both the inpatient and outpatient settings at UI Health. Her clinical interests include immigrant and refugee health, LGBTQ+ health, and gender-affirming care, global health, and opioid use disorder.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416, Primary Care Plus Clinic, 1801 W. Taylor St. 3AA, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627

Name: Cynthia Meza
About: Cynthia Meza is a pre-kidney transplant coordinator in the Kidney Transplant Program at UI Health. In her role, Cynthia evaluates and educates patients on solid organ donation and the transplantation process. Practicing under the supervision of transplant surgeons and physicians, Cynthia ensures coordination of the clinical aspects of transplant patients throughout the pre-kidney transplant phase.
Location: Ear & Eye Infirmary (EEI), Suite 1077, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 12.996.0364

Name: Edward Michals
About: Dr. Edward Michals is the director of Diagnostic Neuroradiology in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Michals' clinical interests include diffusion imaging, functional imaging, perfusion imaging, myelography, and vertebroplasty.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: William Mieler
About: Dr. William Mieler is the Director of Ocular Oncology Clinic at UI Health. Dr. Mieler is an expert in treating diseases of the macula, retina, and vitreous. He is also the Cless Family Professor in Ophthalmology.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Vinay Mikkilineni
About: Dr. Vinay Mikkilineni is an Emergency Medicine physician at UI Health. Dr. Mikkilineni provides care for patients in the Emergency Department, Clinical Decision Unit, and inpatient units.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 866.600.2273

Name: Adam Mikolajczyk
About: Dr. Adam Mikolajczyk practices in the Department of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Dr. Mikolajczyk specializes in the care of patients with cirrhosis, hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), viral hepatitis (hepatitis B and hepatitis C), autoimmune hepatitis, and inherited liver diseases. He also evaluates patients in need of liver transplantation and participates in the post-transplant care team.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7598

Name: David Miller
About: Dr. David Miller is a dentist at the Mile Square Health Center-South Shore location. Dr. Miller has more than 30 years' clinical experience, and he specializes in general dentistry, dental surgery, and oral health. He is a former chief of the Division of Oral within the Illinois Department of Public Health (2011-14), where he was charged with the mission to assure that the people of Illinois have access to population-based interventions that prevent and reduce oral disease and to promote oral health as integral to overall health. A former representative for Illinois' 29th state house district (2001-11), Dr. Miller was the chief sponsor for legislation that mandated dental examinations for K, 2nd, and 6th grades.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–South Shore, 7037 S. Stony Island Avenue, Chicago, IL 60649, 312.996.2000

Name: Michael Miloro
About: Dr. Michael Miloro is the Head of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery at UI Health and Professor of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery at the University of Illinois College of Medicine. His clinical and research interests include nerve regeneration, bone healing, implantology, TMJ disease, and orthognathic surgery. Dr. Miloro is a Diplomate and past Examiner of the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, a Faculty Fellow of the American Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons, and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Miloro also serves as the editor of Craniomaxillofacial Deformities/Cosmetic Surgery for the Journal of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, in addition to serving on its editorial board. He has edited three major textbooks and has authored several textbook chapters. He has lectured nationally and internationally and has been published extensively in medical and dental literature.
Location: College of Dentistry, Room 110, 801 South Paulina Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7460

Name: Mahmoud Mima
About: Dr. Mahmoud Mima practices in the Department of Urology at UI Health. Dr. Mima specializes in male infertility and sexual health, including testosterone replacement, vasectomies and microsurgical vasectomy reversals, erectile dysfunction, sexual dysfunction, penile prosthesis implantation, male slings, urinary sphincters, and Peyronie's disease (abnormal penile curvature). Dr. Mima is a member of several prominent urological societies, including the American Urological Association, the American Society for Reproductive Medicine, the Sexual Medicine Society of North America, and the Chicago Urology Society.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 2nd Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2779

Name: Diana Mnatsakanova
About: Dr. Diana Mnatsakanova practices in the Department of Neurology at UI Health. Dr. Mnatsakanova evaluates patients who present with weakness and numbness, and she diagnoses and treats neuromuscular disorders, including myasthenia gravis, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, neuropathies, muscular dystrophies, and myopathies. She also performs electromyography studies (EMG) to help with diagnosis of neuromuscular disorders.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Mehmet Mocan
About: Dr. M. Cem Mocan practices in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. Dr. Mocan specializes in pediatric eye disorders, with a special focus on anterior segment disorders. His clinical interests include congenital and infantile glaucomas, pediatric cataracts, ocular re-alignment surgery for strabismus, and amblyopia. Dr. Mocan is a co-investigator in national, multicenter studies looking into visual outcomes in children with retinopathy of prematurity, retinoblastoma, and neurofibromatosis. He also is a member of the Craniofacial Center Team at UI Health and treats various eye conditions of children diagnosed with craniofacial disorders. Dr. Mocan is a full-time faculty member in the Department of Ophthalmology & Visual Sciences at the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Heather Moky
About: Heather Moky Cordova is a physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Heather has completed extensive coursework in evaluation and treatment techniques for women, men, pregnancy, pain, transgender, and nonbinary people, with pelvic floor dysfunction, in addition to serving as teaching and lab assistants in the different educational courses.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.6600

Name: Robert Molokie
About: Dr. Robert Molokie practices in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. Dr. Molokie specializes in the treatment of sickle cell disease.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 5 East, 1740 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.8666

Name: Pooja Monpara
About: Dr. Pooja Monpara practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Monpara provides primary care services for pediatric, adolescent, and adult patients, with a focus on preventive healthcare and chronic disease management. She also has a special interest in reproductive healthcare and addiction medicine.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL  60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Kenneth Moore
About: Dr. Kenneth Moore practices in the Department of Neurology & Rehabilitation at UI Health. Dr. Moore specializes in head pain, including headaches and concussions.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.413.5569

Name: Daniel Moreira
About: Dr. Daniel M. Moreira practices in the Department of Urology at UI Health. Dr. Moreira specializes in the diagnosis and surgical management of all urologic cancers, including prostate, kidney, bladder, testicular, penile, and adrenal malignancies. He utilizes open and minimally invasive techniques, including laparoscopic and robotic surgery.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2779, Specialty Care Building, 2nd Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2779

Name: David Morris
About: Dr. David Morris is an associate professor in the Division of Plastic, Reconstructive, and Cosmetic Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Morris' clinical practice focuses on pediatric plastic surgery and craniofacial surgery in children and young adults, and his areas of research interest include multidisciplinary outcomes following orthognathic surgery and optimization of the 3D/virtual planning approach in craniomaxillofacial procedures. Dr. Morris completed residencies in general surgery, plastic surgery, and fellowship training in craniofacial surgery, and he is board-certified in plastic surgery. Dr. Morris is an active member of multiple surgical organizations, including the American Society of Plastic Surgeons, American Society of Maxillofacial Surgeons, and the American Cleft palate/Craniofacial Association. He serves on multiple editorial boards for plastic surgical journals and he is actively involved in clinical research.
Specialty: Cosmetic Surgery of the Face, Body and Extremities
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Melody Mumford
About: Urgent Care specialist Dr. Melody Mumford is the Mile Square Urgent Care Site Director and Assistant Professor of Clinical Family Medicine. She works out of the Mile Square Urgent Care Center and the UI Health Emergency Room. Dr. Mumford's affinity for speed and precision drives her passion for urgent care, while her dedication to serving underserved populations fuels her interest in international medicine. Dr. Mumford earned her medical degree from the University of St. Eustatius in 2007 and went on to train in Family Medicine during her residency at the University of Illinois at Chicago. During that time, Dr. Mumford also contributed to a global health project in which she helped facilitate cancer screenings in Senegal. After completing her residency in 2011, she worked for Ingalls Urgent Aids until 2014 when she joined Mile Square.
Location: Mile Square Health Center, Main, 1220 S Wood St, Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Pravin Muniyappa
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Marisol Munoz
About: Marisol Munoz is a family nurse practitioner in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, and Sleep Medicine. Marisol specializes in lung cancer screening and lung health, including treating pulmonary nodules and helping patients with tobacco cessation. She is passionate about improving disparities in lung screening and lung health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.2740, 55th & Pulaski Health Collaborative, 5525 S. Pulaski Road, Chicago, IL 60629, 312.996.2740

Name: Carlos Murga-Zamalloa
About: Dr. Carlos Murga-Zamalloa is a clinician-scientist in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Murga-Zamalloa's clinical expertise is in the diagnosis of hematolymphoid neoplasms, and his research interest is to learn and investigate the molecular and cellular basis of hematological malignancies, for the development of new therapeutic and diagnostic approaches. The focus of his research is the molecular and cellular biology of lymphomas, with a particular emphasis in T-cell lymphomas.
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3998

Name: Shannon Murphy
About: Dr. Shannon Murphy practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Murphy is a general pediatrician, and she also focuses on newborn care, including treating patients in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU). She has a special interest in helping patients manage eczema, allergies, and asthma, and she is a proponent of physical activity and nutrition as keys to health and wellness.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Christa Mustapha
About: Christa Mustapha is a nurse practitioner in the Department of Urology at UI Health. Christa treats a wide range of urologic conditions, including hypogonadism, erectile dysfunction, benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), lower urinary tract symptoms, and urinary tract infections. She is passionate about helping patient improve their quality of life and providing support and compassion during tough cancer diagnoses.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 2nd Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2779

Name: Ece Mutlu
About: Dr. Ece Mutlu is a board-certified gastroenterologist in the Division of Internal Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Mutlu focuses on treating patients with inflammatory bowel diseases, including ulcerative colitis, Crohn's, microscopic colitis, and collagenous colitis; colon polyps and cancer; and eosinophilic diseases of the digestive tract. She as a special interest in diet and nutrition in digestive-disease prevention and treatment, and she routinely performs gastrointestinal endoscopy and colonoscopy, including specialized procedures such as chromoendoscopy, capsule endoscopy, and large-polyp removals. Dr. Mutlu's collaborative spirit with referring physicians and other providers helps assure multidisciplinary approaches to find the best possible outcomes for her patients, and her diligent approach to patient care and safety has earned her top-physician awards. In addition to clinical care, Dr. Mutlu is nationally and internationally known for her patient-oriented research studying nutrition and the intestinal microbiome. Her work has been supported by foundations and federal agencies. She serves on multiple advisory panels, conducts clinical trials, teaches, lectures, and publishes in the same fields.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 4th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3800

Name: Amy Nagel
About: Amy Nagel is a licensed physical therapist in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Ms. Nagel treats a variety of diagnoses for patients with vestibular, orthopaedic, neurologic, postoperative, and sports rehabilitation needs. She practices a broad range of therapy treatments, methods, and modalities, specializing in vestibular rehabilitation, a form of therapy intended to reduce vertigo and dizziness, gaze instability, and/or imbalance and falls.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Fedra Najjar
About: Dr. Fedra Najjar is the director of the Neurodevelopmental Disorder Psychopharmacology Clinic at UI Health. Dr. Najjar's clinical interests include psychopharmacology clinical trials surrounding schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and autism spectrum disorder.
Location: Colbeth Clinic, IJR, 1747 West Roosevelt Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7723

Name: Muhammad Najjar
About: Dr. Muhammad Najjar is a neurologist at UI Health, specializing in sleep medicine. Dr. Najjar treats patient with disorders related to sleep, including patients who snore, stop breathing in sleep, feel drowsy during the day, have difficulty sleeping, or have abnormal behavior in sleep. He works closely with patients to address their complaints and develop individualized treatment plans to meet their needs and expectations. Dr. Najjar's goal is successful treatment and patient satisfaction.
Location: Sleep Science Center, Suite 104, 2242 W. Harrison St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7708

Name: Niyada Naksuk
About: Dr. Niyada Naksuk is a cardiac electrophysiologist in the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Naksuk provides state-of-the-art therapy to patients with arrhythmias, including supraventricular tachycardia, atrial fibrillation, and ventricular arrhythmias; she also provides device therapy, such as pacemaker and defibrillator. Her particular area of expertise relates to quality initiatives, outcome improvements, and sudden cardiac death. Dr. Naksuk focuses on patient needs to ensure they can make informed decisions about their health.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Beatrice Naulleau
About: Ms. Beatrice Naulleau is a Licensed Clinical Social Worker with over 25 years of experience.
