The majority of Ms. Naulleau's clinical experience has been working with adults facing various issues, including depression, anxiety, bereavement and relationship issues. She has experience working with children and adolescents as well.
Location: Neuropsychiatric Institute, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2200

Name: Ammara Naveed
About: Dr. Naveed’s services include evaluating and treating patients with chronic liver disease. She is involved in pre-transplant evaluations and post-transplant care. Her clinical interests include viral hepatitis (Hepatitis C), autoimmune hepatitis, and liver cancer.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7598

Name: Keith Naylor
About: Dr. Keith Naylor is a gastroenterologist and health services researcher in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Dr. Naylor's major areas of interest include using administrative health data to investigate small-area variation in the utilization of endoscopic and non-endoscopic forms of colorectal cancer screening. His current research interests include defining colonoscopy-related geographic service areas using administrative data and examining the relationship between spatial proximity to colonoscopy infrastructure and the utilization of endoscopic and non-endoscopic screening modalities. He is particularly interested in exploring these factors among urban communities and within racial and ethnic minority population subgroups.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000, Specialty Care Building, 4th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3800

Name: Michael Naylor
About: Dr. Michael Naylor is the director of the Behavioral Health and Welfare Program at UI Health. Dr. Naylor's clinical interests include child and adult psychiatry, general psychiatry, and sleep disorders medicine, and he is an expert in child and adolescent mood disorders and psychopharmacology. He is affiliated with the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry (AACAP), the Illinois Council of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry (ICCAP), and the Association of Professional Sleep Societies (APSS), and he has received the AACAP Norbert and Charlotte Rieger Service Program Award for Excellence as director of the Behavioral Health and Welfare Program. Dr. Naylor also serves as director of the Clinical Services in Psychopharmacology Program at UI Health.
Location: Institute for Juvenile Research, Room 155, 1747 W. Roosevelt Road, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7723

Name: Sergey Neckrysh
About: Dr. Sergey Neckrysh is the chief of Spine Surgery at UI Health. He is a board-certified neurological surgeon specializing in the treatment of complex spinal conditions. Dr. Neckrysh focuses his clinical practice on revision surgery and complex spine reconstruction for failed back syndrome, adult and pediatric scoliosis, primary and metastatic spinal tumors, as well as degenerative conditions and spinal trauma. Dr. Neckrysh has been in practice for more than 18 years.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Christine Neeb
About: Dr. Christine Neeb is a family medicine physician at the Mile Square Health Center-Main location. Dr. Neeb focuses on care of the whole patient and feels that patients do best when their physical and mental health is treated at the same time. She has a particular interest in substance-use disorders, including management of opioid-use disorder with buprenorphine or methadone, and management of alcohol-use disorders.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL  60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Erin Neuschler
About: Dr. Erin Neuschler practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Neuschler specializes in breast imaging. As part of the Center for Breast Care, she interprets mammograms, breast ultrasound, and breast MRI; she also performs breast biopsies in these modalities.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago , IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Alison Newman
About: Dr. Alison Newman is a Clinical Health Psychologist in the Bariatric Surgery Program at UI Health. Dr. Newman specializes in conducting pre-surgical psychological evaluations for patients pursuing bariatric surgery. She also follows patients pre- and post-operatively to address any co-morbidities or concerns related to surgery or weight loss.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312-355-3463

Name: Megan Ngetich
About: Megan Ngetich is a physical therapist in Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Ms. Ngetich evaluates and treats a variety of orthopedic conditions, including post-operative rehab, breast cancer rehab, and work-related injuries.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Ryan Nguyen
About: Dr. Ryan H. Nguyen is a physician and researcher in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. As a medical oncologist, Dr. Nguyen specializes in the care of patients living with lung cancer and melanoma. He works with patients and families to ensure they are receiving personalized and compassionate care. Dr. Nguyen also develops and conducts clinical trials of new medicines and tests with the goal of helping patients with cancer live longer and healthier lives. His research work is focused on ensuring that new discoveries in cancer research benefit patients equitably.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Terry Nicola
About: Dr. Terry Nicola is the director of Sports Medicine Rehabilitation at UI Health. Dr. Nicola's specialties include orthopaedic sports medicine, physical medicine, and rehabilitation. His practice includes the evaluation and treatment of sports and work-related injuries and the management of nonsurgical musculoskeletal and neuromuscular conditions. Dr. Nicola has received numerous teaching and hospital awards, and he served in the United States Olympic Committee for the Salt Lake City Olympic Games.
Location: Sports Medicine & Human Performance Center, Suite 102, 839 W. Roosevelt Road, Chicago, IL 60608, 312.355.4404

Name: Craig Niederberger
About: Dr. Craig Niederberger is a board certified urologist at UI Health. Dr. Niederberger specializes in male reproductive medicine. He is also the Clarence C Saelhof Professor.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 2nd Floor, 1009 S. Wood. St., Chicago, IL 60612, P: 312.440.5127 | F: 312.355.2983

Name: Matthew Niemeyer
About: Dr. Matthew Niemeyer practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Niemeyer specializes in interventional radiology and diagnostic radiology.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Room 2483, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0241

Name: Franklin Njoku
About: Dr. Franklin Njoku is an internist in the Sickle Cell Program at UI Health Dr. Njoku provides individualized care to sickle cell patients in the clinic, during hospitalization, and at the acute care center.
Location: University Of Illinois Hospital, 5th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.9287

Name: Bamncedile Nkosi
About: The Rev. Bamncedile (Sydwell) Nkosi is a staff chaplain in Pastoral Care Services at UI Health. Mr. Nkosi is the evening staff chaplain who provides a compassionate, warm, and peaceful presence for patients, families, and staff. He is emotionally available and sensitive to the joys and struggles of others, he and brings an empathic and supportive presence to individuals of all diverse backgrounds, cultures, and religions. Mr. Nkosi models best practices in teamwork and bereavement support for patients, families, and staff. In addition to English, Rev. Nkosi also speaks Swazi, Zulu, and Afrikaans.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite 2009, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.413.3600

Name: Richard Novak
About: Dr. Richard Novak is the Head of the Division of Infectious Diseases at UI Health, where he has worked for the past 35 years, dividing his time between teaching, research and patient care. Dr. Novak has been actively involved in HIV clinical care for 30 years and serves as the Director of the UIC Community Clinic Network (UCCN), which he began in 1991, and is largely supported by the Ryan White Care Act, Parts A and C.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337

Name: Priti Nuthakki
About: Dr. Priti Marwaha Nuthakki specializes in the care of patients with cirrhosis, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, hepatitis B and C, hepatocellular carcinoma, and autoimmune liver disease. As part of the Liver Transplant team at UI Health, Dr. Marwaha also evaluates patients in need of transplantation and is part of their post-transplant care team.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7598

Name: Chika Nwachukwu
About: Dr. Chika Nwachukwu is a doctoral-prepared nurse practitioner in the Sickle Cell Acute Care Center at UI Health. Dr. Nwachukwu evaluates and treats patients who are experiencing a vaso-occlusive pain crisis and uses multimodal pain-relief strategies to manage sickle cell pain. Her research interests include sickle cell disease, health education, pain management, and health disparities.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 5th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.5680

Name: Jeremy O’Neal
About: Jeremy O'Neal is a licensed registered dietitian in the Bariatric Surgery Program at UI Health. Jeremy has a passion for weight-loss nutrition, nutrition education, and meal planning. He provides patients with individualized nutrition education, focusing on each patient's strengths and areas of improvement. Jeremy's focuses include stress-free lifestyle behavior changes along with small, easy-to-manage goals that lead to long-term success.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.5100

Name: Samuel Ohlander
About: Dr. Samuel Ohlander practices in the Department of Urology at UI Health. Dr. Ohlander specializes in male infertility, fertility preservation, low testosterone, vasectomies, and microsurgical vasectomy reversals. He also treats patients with erectile dysfunction, sexual dysfunction, penile prosthesis implantation, and Peyronie's disease (abnormal penile curvature). Dr. Ohlander is a member of several prominent urologic societies, including the American Urologic Association, American Society for Reproductive Medicine, Sexual Medicine Society, and the Chicago Urologic Society.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 2nd Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2779

Name: Chukwudi Okpala
About: Dr. Chukwudi Okpala's interests are in managing pain of various disorders via multi-modal approaches, utilizing physical therapy, pain psychotherapy, and interventional pain procedures. He is also interested in the field of neuromodulation, and specifically, procedures such as spinal cord stimulation and dorsal root ganglion stimulation for the management of other pain disorders.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4020

Name: Peter Orris
About: Dr. Peter Orris is Chief of Occupational & Environmental Medicine at UI Health, and he has more than four decades' experience practicing occupational & environmental medicine in the Chicago area.
Location: Occupational and Environmental Medicine, Suite E144M, 835 S. Wolcott Ave., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7420

Name: Shayna Oshita
About: Dr. Shayna Oshita is a registered dietitian and certified diabetes educator at UI Health. Dr. Oshita specializes in nutrition & wellness and chronic disease management, including diabetes. Her goal is to help patients achieve their healthy lifestyle goals while considering specific disease-related recommendations. Dr. Oshita's appointments incorporate dietetic interns to provide care and help educate, counsel, and support patients in their efforts.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000 (Mile Square), 722 W. Maxwell St., Family Medicine Center at University Village, Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901 (University Village)

Name: Amanda Osta
About: Dr. Amanda Osta is Director of the Pediatric Residency Program at UI Health. Dr. Osta's clinical interests involve supporting families with all aspects of the care of their children, from newborns through adolescents, and she has particular interest in breastfeeding support. Her research interests include graduate medical education; identification of adverse childhood experiences and unmet social needs; and building resilience in children, their families, and pediatric providers. Dr. Osta also is the Division Chief for Education in the Department of Pediatrics.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Jovonne Owens
About: Jovonne Owens is a nurse practitioner in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. Ms. Owens provides care for those living with cancer, and their families, from diagnosis through treatment, survivorship, and end-of-life. She works with oncologists focused on solid-tumor cancers to provide care for patients receiving treatments that include chemotherapy, targeted therapy, and concurrent chemotherapy and radiation. She also is part of the Breast Cancer Survivorship Clinic at UI Health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1e, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Burce Ozgen Mocan
About: Dr. Burce Ozgen Mocan practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Ozgen Mocan specializes in clinical diagnosis services with CT and MRI interpretation for neurological disorders in the brain, spine, head, and neck. Her clinical and research interests are in head and neck imaging.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago , IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Valentina Pacheco-Cornejo
About: Dr. Valentina M. Pacheco-Cornejo is a child and adolescent psychologist in the Department of Psychiatry at UI Health. Dr. Pacheco-Cornejo's interests include developmental and behavioral pediatrics; disruptive behaviors; developmental disabilities, including learning problems, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), and autism spectrum disorder; trauma; and spiritual and cultural alienation. She has worked predominantly with child and adolescent populations in school settings, developmental disabilities clinics, community mental health centers, and hospital-affiliated community health centers. Her experience includes providing crisis intervention; psychoeducation; child-custody forensic evaluations; and therapy and testing services to children, adolescents, and families who presented with a range of concerns, from stress-related issues and somatic problems to trauma, mood, and serious behavioral disturbances. Dr. Pacheco-Cornejo is passionate about extending the accessibility of mental health services to and reducing maladaptive behaviors in youths, in addition to integrating spirituality and issues of diversity in her practice.
Specialty: Child and adolescents with disruptive behaviors
Developmental disabilities (learning problems, ADHD, and Autism Spectrum Disorder)
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Back of the Yards, 4630 S. Bishop St., Chicago, IL 60609, 312.996.2000, Mile Square Health Center–Cicero, 4745–51 W. Cermak Road, Cicero, IL 60804, 312.996.2000

Name: Nina Pagaduan
About: Nina Pagaduan is a nurse practitioner in the Division of Hematology/Oncology at UI Health. Ms. Pagaduan specializes in providing individualized care for patients with blood cancers and those undergoing bone marrow transplantation.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Jaime Palmer
About: Dr. Jaime Palmer practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Palmer sees patients of all ages, and has a special interest in working with the LGBTQ+ community. Her clinical focus includes reproductive health, transgender health, and medication-assisted treatment (MAT) for opioid addiction.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Lopa Pandya
About: Dr. Lopa Pandya is a reconstructive surgeon in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Pandya specializes in treating various pelvic floor disorders, urinary issues, and pelvic organ prolapse. Her clinical interests include minimally invasive surgery, surgical outcomes, and finding ways to improve patients' quality of life. She believes in share decision making, and she focuses on helping patients choose the treatment option that is best for them; oftentimes, patients are able to achieve major improvements in their quality of life with relatively simple treatments. The best part of her job is hearing about all the activities women are able to enjoy again once their symptoms improve. Call 312.413.5096 to get in touch with a Women's Pelvic health provider.
Specialty: Female Pelvic Medicine and Reconstructive Surgery
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500

Name: Michael Papadimitriou
About: Dr. Michael Papadimitriou is a surgeon in the Department of Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery at UI Health. His clinical interests include dentoalveolar surgery, outpatient anesthesia, bone grafting, dental implants, pathology, and the management of maxillofacial trauma. He is a clinical assistant professor in the Department of Oral & Maxillofacial Surgery at the UIC College of Dentistry. In addition to his teaching activities, Dr. Papadimitriou maintains a private practice in the Chicagoland area.
Location: College of Dentistry, Room 110, 801 S. Paulina St., Chicago, Illinois 60612, 312.996.7460

Name: Andrea Pappalardo
About: Dr. Andrea A. Pappalardo practices in the Division of Pediatric Allergy-Immunology at UI Health. Dr. Pappalardo specializes in the care of patients with asthma and environmental, food, and drug allergies. She also treats adult and child patients with atopic (eczema) and contact dermatitis. Dr. Pappalardo works with her patients to find the best, most comprehensive approach to their medical care, and she believes that the family, physicians, and medical neighborhood should work together in addressing allergy and asthma problems. Dr. Pappalardo serves as the asthma medical director in the Coordination of Healthcare for Complex Kids (CHECK) program, and her research focuses on addressing health disparities in asthma.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 2E, 1801 W Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416 (Child & Youth Center), Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2740 (Adult Allergy)

Name: C. Park
About: Dr. C. Lucy Park practices in the Division of Pediatric Allergy, Immunology, & Pulmonology at UI Health. Dr. Park treats children with asthma, allergies, immunodeficiency, and respiratory illness. Her interests also include food allergies, atopic dermatitis (eczema), and other allergic conditions. Dr. Park has been practicing in Chicago for more than 30 years, and she has been voted as one of the Best Doctors in Chicago by her peers in Pediatric Allergy and Immunology. She is an associate professor of clinical pediatrics at the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 2E, 1801 W. Taylor Str., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6714

Name: Gye Park
About: Dr. Gye Y. Park specializes in asthma, COPD, lung cancer, & intervention bronchoscopy.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3300

Name: Nina Paroff
About: Dr. Nina Paroff practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Paroff provides a full spectrum of preventative health and wellness care for children, adults, and older adults. She has special interests in chronic disease management and women's health, including family planning, cancer screenings, prenatal care, and obstetric care. Dr. Paroff enjoys helping patients set their personal health goals and working together to achieve them.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–South Shore, 7037 S. Stony Island Aves., Chicago, IL  60649, 312.996.2000

Name: Mary Pasquinelli
About: Mary Pasquinelli is a nurse practitioner in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, Sleep, and Allergy at UI Health. Ms. Pasquinelli specializes in lung cancer and lung cancer screening, and pulmonary nodule management. She sees patients in the pulmonary clinic who have pulmonary nodules; need screening for lung cancer; and want to quit smoking (smoking cessation). She also sees patients diagnosed with lung cancer in the Medical Oncology Clinic.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C (Pulmonary), 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3300, Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E (Medical Oncology), 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1625

Name: Pravin Patel
About: For more than two decades, Dr. Pravin Patel has been caring for children with deformities that involve the skull and facial bones (craniofacial and maxillofacial surgery). This includes children with abnormal development of the skull as a result of craniosynostosis (fused skull joints or sutures), abnormal position of the orbits of the eye (hyperteleorbitism), malpositioned jaws (overgrowth and undergrowth of the upper and lower jaw bones), conditions such as hemifacial microsomia, Treacher Collins syndrome, and children born with facial clefts (cleft lip and palate). Dr. Patel has many years of experience in caring for children and young adults with congenital birth defects.
Location: Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Mahesh Patel
About: Dr. Patel provides a broad range of clinical infectious diseases services. Dr. Patel has a particular interest in patients with HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, Staph Aureus, and bloodstream infections.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337

Name: Krishna Patel
About: Krishna Patel is a nurse practitioner in the Diabetes Center & Endocrinology Clinic at UI Health. Ms. Patel provides individualized care to patients with diabetes, thyroid, and other endocrine disorders. Her special interest is educating patients about diabetes, helping them reduce or eliminate the need for medication with lifestyle modifications.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Saurabhkumar Patel
About: Dr. Saurabh Patel practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health, specializing in Neonatal-Perinatal Medicine. Dr. Patel's clinical and research interests include neonatal respiratory physiology, neonatal resuscitation, assisted ventilation of the neonate, and pulmonary hypertension in preterm infants. He has an interest in medical education and learning through simulation, and he is actively involved in mentoring residents and Neonatal-Perinatal fellows.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 5th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1777

Name: Pritesh Patel
About: Dr. Pritesh Patel is the assistant director of Blood & Marrow Transplantation at UI Health. Dr. Patel's clinical practice focuses on patients with multiple myeloma and patients with blood cancers undergoing stem cell/bone marrow transplant. His clinical research focuses on improving outcomes of stem cell/bone marrow transplantation patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Tushar Patel
About: Dr. Tushar Patel is a pathologist and the Director of Pathology Informatics in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. In this role, Dr. Patel leverages and studies the use of data and technology to improve patient care. His clinical practice focuses on kidney diseases in patients, including those who have undergone a kidney transplant.
Specialty: Native and transplant medical renal diseases
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3886

Name: Vrunda Patel
About: Dr. Vrunda Patel is a nurse practitioner in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, Sleep, and Allergy at UI Health. Dr. Patel is passionate about supporting and empowering all patients suffering from a broad range of conditions, including allergic rhinitis, chronic rhinosinusitis, hives, asthma, and food and drug allergies. She provides allergy skin testing and patch testing to help diagnose and develop appropriate management plans. She values relationships with her patients and sees herself as a partner in patient care, working together to help patients understand and manage their allergies and asthma.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2740

Name: Pritikanta Paul
About: Dr. Pritikanta Paul practices in the Department of Neurology at UI Health. Dr. Paul specializes in nerve and muscle diseases, and he treats patients with chronic neuromuscular conditions like muscular dystrophy, chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP), ALS, and myasthenia gravis. Dr. Paul evaluates patients presenting with symptoms of tingling/numbness and/or muscle weakness, and he performs EMG to help diagnose neuromuscular conditions.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0150

Name: Meredith Pavicic
About: Dr. Meredith Pavicic practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Pavicic has a background in global community health, and her interests include quality improvement and care of pregnant women with substance-use disorder. Her research interests focus on intimate partner violence, and she has led which led to multiple regional presentations on the topic.
Specialty: Care of pregnant women with substance-use disorder
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7500, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Justin Payette
About: Dr. Justin Payette is a physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Dr. Payette specializes in sports physical therapy, including the evaluation and treatment of sports conditions. He also is part of the Concussion Management Program at UI Health, and he provides screening and treatment for physical systems impaired by concussion from sports. Dr. Payette has additional interests in injury prevention, sports medicine, and academics.
Location: Physical Therapy Faculty Practice, Room 336, 1640 W. Roosevelt Rd., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.413.8043

Name: Mallari Peace
About: Mallari Peace is a nurse practitioner in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. Ms. Peace cares for patients of all ages, and her clinical interests include hypertension, diabetes, HIV, and mental healthcare.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Englewood, 641 W. 63rd St., Chicago, IL 60620, 312.996.2000

Name: Laura Pedelty
About: Dr. Laura Pedelty is Chief of the UI Health Neurobehavioral Section of the Department of Neurology, and a member of the Stroke section. She takes care of inpatient stroke patients and does outpatient assessment and care of patients who have had strokes and patients with mental disorders. Dr. Pedelty's interests include Alzheimer's disease and other dementias, cognitive and behavioral changes after stroke, stroke prevention, and recovery from ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: John Penalosa
About: John Penalosa is a wound care physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. As part of the comprehensive wound care team, he provides physical therapy wound care treatments for patients with difficult and nonhealing wounds, and he is dedicated to helping people with difficult wounds return to their home and community activities.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3701

Name: Omar Perez
About: Dr. Omar Perez is a clinician-scientist in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. As the Associate Director of Clinical Microbiology, Dr. Perez focuses on providing cutting-edge diagnostic testing to identify disease-causing pathogens. He works alongside clinicians to help diagnose etiological agents of infectious-disease illness and in selecting the best treatment options for patients. Dr. Perez also is active in basic and translational research studying pathogen-host interactions. He is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Pathology at the University of Illinois College of Medicine, and he also is a military microbiologist with the United States Army Reserves.
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.9650

Name: Alejandra Perez-Tamayo
About: Dr. Alejandra Perez-Tamayo is a surgeon in the Division of Colon & Rectal Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Perez-Tamayo specializes in colon and rectal cancer; inflammatory bowel disease; diverticular disease; pelvic floor dysfunction and disorders; and anorectal disease.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.2061

Name: L. Amanda Perry
About: Dr. L. Amanda Perry practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Perry is board-certified in Family Medicine and Geriatrics, and she sees patients at all stages of life. She specializes in geriatric medicine, home visits, LGBTQ-inclusive care, pregnancy care, reproductive health, office procedures, and chronic disease management. She is the program director of the Family Medicine Residency and the medical director of the UI Health Family Medicine Home Visit Program.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W.Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2901

Name: Stephen Pesanti
About: Dr. Stephen Pesanti practices in the Department of Psychiatry at UI Health. Dr. Pesanti specializes in general adult psychiatry and forensic psychiatry. He earned an MBA in Multi-Sector Health Management at St. George's University.
Location: Neuropsychiatric Institute (NPI), 4th Floor, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2200

Name: Timothy Peterson
About: Dr. Timothy Peterson is a family medicine physician at the Mile Square Health Center-Back of the Yards location. Dr. Peterson provides full-spectrum care to patients of all ages and backgrounds, and his clinical interest include chronic disease management, reproductive health, and treatment for substance-use disorders.
Location: Mile Square Health Center – Back of the Yards, 4630 S. Bishop St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Jessica Petreski
About: Jessica Petreski is a physician assistant in the Department of Dermatology at UI Health. Ms. Petreski focuses on general and cosmetic dermatology with a special interest in acne, psoriasis, complete skin examinations, neurotoxins, and fillers.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8666

Name: Sadie Pierce-Mulligan
About: Sadie Pierce-Mulligan is a registered dietitian at UI Health. Sadie specializes in nutrition education for general nutrition/healthy eating, weight management, heart failure, and other cardiovascular diseases. She helps patients create an individualized plan that works for their lifestyle and will lead them to accomplish their long-term nutrition/health goals. Sadie uses motivational interviewing techniques to guide patients in making changes that will last a lifetime and help them prevent, treat, and manage their chronic diseases.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: De-Ann Pillers
About: Dr. De-Ann Pillers is the head of the Section of Neonatology at UI Health. In her role, Dr. Pillers assures the continued success of clinical neonatology programs and supports the scholarly pursuit of excellence in newborn medicine.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 4th Floor (NICU), 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.4150

Name: Neil Pliskin
About: Dr. Neil Pliskin is a board certified clinical neuropsychologist and director of neuropsychology services at UI Health. He has over 25 years of experience working as a clinical neuropsychologist and directing clinical neuropsychology training programs. Dr. Pliskin has strong scientific and clinical interests in memory disorders, neuropsychological symptoms of medical illness (MS, dementia, renal disease) and in particular brain trauma (electrical shock injuries). He is a former president of the Society for Clinical Neuropsychology, Division 40 of APA.
Location: Neuropsychiatry & Psycological Services, 1st floor, 912 South Wood Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2200

Name: Anne Polick
About: Dr. Anne Polick specializes in internal medicine with an emphasis on preventative medicine.  Her particular areas of interest include women's health, chronic disease management, and quality improvement.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627

Name: Julie Polt
About: Julie Polt is a physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Ms. Polt provides pelvic health rehabilitation for women, men, transgender, and gender non-binary. She treats patients with peripartum lumbopelvic pain; chronic pelvic pain; bowel and bladder incontinence; organ prolapse, bowel & bladder dysfunction; and pelvic floor dysfunction. She is passionate about providing high-quality care in a caring and friendly environment.
Location: Outpatient Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5731

Name: Anna Porter
About: Dr. Anna Porter is a board certified nephrologist at UI Health. Dr. Porter's clinical interests are end-stage renal disease and chronic kidney diseases. She has more than 10 years of experience.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569

Name: Mark Potter
About: Dr. Mark Potter is a Family Medicine physician at UI Health. Dr Potter has expertise in maternity care including prenatal care and delivery. Dr. Potter provides care for all members of a family including children and adults. He also has special interests in caring for people from all walks of life, and in improving the health system.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, Suite 235, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Bharati Prasad
About: Dr. Prasad is board certified in Pulmonary, Critical Care, and Sleep Medicine. She completed her medical training at UIC in 2009. Her special interest is sleep-disordered breathing and its relationship with cardiovascular disease.
Location: UI Health Sleep Science Center, Suite 104, 2242 West Harrison Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7708

Name: Marzena Przeszlo
About: Marzena Przeszlo is a staff chaplain in Pastoral Care Services at UI Health. Ms. Przeszlo provides spiritual and emotional support for patient, families, and staff. Her care services focus on the poor, homeless, and immigrants by working as part of the interdisciplinary team to see the patient as a whole person. Ms. Przeszlo also assists medical teams as an interpreter for the Polish population. She also serves the hospital community as a certified eucharistic minister.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite 2009, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0296

Name: Chad Purnell
About: Dr. Chad Purnell is surgeon in the Division of Plastic, Reconstructive, and Cosmetic Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Purnell performs plastic surgery of the whole body including microsurgical breast, limb, and head and neck reconstruction, and cosmetic surgeries such as rhinoplasty, blepharoplasty (eye lift), and facelift. He specializes in aesthetic and reconstructive surgery of the head and neck, including treatment of facial fractures, orthognathic (jaw) surgery, facial reconstruction after skin cancer (Mohs) surgery, and the treatment of congenital facial abnormalities. Dr. Purnell sees both children and adult patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Allen Putterman
About: Dr. Allen Putterman is an ophthalmologist with over 40 years of experience. He specializes in treating blepharitis, entropion, ptosis and thyroid orbitopathy. Dr. Putterman is one of the approximately 300 doctors in the United States to have an approved oculofacial plastic surgery fellowship.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: John Quigley
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Jon Radosta
About: Dr. Jon Radosta is the Interim Chief Medical Officer at UI Health. As a primary care physician, Dr. Radosta has served in a number of leadership roles at UI Health focused on improving patient care and quality, patient and physician satisfaction, and clinical financial performance, including as the Clinic Medical Director for Primary Care Plus/Internal Medicine and the Senior Medical Director for Managed Care. As Co-Chief Medical Information Officer for Epic Implementation, Dr. Radosta spearheaded changes across the UI Health enterprise to improve the patient experience and clinical workflows through a new unified electronic health record and financial system. His clinical interests include quality improvement and population health research. Dr. Radosta is the Assistant Dean for Clinical Affairs in the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Aarti Raghavan
About: Dr. Aarti Raghavan is a neonatologist in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Raghavan provides care for high-risk newborn patients, such as those born extremely prematurely or with complications needing surgical interventions, and newborns with genetic abnormalities and other organ-specific complications. This care begins from the delivery room and encompasses the entire duration of the child's stay in the NICU or Special Care Nursery. Dr. Raghavan is skilled in neonatal resuscitation; complex neonatal procedures; patient-centered care and family-centered rounds; and uses a collaborative decision-making model.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 4th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.4150

Name: Ciro Ramos Estebanez
About: Dr. Ciro Ramos-Estebanez is the chief of the Section of Neurocritical Care at UI Health. A physician-scientist, Dr. Ciro specializes in critical care neurology, noninvasive brain stimulation research, and MRI research. Dr. Ramos-Estebanez's is an innovator who has produced basic science and clinical manuscripts in a number of neurological journals. His research interests include vascular cognitive impairment (VCI), and he is a member of the multinational Vascular Impairment of Cognition Classification Consensus Study (VICCS). His research also focuses on noninvasive brain stimulation and behavioral neurophysiology, and he has developed a number novel technologies in this area. In addition, he has developed a new MRI sequence that measures the cerebral metabolic rate and blood brain barrier permeability in-vivo. Dr. Ramos-Estebanez's other clinical research achievements have focused on neurocritical care and include novel diagnostic criteria for a neurocritical care condition, and a first description in the literature of a heroin complication in the central nervous system.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1528

Name: Matthew Ranzer
About: Dr. Matthew Ranzer is a surgeon in the Division of Plastic, Reconstructive, and Cosmetic Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Ranzer's clinical practice specializes in general surgery, plastic surgery, and cosmetic surgery, and he has a special interest in body contouring for both gender affirmation and post-weight loss.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.6600

Name: Anil Rao
About: Dr. Anil Rao practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Rao's clinical interests including pediatric imaging and sports medicine imaging, and he has a focus on radiation-reduction techniques. He is a patient-care advocate and works closely with the care team to help provide the most appropriate and optimal care possible for each patient.
Specialty: Pediatric body and musculoskeletal imaging, including MRI
Application of newer cross-sectional imaging techniques
Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning applications
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Phornphat Rasamimari
About: Dr. Phornphat "Paul" Rasamimari practices in the Division of Neonatology at UI Health. As a pediatric neonatologist, Dr. Rasamimari provides full clinical support to premature and sick babies in the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) to ensure that they will grow up healthy and with a good quality of life. His areas of interest include respiratory failure, noninvasive ventilation management, work ethics and quality improvement in NICU, and long-term neurodevelopmental outcomes of NICU patients after they return home.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 4th Floor (NICU), 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.4150

Name: Charles Ray
About: Dr. Charles Ray, Jr. is a board certified Radiologist with certifications from the American Board of Radiology in Diagnostic Radiology and Certificate of Added Qualification in Interventional Radiology. He completed fellowship in Vascular and Interventional Radiology at Massachusetts General Hospital, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA. and completed Residency in Diagnostic Radiology at the University of Illinois at Chicago. He completed Medical School at Rush Medical College, Chicago.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3737

Name: Miriam Redleaf
About: Dr. Miriam Redleaf is an otologist/neurotologist and ear surgeon in the Department of Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Redleaf's clinical interests include treating ear and facial nerve tumors and cholesteatoma, and performing cochlear implantation. She enjoys a local reputation as an outstanding ear surgeon and educator, and a national reputation for initiating and maintaining surgical educational programs in Ethiopia. Dr. Redleaf is one of just two women to receive the American Otological Society Award of Merit, the field's highest honor, and she has author nearly 100 peer-reviewed publications on ear problems and their solutions.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Jenna Reeh
About: Jenna Reeh is a stroke and rehabilitation nurse practitioner in the Comprehensive Stroke Program at UI Health. Ms. Reeh provides education and clinical care to support stroke patients as they move through the continuum of care, and her focus is on optimizing communication between members of the care team to address the difficulties patients may have in navigating the healthcare system. She is actively involved in community engagement programs to deliver stroke care and prevention education to UI Health's surrounding patient communities.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Johnna Reggi
About: Johnna Reggi is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Ms. Reggi provides full-scope midwifery care in both the outpatient and hospital settings, and her interests include special interests include unmedicated childbirth, prenatal education, adolescent gynecology, and contraceptive counseling. She provides comprehensive education in women's health and promotes shared decision making.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000, Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Jalees Rehman
About: Dr. Jalees Rehman practices in the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Rehman is a stem cell researcher and cell biologist whose clinical interests are focused on preventive cardiology and the effects of exercise and lifestyle on cardiovascular health. He can advise patients on recent clinical studies and how they can be best used to improve their health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6481

Name: David Reisberg
About: Dr. David Reisberg received his dental degree from Case Western Reserve University in 1977. He went on to receive a specialty certificate in Prosthodontics from Tufts University in Boston and one in Maxillofacial Prosthetics from The University of Chicago. He has been Director of the Maxillofacial Prosthetics Clinic at the University of Illinois Hospital & Health Sciences System since 1981. In 1998, he was named Medical Director of The Craniofacial Center, a position he held until 2010. He has served on the Board of Directors of the American Academy of Maxillofacial Prosthetics and is president-elect of that organization.  He is past president of the International Society for Maxillofacial Rehabilitation and the Illinois Association for Cleft/Craniofacial Teams and the current president of Ameriface, a national organization that supports people with facial differences. Dr. Reisberg is certified by the American Board of Prosthodontics. He has lectured nationally and internationally and is recognized as an authority on the application of osseointegrated implants for craniofacial rehabilitation.
Location: Craniofacial Center, Suite 161, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Natalie Reizine
About: Dr. Natalie Reizine is a physician and researcher in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. As a medical oncologist, Dr. Reizine specializes in treating genitourinary cancers, including prostate, kidney, bladder, and germ cell tumors. She strives to be her patients' advocate and to facilitate shared decision-making. Dr. Reizine's research interests include developing and designing clinical trials to improve personalized treatment approaches for cancer patients. She studies how genes impact her patients' response to medications and therapies, and she hopes to reduce her patients' toxicities to treatment while maximizing their therapeutic benefits.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Sirimon Reutrakul
About: Dr. Sirimon Reutrakul practices in the Division of Endocrinology, Diabetes, and Metabolism at UI Health. Dr. Reutrakul specializes in treating type 1 and type 2 diabetes, and she has a clinical interest in glucose metabolism.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Ana Ricardo
About: Dr. Ana C. Ricardo is a kidney doctor at UI Health.  Dr. Ricardo's specialties include treating people with acute and chronic kidney diseases, fluid and electrolyte disorders, geriatric nephrology, and high blood pressure.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Amber Rideout
About: Amber Rideout is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Amber specializes in low-risk pregnancy and birth, gynecology/well-woman care, family planning, and contraception management. She is passionate about working with Black, indigenous, and people of color (BIPOC), improving health disparities, community health, and providing culturally competent and patient-centered care.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000, Mile Square Health Center–Englewood, 641 W. 63rd St., Chicago, IL 60621, 312.996.2000

Name: Glenda Rios
Location: Mile Square Health Center, Back of the Yards, 4630 S. Bishop St., Chicago, IL 60608, 773.523.2615

Name: Luis Rivera
About: Dr. Luis Rivera practices in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Rivera treats patients of all ages, and he enjoys helping patients manage chronic health conditions, including mental health, and focusing on preventative health services to keep patients healthy. He also performs many office-based procedures and provides reproductive health services. Dr. Rivera has a special interest in the care of Spanish-speaking patients.
Location: Pilsen Family Health Center Lower West, 1713 S. Ashland Ave., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.413.4179

Name: Insia Rizvi
About: Dr. Insia Rizvi practices in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. Dr. Rizvi specializes in sickle cell disease, and she provides full-spectrum, evidence-based, individualized and compassionate care to sickle cell patients in outpatient, inpatient, and acute care settings. She also involved in the clinical research program in the Division of Hematology & Oncology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Kelly Robinson
About: Kelly Robinson is a licensed physical therapist in the Department of Rehabilitation at UI Health. As part of the interdisciplinary team, Ms. Robinson works with patients throughout their stay to focus on mobility. She enjoys working with patients with neurological disorders to improve function and allow them to return to home and the community.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Adam Rodos
About: Dr. Adam Rodos is a physician and hospitalist in the Department of Emergency Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Rodos specializes in emergency, internal, and observation medicine; quality improvement, and patient safety. He strives to provide quality, evidence-based, patient-focused care to all patients.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 866.600.2273

Name: Marko Rojnica
About: Dr. Marko Rojnica practices in the Division of Pediatric Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Rojnica specializes in the surgical treatment of a number of abdominal and chest problems in children, from birth to young adulthood. His clinical interests include in caring for children with birth defects; hernias; intestinal, lung, and esophagus issues; chest wall deformities; and children with tumors of the abdomen and chest. Patient and family communication, education, and participation are critical parts of Dr. Rojnica's practice and provide the cornerstone for healing. His other areas of interest include surgical innovation and surgical education of students and residents.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Eric Romain
About: Dr. Romain specializes in treating all disorders of the foot and ankle, including diabetic wound care, limb salvage, deformity correction, and musculoskeletal injuries.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1300

Name: Joann Romano-Keeler
About: Dr. Joann Romano-Keeler is a neonatologist in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Romano-Keeler's clinical and research interests include neonatal nutrition and optimization of growth during the newborn period. She is Director of the Neonatal Transport Team, and she also cares for patients and their families in the NICU neurodevelopmental follow-up clinic.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 4th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Gina Romero
About: Gina Romero is an advanced practice registered nurse at the Craniofacial Center at UI Health. Ms. Romero takes great pride in educating her patients and their families and assisting them every step of the way throughout their surgical journeys. She has more than 10 years of nursing experience and currently is studying to obtain her Plastic Surgical Nurse certification (CPSN) with her growing passion for plastics, reconstructive, and cosmetic surgery.
Location: Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: James Ronayne
About: Dr. James Ronayne is a general pediatrician and a cognitive behavioral therapist. Dr. Ronayne offers general pediatrics services and has training in behavioral health including ADHD.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Damiano Rondelli
About: Dr. Damiano Rondelli is the Principal Investigator of clinical studies in stem cell transplantation for hematologic malignancies, such as high risk leukemia, lymphoma or myeloma, or myelofibrosis, and for patients with sickle cell anemia. He authored over 100 articles in peer-reviewed journals, multiple book chapters. Dr. Rondelli graduated at the Medical School of the University of Bologna, Italy, where he also completed his training in Hematology. He started his research on hematopoietic stem cell transplant immunology as Research Associate at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center in Seattle, WA. He was then Assistant Professor at the University of Bologna where he established his lab research and clinical work in the Allogeneic Bone Marrow Transplant unit. In 2002, he moved to the University of Illinois at Chicago as Director of the Blood and Marrow Transplant Program and in 2013 he was appointed Chief of the Division of Hematology/Oncology and is the Michael Reese Professor in Hematology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Janine Rosenberg
About: Dr. Janine Rosenberg is a pediatric psychologist at UI Health. Practicing at the Craniofacial Center, Dr. Rosenberg provides evaluation of and treatment for social-emotional, learning, developmental, behavioral, and adjustment disorders for children with craniofacial conditions and their families. She provides support and guidance for patients from birth to young adulthood and assesses how a craniofacial condition impacts the lives of patients and their families. In addition, Dr. Rosenberg is a vital resource when making decisions about whether the patient needs or is ready for more surgeries. She also provides psychological testing to provide comprehensive feedback about patients' learning, cognitive functioning, and attention. Dr. Rosenberg is actively involved in National Institutes of Health research studies assessing development in infants with craniosynostosis; quality of life of children and adolescents with cleft lip and palate; and treatment outcomes for infants with cleft.
Location: Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Mark Rosenblatt
About: Dr. Mark Rosenblatt is a corneal surgeon and a highly accomplished physician-scientist with a National Institutes of Health sponsored research program exploring mechanisms to regenerate corneal nerves following corneal injury. His primary focus is innovation and the translation of basic discoveries in the laboratory into relevant therapies for patients. Dr. Rosenblatt's clinical practice focuses on laser vision correction surgery and the treatment of cataracts and corneal disease. He is also the Illinois Lions/Charles I Young Endowed Chair in Ocular Research.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Robert Rosman
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Ari Rubenfeld
About: Dr. Ari B. Rubenfeld is a board-certified otolaryngologist who treats a range of head and neck issues in children as well as adults: nasal allergy and airway disorders, general conditions of the ear, non-malignant disorders of the head and neck, snoring, sleep apnea, and thyroid disorders. Dr. Rubenfeld is an Assistant Professor of Otolaryngology - Head and Neck Surgery at the University of Illinois.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Israel Rubinstein
About: Dr. Israel Rubinstein practices in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, Sleep & Allergy at UI Health. Dr. Rubinstein provides a broad range of diagnosis and treatment services for persons with a variety breathing or lung problems, ranging from acute illnesses to complex diseases. His specialties include nanomedicine, targeted drug delivery, and bioimaging.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.2740

Name: Catherine Rudnicki
About: Catherine Rudnicki is a physical therapist in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. She works with a variety of pediatric and orthopedic patients, including those with neuromuscular, orthopedic, and pulmonary needs.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Kay Rudnitsky
About: Kay Rudnitsky is assistant director of Inpatient Therapy Services at UI Health, including Acute Care Physical Therapy, Acute Care Occupational Therapy, and Behavioral Health Occupational Therapy. Ms. Rudnitsky's clinical experience includes acute care, acute rehabilitation, outpatient therapy, lymphedema therapy, and chronic disease self-management, with an emphasis on oncology. Her leadership interests include multidisciplinary work; quality improvement and program development; staff and student development; and making therapy as convenient and effective as possible for patients.  Ms. Rudnitsky holds a teaching appointment in the Department of Occupational Therapy at UIC, and she has been involved in campus initiatives around interprofessional education and collaborative care models with all kinds of professionals working together to improve patient care.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Mark Runge
About: Dr. Mark Runge is an orthodontist at the Craniofacial Center at UI Health. Dr. Runge has over 30 years of experience working with cleft palate and craniofacial patients, and his work at UI Health includes providing presurgical orthodontic care for patients who require reconstructive surgery. His research interests include the study of outcomes using 3D virtual treatment planning software for facial reconstruction, and he is interested in evaluating the success of jaw advancement surgery to improve the airway in patients who suffer from obstructive sleep apnea.
Location: Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Surya Sabhapathy
About: Dr. Surya Sabhapathy practices in the Department of Psychiatry at UI Health. Dr. Sabhapathy works in both the inpatient and outpatient settings at UI Health, and they focus on LGBTQ-affirming mental healthcare, emphasizing transgender, nonbinary, and other gender-expansive people. They also have special interests in perinatal mental health; complex trauma; and expanding access to comprehensive mental healthcare for underserved populations, particularly women, gender minorities, and BIPOC.
Specialty: Perinatal Mental Health (Pregnancy and Postpartum Care)
Location: Neuropsychiatric Institute, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2200

Name: Ashima Sahni
About: Dr. Ashima Sahni practices in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, Sleep, and Allergy at UI Health. Dr. Sahni specializes in sleep medicine, and she has a special interest in non-invasive ventilation, neuromuscular disease, and complex sleep-related breathing disorders. She also has a focus on the transition of inpatient/outpatient care for patients with sleep-related disorders.
Location: UI Health Sleep Science Center, Suite 104, 2242 W Harrison St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7708

Name: Sana Salih
About: Dr. Sana Salih is the director of the University of Illinois IVF Program. Dr. Salih offers compassionate and proficient care to patients with infertility and recurrent pregnancy loss. She assists individuals and couples achieve their family-building dreams in a compassionate and personalized manner. Her expertise in infertility and recurrent pregnancy loss promotes comprehensive evaluation and management, including advanced reproductive technology, such as in vitro fertilization (IVF), fertility preservation, and preimplantation genetic diagnosis.
Specialty: Ovulation Induction, Intrauterine Insemination, In vitro fertilization (IVF)
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4A, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.2634

Name: Harley Salinas
About: Harley Salinas is a nurse practitioner in the Diabetes Center & Endocrinology Clinic at UI Health. Harley is passionate about supporting and empowering all patients with diabetes from all walks of life. He sees himself as a partner in their diabetes care, and he values relationships with his patients as they establish their goals and needs. A member of the American Diabetes Association, Harley has worked for many years as a diabetes educator and has implemented church-based diabetes prevention programs in his community.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: George Salti
About: Dr. George Salti is a surgical oncologist at UI Health. Dr. Salti is a specialist in treating cancers in breast, stomach, pancreas, liver and biliary tract, colon and rectum. Dr. Salti is one of only a few surgeons in Illinois to treat late stage abdominal cancers with Hyperthermic Intraperitoneal Chemotherapy (HIPEC). He speaks multiple languages including French and Arabic.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Anita Sanchez
About: Anita Sanchez is a physical therapist in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. Dr. Sanchez treats a variety of conditions ranging from difficulty walking to sports injuries. She performs individualized manual therapy approaches and exercises prescription for clients who experience musculoskeletal, neurological, cardiopulmonary, and complex medical conditions. She also works collaboratively with the Center for Breast Care at UI Health to provide physical therapy after breast cancer procedures. Dr. Sanchez carries expertise in the rehabilitation of facial nerve disorders and part of the UI Health's Facial Nerve Multidisciplinary Center.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Christina Sands
About: Christina Sands is a board certified Nurse Practitioner. In collaboration with UIC's Gastroenterology team, she provides comprehensive services including health assessments, follow-ups, and management plans for patients living with gastrointestinal illness. Her special interests include patient education, nutrition, and diseases affecting the pancreas and biliary system.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 4th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7598, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Santosh Saraf
About: Dr. Santosh Saraf is an Assistant Professor of Medicine in the Division of Hematology/Oncology. After receiving his B.S. in Biology at Pennsylvania State University, he went to medical school at Temple University School of Medicine. Dr. Saraf completed his Internal Medicine Residency and Hematology-Oncology training at the University of Illinois Medical Center. He is currently an active member of the American Society of Hematology.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite 5E, 1740 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Nitu Saran
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 7N, 2nd Floor, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Robert Sargis
About: Dr. Robert Sargis practices in the Division of Endocrinology, Diabetes, and Metabolism at UI Health. Dr. Sargis' clinical practice focuses on the care of patients with diabetes and lipid disorders, and those experiencing hormonal abnormalities stemming from anti-cancer treatments. He has clinical and research interests in patients with diabetes and other endocrine disorders arising from environmental and occupational exposures. Dr. Sargis is deeply devoted to patient-centered care that emphasizes the importance of communication and a strong patient-physician alliance. Building clinical relationships upon trust and mutual understanding, he strives to empower patients to manage their medical conditions. Dr. Sargis looks forward to working with your healthcare team to provide you with the best possible care.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Edgar Sarmiento Jr
About: Edgar Sarmiento is an Advance Practice Nurse in the Emergency Department at UI Health. His emergency nursing experience includes trauma and adult and pediatric emergency care, and his clinical experience includes the treatment of burns and various musculoskeletal and orthopedic injuries. He is the lead nurse practitioner in the Emergency Department at UI Health and serves as preceptor to advance practice nursing students from University of Illinois at Chicago College of Nursing.
Location: O'Hare Urgent Care Clinic, Terminal 2 (Across from gate F3), Chicago, IL 60666, 773.894.5100

Name: Alexandria Saulsberry
About: The interests of Dr. Saulsberry include diagnosing and treating neurodevelopmental disorders (e.g., Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder [ADHD] and autism), and screening for intellectual disabilities and disorders of language and learning. Other clinical interests include oppositional defiant disorder. Her main research interest is behavioral interventions in children with ADHD. She also is involved with community education and parent advocacy within schools. She participates in such groups as Family Resource Center on Disabilities, Chicago Southside Autism Support Group, and Children and Adults with ADHD.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Josiah Sault
About: Dr. Josiah Sault is a physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Dr. Sault is the clinic coordinator for UI Health Physical Therapy University Village. He specializes in orthopaedic physical therapy and strives to provide individualized, evidence-informed, patient-centered care to help his patients meet their goals. Dr. Sault has completed a post-professional fellowship with a focus in orthopaedic manual physical therapy and he is certified in dry needling. Academically, he has lectured and mentored at both UIC and Northwestern in their post-professional physical therapy fellowship programs, teaching sections on wrist and hand and temporomandibular disorders; he also has taught in the UIC doctoral physical therapy program. Dr. Sault has published multiple peer-reviewed articles and continues to participate in research and publication.
Location: Outpatient Physical Therapy at Maxwell Street, 711 W Maxwell St, Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.2626

Name: Angelica Scanzera
About: Dr. Angelica Scanzera practices in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. Dr. Scanzera is fellowship-trained in fitting medically necessary contact lenses. She fits specialty soft, rigid gas permeable, hybrid, and scleral lenses. Dr. Scanzera is trained in the use of EyePrint PRO, an impression-based scleral lens used to improve vision, symptoms, and quality of life in patients suffering from severe corneal disease. Her clinical interests include improving vision from corneal irregularities, in addition to reducing symptoms from severe ocular surface disease. She is a fellow of the American Academy of Optometry and the Scleral Lens Education Society.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937), Millennium Park Eye Center, 30 N. Michigan Ave., Ste. 410, Chicago, IL 60602, 312.996.2020

Name: Cathleen Schaeffer
About: Cathleen Schaeffer is a breast nurse navigator in Cancer Services at UI Health. Ms. Schaeffer works throughout the continuum of care to address patient needs; reduce gaps in care; provide education and assist in informed decision making; improve timeliness of care; coordinate complex care plans; address barriers to care; improve quality of life for patients and their families; and develop plans for long-term and survivorship care after treatment. She is both an Oncology Certified Nurse and a Certified Breast Care Nurse.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E/3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3347

Name: Paul Schlesinger
About: Dr. Paul Schlesinger practices in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Dr. Schlesinger specializes in screening colonoscopy and video capsule endoscopy interpretations. He completed his fellowship, residency, and medical school at UIC, and he also is a clinical professor in the Department of Medicine.
Location: Back To Top

Name: Mary Lou Schmidt
About: Dr. Mary Lou Schmidt is a pediatric hematology and oncology expert at UI Health. Dr. Schmidt's clinical interests include Hemangioma, palliative care, and vascular formations. She treats adolescent and young adults with cancer and has been in practice for more than 30 years. Dr. Schmidt speaks multiple languages including Spanish.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Jaye Schreier
About: Dr. Jaye Schreier focuses on providing primary care for health maintenance. Dr. Schreier cares for acute and chronic health conditions.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Felicia Scott
About: Dr. Felicia Scott practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Scott specializes in Adolescent Medicine, providing healthcare to teens and young adults ages 11-25, and she has an interest in adolescent sexually transmitted infection (STI) prevention and treatment, and reproductive health. She believes in a patient-centered approach that includes family support, youth confidentiality and advocacy, and, above all, comprehensive adolescent healthcare. Dr. Scott's ultimate goal is to provide healthcare that aids in the successful transition into adulthood.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Shirley Scott
About: Shirley Scott is a women's health nurse practitioner at UI Health. Shirley has many years of experience as a maternal/child healthcare provider. She enjoys working with individuals from puberty to adulthood. Her specialties include breastfeeding support; postpartum and primary care; annual exams; family planning; preconception counseling; sexually transmitted infections; and menopause. The focus of her practice is to help her patients obtain optimal health.
Location: South Loop Physicians Group, Suite 100, 2600 S. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.492.0025

Name: Rosemary Seelaus
About: Rosemary Seelaus is senior anaplastologist at the UI Health Craniofacial Center. Ms. Seelaus' clinical practice specializes primarily in the treatment and fabrication of implant-retained facial prostheses and virtual surgical planning for facial reconstruction using 3D imaging & printing technologies. She maintains an emphasis on ensuring that an informed patient and family is central to defining treatment goals and successful outcomes. A leader in her field, Ms. Seelaus has lectured extensively worldwide on her clinical and technology expertise and has mentored graduate and postgraduate students both domestically and abroad. Her primary research interests are central to the clinical application of 3D digital and coloring technologies to define best practices and treatment outcomes for surgical and prosthetic reconstruction and rehabilitation of the head and neck. She has served on multiple professional, scientific, and editorial boards and committees for both research and clinical endeavors.
Location: UI Health Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Amanda Seguin
About: Amanda Seguin is a registered dietitian specializing in nephrology and renal nutrition. She works collaboratively with the interdisciplinary team to provide medical nutrition therapy for patients with chronic kidney disease. Amanda understands the importance of treating each patient as an individual using evidence-based practice guidelines with appropriate instructional methods and tools for renal nutrition care.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0612

Name: Shahrooz Sepahdari
About: Dr. Shahrooz Sepahdari practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Sepahdari specializes in nuclear radiology.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0276

Name: Anna Serafini
About: Dr. Anna Serafini practices in the Department of Neurology at UI Health. Dr. Serafini specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of epilepsy and seizures. Her clinical interest and research focuses on identifying the source of a patient's seizures, and epilepsy surgery. Her expertise in the treatment of complicated and drug-resistant epilepsy includes training both in Europe (Italy, France) and the United States. Dr. Serafini also has a particular interest in women's epilepsy issues, including contraception complications and the management of seizures and antiepileptic medications during pregnancy.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W.  Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Maria Serratto-Benvenuto
About: Dr. Maria Serratto-Benvenuto is a skilled general pediatric cardiologist who diagnoses and treats children with a variety of cardiological problems. Dr. Serratto-Benvenuto works closely with a team of specialists - including interventional pediatric cardiologists, electrophysiologists, pediatric cardiac surgeons, exercise physiologists, cardiac sonographers and dieticians to provide comprehensive management for these children.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Pete Setabutr
About: Dr. Setabutr is one of only 500 surgeons worldwide to have completed an American Society of Ophthalmic Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) approved fellowship. His research focuses on disease of the eyelids and orbit. He is exploring innovative procedures to guide surgeons in rejuvenating the eyelids and is a fellowship-trained, board-certified ophthalmologist specializing in cosmetic and reconstructive oculofacial surgery.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937), Millennium Park Eye Center, Suite 410, 30 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60602, 312.996.2020

Name: Bhanu Settipalle
About: Dr. Bhanu Harshita Settipalle is a primary care physician and hospitalist at UI Health. Dr. Settipalle specializes in managing chronic medical conditions, including hypertension, diabetes, asthma, obstructive lung disorders, and acid reflux. She also helps patients manage mental health disorders and provides education and counseling on substance use, including tobacco, alcohol, and recreational drug use.
Specialty: Counseling on Smoking and Alcohol Cessation
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL  60607, 312.413.3000, Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, Il  60612, 312.413.3627

Name: Suman Setty
About: Dr. Suman Setty practices in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Setty's clinical focus includes general surgical pathology, and her areas of expertise includes genitourinary oncologic pathology and medical renal pathology. She also provides interpretation for renal biopsies for our complex patient population who have received renal allografts.
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3878

Name: Neelofer Shafi
About: Dr. Neelofer Shafi is a certified neurologist who can help you with problems with your nervous system, brain, and recovery from a stroke. Dr. Shafi is board certified in both neurology & vascular neurology by the American Board of Psychiatry & Neurology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Reshma Shah
About: Dr. Shah's clinical interests include developmental delay, autism spectrum disorders, intellectual disability, and learning disorders. She graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in anthropology from University of Michigan in 1998. Prior to receiving her Doctor of Medicine degree from Wayne State University School of Medicine in 2003, she spent one year in Copenhagen, Denmark conducting neurobiology research. She completed her pediatric internship at Rainbow Babies and Children's Hospital and her pediatric residency at Lurie's Children's Hospital in 2006. She then worked as a general pediatrician in Chicago for three years. She completed her fellowship training at the University of Chicago in Developmental and Behavioral Pediatrics in 2012 where her research focused on examining pediatricians' experiences with special education as well as monitoring developmental outcomes in children with monogenic diabetes.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Ejaz Shamim
About: Dr. Ejaz Shamim's clinical interest include body imaging including ultrasound evaluation of transplanted organs, abdominal imaging, and musculoskeletal imaging with focus on sports medicine, with procedures including arthrography and arthrocentesis.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite 7N/2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900

Name: Rita Shapiro
About: Dr. Rita Shapiro practices in the Department of Neurology & Rehabilitation at UI Health. Dr. Shapiro provides clinical consultations for patients with variety of problems related to suspected brain disorders, including changes in memory and language, and concerns about dementia or related syndromes. She maintains a holistic approach to neurologic care and works closely with referring physicians, primary care providers, and collaborating specialists at UI Health to treat brain disorders. As a clinician-educator, Dr. Shapiro has a long career in academic- and VA-based medical settings and remains involved in collaborative clinical research. She believes that many patients and families benefit from supportive services like the Alzheimer's Association and that there are positive steps healthcare professionals, patients, and families can do to help maintain and improve cognitive health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1010

Name: Rajiv Sharma
