About: Dr. Rajiv Sharma focuses on epigenetic mechanisms of psychotic disorders and regenerative neurobiology. Dr. Sharma's research laboratory is investigating gene regulation in neurons and cells, with a special focus on translational research (clinical samples, postmortem brain).
Location: Neuropsychiatric Institute, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2200

Name: Jalene Shoener
About: Dr. Jalene Shoener practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Shoener provides primary care services for children and adults, and she has a special interest in supportive care for patients transitioning from pediatric to adult specialty care.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416 (Child & Youth Center), Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337 (Primary Care Adults & Children)

Name: Ellen Shorter
About: Dr. Ellen Shorter practices in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. Dr. Shorter specializes in using specialty contact lenses for the management of dry eye, graft-versus-host disease (GVHD), Sjogren's syndrome, keratoconus, and post-surgical corneas with medically necessary contact lenses. She is the director of the Prosthetic Replacement of the Ocular Surface Ecosystem (PROSE) Clinic and provides PROSE therapy for patients with complex ocular diseases to restore vision, and improve comfort and quality of life for patients. Additionally, she utilizes the newest technology available fitting image-guided freeform and impression-based EyePrintPro scleral lenses. Dr. Shorter's research interests include scleral lenses, keratoconus, and adenoviral conjunctivitis. She is a fellow of the Scleral Lens Education Society and the American Academy of Optometry.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Adhir Shroff
About: Dr. Adhir Shroff is the clinical chief of the Division of Cardiology and director of the Cardiac Catheterization Lab at UI Health. Dr. Shroff is a national leader in radial-artery catherization, a safer catheterization method he helped pioneer. He also specializes in diagnosing arterial blockages in the heart, and he is an expert in nonsurgical cardiac procedures that avoid open-heart surgery. Dr. Shroff is a core member of the Structural Heart Disease Program at UI Health, and he works with the team to grow referral programs, develop outreach efforts in the community, and expand the types of procedures that are offered at UI Health. Dr. Shroff has trained hundreds of physicians on radial catheterizations, and he chairs a national working group to improve the safety of cardiac catheterization procedures. He also trains physicians on the use of hemodynamic support devices to help patients whose hearts may be too weak to undergo other cardiac procedures, such as angioplasty or catheterization. He is a professor and director of the Interventional Cardiology Fellowship Program in the University of Illinois College of Medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Asim Shuja
About: Dr. Asim Shuja practices in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Dr. Shuja sees patients with a range of gastrointestinal conditions, and he has special expertise in diseases of the esophagus (swallowing difficulty), stomach (acid reflux, peptic ulcers) and colon (IBD, polyps, cancer), and in the evaluation of gastrointestinal (GI) bleeding. In addition, Dr. Shuja has keen interest in clinical research and educating future physicians.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000, Specialty Care Building, 4th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3800

Name: Ashley Sicard
About: Ashley Sicard is an occupational therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. She specializes in the evaluation and treatment of patients with a variety of cognitive conditions and neurological conditions, including stroke; Parkinson's disease; multiple sclerosis; spinal cord injury; memory loss; and traumatic brain injury. Ashley is a certified lymphedema therapist and is trained in complete digestive therapy (CDT). Additionally, she represents Rehabilitation Services in gynecologic oncology and assist patients in receiving beneficial therapy services.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.996.3700

Name: JoAnna Siciliano
About: JoAnna Siciliano is practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. A registered dietitian and specialist in pediatric nutrition, Ms. Siciliano enjoys educating families on creating personalized meal plans to help them live healthier lifestyles. She specializes in nutritional management of GI disorders such as celiac disease, Crohn's disease, irritable bowel syndrome, constipation, and failure to thrive. She also closely monitor our patients receiving G-tubes for adequate caloric needs with specialized formulas and blenderized feedings.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Krzysztof Siemionow
About: Dr. Siemionow specializes in the surgical management of spinal conditions affecting the neck, spine, and back in adults, children, and adolescents. Dr. Siemionow is Board Certified by the American Board of Orthopaedic Surgery.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1300

Name: Hernan Sierra
About: Dr. Hernan Sierra is currently researching the potential benefits of clinical informatics tools for parents and babies in the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU). Dr. Sierra concluded his medical education at the Universidad de Ciencias Medicas in San Jose, Costa Rica. He specialized in General Pediatrics at the John H. Stroger Junior Hospital of Chicago, and he sub-specialized in Neonatology at the Harbor UCLA Medical Center, in Los Angeles, California. He joined UI Health in 2013.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Herbert Sims
About: Dr. H. Steven Sims is the director of the Chicago Institute for Voice Care- a comprehensive voice treatment center dedicated to the care of voice and airway disorders. A laryngologist and board-certified Otolaryngologist, as well as an accomplished musician, he uniquely blends his expertise and passions in his career in professional voice care. A graduate of the Yale University School of Medicine, where he completed his residency training, Dr. Sims completed a research fellowship at the National Institute on Deafness and Communication Disorders and a clinical fellowship at the Vanderbilt Voice Center. He is also an accomplished musician who plays trombone, bassoon and piano.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Thomas Sims
About: Dr. Thomas L. Sims Jr. practices in the Division of Pediatric Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Sims specializes in the surgical treatment of a number of abdominal and chest problems in children, from birth to adulthood. Having been born with a medical condition that required surgery as a baby and treatment throughout childhood, Dr. Sims understands what it is like for a child and family dealing with one of these problems. His clinical interests include in caring for children with birth defects; hernias; intestinal, lung and esophagus issues; and traumatic injuries. He focuses on patient and family education, as he believes family input and involvement is important in the care of each patient. He is working to build the Global Impact of the Department of Surgery to help improve surgical care in low- and middle-income countries, and he enjoys teaching students and surgical trainees.
Location: Pediatric Clinic, 1801 West Taylor, Suite 3F, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Manmeet Singh
About: Dr. Manmeet (Manu) Singh practices in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Singh focuses on Pathology Informatics (efforts related to the utilization and improvement of laboratory information technology and value of existing laboratory test data) and Breast Pathology (efforts related to microscopic examination of breast tissue to provide diagnoses which Oncologists and Surgeons utilize in the management and care for patients).
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0367

Name: Sunit Singla
About: Dr. Sunit Singla primary clinical interests are obstructive lung disease and acute lung injury.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4244

Name: Kristina Skare
About: Kristina Skare is the assistant director for Outpatient Occupational and Physical Therapy Services, Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy Services, and Cardiac Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. A physical therapist by background, she has worked in a variety of care settings - including acute care, post-acute care, day rehab, home health, and outpatient - with a wide array of patient diagnoses. She brings her experience across the care continuum and across body systems to her work at UI Health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.355.4394, Physical Therapy at University Village, 711 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.355.4394

Name: Demetrios Skias
About: Dr. Demetrios Skias is the director of the Multiple Sclerosis (MS) clinic at UI Health and specializes in diseases that affect the brain. If you have a brain disease, please schedule an appointment with Dr. Skias.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Konstantin Slavin
About: Dr. Konstantin Slavin's clinical interests are diverse applications of surgical neuromodulation and functional neurosurgery. This includes treatment of pain, movement disorders, epilepsy, and psychiatric diseases with a particular interest in the treatment of facial pain, cancer-related pain, Chiari malformation, stereotactic radiosurgery, brain tumors, and spinal problems. He has received many clinical and professional awards, including "Most Compassionate Doctor," and for many years has been included in the prestigious "Top Surgeons" and "Best Doctors" lists in the USA. Dr. Slavin is a professor of neurosurgery and head of the Stereotactic and Functional Neurosurgery section at UIC. He is the Past-President of the American Society for Stereotactic and Functional Neurosurgery, and Director-at-Large of the North American Neuromodulation Society and the International Neuromodulation Society. He also serves on Medical Advisory Board of the Facial Pain Association (formerly Trigeminal Neuralgia Association). He has authored and co-authored more than a hundred chapters and peer-reviewed articles, edited three books on Peripheral Nerve Stimulation, and presented at countless educational events and professional conferences. He is now an associate editor of Neuromodulation, Neurosurgery, Surgical Neurology International and a member of editorial boards of several other professional journals. Dr. Slavin's research interests parallel his clinical expertise and include practical aspects of neuromodulation, a multitude of prospective clinical studies and pioneering research in spinal cord stimulation for cerebral vasospasm, surgical treatment for migraines, and deep brain stimulation for tremor, Parkinson's disease, and depression.
Specialty: Carpal Tunnel, Ulnar Nerve and Other Peripheral Nerve Surgery
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Sara Smith
About: Dr. Sara Smith is an Assistant Professor of Internal Medicine and Pediatrics at UI Health. Dr. Smith serves both adult and pediatric patients, and her clinical and academic interests include underserved populations, patient safety, and medical education.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Maureen Smith
About: Maureen Smith is a nurse practitioner in the Sleep Science Center at UI Health. Ms. Smith has a focus on sleep medicine, and she treats patients with all sleep problems, from sleep apnea to insomnia. Her practice philosophy is to not only treat illness but also to elevate awareness of the importance of good sleep in the healing process and as an important aspect of overall well-bring. Her clinical interests also include population health and health disparities.
Location: Sleep Science Center, 2242 W. Harrison St., Suite 104, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1091

Name: Jason Soble
About: Dr. Jason Soble practices in the Department of Psychiatry at UI Health. Dr. Soble's clinical interests include neuropsychological assessment of adults with dementia; complex neurological/medical disorders; cerebrovascular disease; epilepsy; and traumatic brain injury (TBI). He also has a special interest in working with the veteran and active-duty military populations. Dr. Soble's research broadly investigates the diagnostic properties and clinical utility of neuropsychological tests, in addition to the neurobehavioral consequences of disorders like TBI, epilepsy, and vascular disease.
Location: Neuropsychiatric Institute, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6217

Name: Augustine Sohn
About: Dr. Augustine Sohn is a family physician with over 37 years of experience. Dr. Sohn's specialties include prevention and management of chronic diseases especially type 2 diabetes mellitus, obesity, and hypertension. He is an expert in patient centered medicine and outpatient surgical procedures. Dr. Sohn is a bilingual in English and Korean.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W Maxwell St, Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Christina Son
About: Dr. Christina Son practices in the Department of Radiation Oncology at UI Health. Dr. Son specializes in treating patients with gynecologic cancers and breast cancers. Her clinical research interests include clinical trials, patient-reported outcomes, and quality of life.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite C400, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3631

Name: Woojin Song
About: Dr. Woojin Song specializes in the neuropsychological evaluation of patients with neurological and psychiatric disorders, with particular interests in age-related cognitive decline, dementias, movement disorders, and brain tumors. She also provides neuropsychological evaluation for Korean-speaking patients. Her research interests include the cognitive and functional decline in mild cognitive impairment and Alzheimer's disease, as well as behavioral and psychiatric changes associated neurological conditions.
Location: Neuropsychiatry & Psycological Services, 1st Floor, 912 South Wood St, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6217

Name: Mario Spaggiari
About: Dr. Mario Spaggiari practices in the Division of Transplantation at UI Health. Dr. Spaggiari has extensive experience in liver, kidney, pancreas, and intestinal transplantation, in addition to hepatobiliary and pancreatic surgery. He has completed both an ASTS Multi-Organ Transplantation and Hepatobiliary Fellowship at the Cleveland Clinic and an Islet and Pancreas Transplantation Fellowship at UI Health. Dr. Spaggiari has been published innumerous peer-reviewed journals, presented his work at national and international meetings, and has co-authored several chapters in surgical textbooks.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Jessica Spitelli
About: Jessica Spitelli is a board-certified nurse practitioner in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Her clinical interests include IBD, nutrition, and small bowel disorders. Her goal is to work collaboratively with the gastroenterology team and patient to improve care coordination, patient outcomes, and overall quality of life. She values the importance of providing patient-centered care.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 4th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3800, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Radhika Sreedhar
About: Dr. Radhika Sreedhar provides patient centered care with a focus on preventive medicine.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3627

Name: Nishant Srinivasan
About: Dr. Nishant Srinivasan practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health, specializing in Neonatal-Perinatal Medicine. Dr. Srinivasan is the Director of Neonatal Simulation and Neonatal Transports in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU), and he serves as the NICU liaison for the Pediatric Residency Program. His clinical and research interests include neonatal respiratory physiology, neonatal resuscitation, assisted ventilation of the neonate, and acute kidney injury in preterm infants. Dr. Srinivasan has an interest in medical education and learning through simulation, and he is actively involved in mentoring residents and Neonatal-Perinatal fellows.
Location: Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU), Children’s Hospital University of Illinois, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Pavan Srivastava
About: Dr. Pavan Srivastava is a board certified physician in Internal Medicine and Pediatrics. Dr. Srivastava specializes in primary and preventative healthcare as well as chronic disease management for adults, adolescents, and children. He has additional interests in medical education and quality improvement.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3AA, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Akanksha Srivastava
About: Dr. Akanksha Srivastava is a maxillofacial prosthodontist and implantologist at the Craniofacial Center at UI Health. Dr. Srivastava focuses on providing care to children and adults with reconstructive needs, including cleft lip and palate, head and neck cancer, craniofacial trauma, and other acquired orofacial conditions. She specializes in craniofacial implant and prosthetic rehabilitation and also provides care to patients with advanced oral rehabilitation needs, including full-mouth rehabilitations, implant-supported "fixed teeth in a day," and zygomatic and pterygoid implants. She works with the multidisciplinary team at the Craniofacial Center and utilizes state-of-the art digital technologies to enhance her patients' oral rehabilitation outcomes.
Location: Craniofacial Center, Suite 161, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7546

Name: Nathan Stackhouse
About: Dr. Nathan Stackhouse practices in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Stackhouse specializes in patient-centered care for individuals of all ages.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Joan Stelmack
About: Dr. Joan Stelmack is Director of Low Vision Service in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health and Clinical Associate Professor of Ophthalmology at the University of Illinois College of Medicine. Dr. Stelmack specializes in low vision rehabilitation. Her interests include technologies, techniques, and therapies for enhancing patients' remaining sight, including the use of special optical and electronic devices and new visual skills to address routine daily tasks, such as reading and writing.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Jennifer Stenger
About: Jennifer Stenger is an occupational therapist and certified hand therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Ms. Stenger has vast experience treating a variety of upper extremity conditions due to trauma, acquired deformities, congenital conditions, repetitive motion disorders, and post-surgical. She utilizes a variety of intervention methods for treatment, including custom orthotic fabrication; electrotherapeutic and thermal/cryo physical agent modalities; postoperative wound care and suture removal; joint and soft tissue mobilization; therapeutic taping; instrumental and activities of daily living training; neuromuscular re-education; and sensory re-education and desensitization. She also develops customized home exercise programs. Ms. Stenger completes activity and job analyses to recommend and train in the use of ergonomics, joint protection, and energy conservation techniques. She has completed training to complete Functional Capacity Evaluations for worker compensation claims.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Shirley Stephenson
About: Shirley Stephenson is a family nurse practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center-Humboldt Park location, which uses a collaborative-care approach to address medical and mental health needs hand-in-hand. Ms. Stephenson's experience and interests include HIV prevention (PrEP), family planning, adolescent health, medication-assisted treatment for opioid-use disorder, LGBTQ-inclusive healthcare, and preventive services, including screenings, immunizations, and nutrition counseling.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Humboldt Park, 3240 W. Division St., Chicago, IL 60651, 312.413.7425

Name: Kristina Stevens
About: Kristina Stevens is passionate about providing excellent treatment of adult ADHD, depression, anxiety, and bipolar disorders, as well as recovery from sexual trauma and postpartum/antepartum depression and anxiety. An alumnus of UIC's Masters of Nursing program, Kristina is intimately familiar with the UIC community and excited to call it her professional home.
Specialty: Postpartum and antepartum depression and anxiety
Location: Neuropsychiatry & Psycological Services, 3rd floor, 912 South Wood St, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4387

Name: Karie Stewart
About: Karie Stewart is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Karie specializes in family planning, including contraception management; birthing alternatives, education, and options; group prenatal care; and breastfeeding. She is passionate about Black maternal health, racial-concordant prenatal care, and reproductive justice and health.
Location: Miles Square Health Center–Auburn Gresham, 838 W. 79th Street, Chicago, IL 60620, 312.996.2000

Name: Danijela Stojanac
About: Dr. Danijela Stojanac is a psychiatrist in the Women's Mental Health Program at UI Health. Dr. Stojanac's clinical and academic interests include women's mental health, psychiatric disorders during pregnancy and the post-partum period, depression in midlife women, and issues related to infertility and mental health. She also has interests in early childhood development, impulsive and compulsive disorders, psychodynamic psychotherapy, and group psychotherapy. With her training in child and adolescent psychiatry, Dr. Stojanac is working to develop programs that bridge the Child and Adult Psychiatry Divisions within the department.
Location: Neuropsychiatry & Psycological Services, First Floor, 912 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.2200; 312-413-7701

Name: Jodi Stonefelt
About: As an orthopaedic physical therapist, Jodi Stonefelt specializes in both post-surgical rehabilitation as well as non-surgical management for injury and pain, utilizing evidenced based interventions. While evaluating and treating a variety of orthopaedic conditions, she also works with patients post Total Knee Replacements in a group setting, treats patients with workers compensation, and is trained to perform Functional Capacity Evaluations. All treatment provided is patient-centered and goal-oriented.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W Taylor St, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Richard Stringham
About: Dr. Stringham enjoys seeing patients at UI Health and teaching at UIC.  He is interested in the wide variety of care that family physicians provide.  He has special interests in dermatology, orthopedics, and geriatrics.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W Maxwell St, Chicago, IL 60607, 866.600.2273

Name: Vithida Sueblinvong

Name: Sai Sunkara

She emphasizes patient education to help them make fully informed decisions regarding their healthcare.
Location: Sleep Science Center, Suite 104, 2242 W. Harrison St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7708

Name: Nichole Suss
About: Dr. Suss is a specialist in Audiology at UI Health. She sees patients of all ages for a wide range of diagnostic and rehabilitative services. She enjoys providing education to patients, students, and other professionals about hearing and improving quality of life through hearing health. Specialty areas of care include pediatrics, evoked potentials, amplification, and bone-anchored solutions.
Specialty: Auditory brainstem implant evaluations and management
Bone anchored implant evaluations and management
Hearing aid selections, fittings, and management
Assistive Listening Devices (ALD) selections and fittings
Location: Eye & Ear Infirmary, Suite B46, 1855 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6522, Craniofacial Center, 811 S. Paulina St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6933

Name: James Swakow
About: Dr. James Swakow is a family medicine physician at the Mile Square Health Center locations in Englewood and Humboldt Park. Dr. Swakow provides full-spectrum care to patients of all ages and backgrounds, including chronic-disease management and office-based procedures.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Englewood, 641 W. 63rd St., Chicago, IL 60621, 312.996.2000, Mile Square Health Center–Humboldt Park, 3240 W. Division St., Chicago, IL 60651, 312.996.2000

Name: Nadera Sweiss

Name: Uzma Syed
About: Uzma Syed, MD is an attending physician at the UI Health. Dr. Syed provides individualized care to patients with Endocrine diseases including diabetes & thyroid disorders. Also other endocrine diseases of the pituitary, parathyroid & adrenals. Special interest in Insulin pumps & glucose sensors.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Letitia Sykes-Matthews
About: Letitia Sykes-Matthews is a staff chaplain in Pastoral Care Services at UI Health. Ms. Sykes-Matthews provides a caring, empathic, and calm presence to patients and their families through active listening and unconditional regard to patients and their families as they process their experiences with intermittent and chronic illness, intensive care, and the end of life. Her background in mental health and substance abuse has provided a pathway for her to connect with patients of various backgrounds and cultures.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite 2009, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0296

Name: Allyson Talbert
About: Allyson Talbert is the clinical pastoral educator/supervisor in Pastoral Care Services at UI Health. Ms. Talbert is responsible for the re-establishment of the UI Health clinical pastoral education center and providing professional development opportunities for the department. She has served as a healthcare chaplain since 2010, often in the areas of oncology, cardiothoracic care, and sickle cell patient support.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite 2009, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0296

Name: Parkash Talwar
About: Dr. Parkash S. Talwar practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 7 North/2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6840

Name: Ignatius Tang
About: Dr. Tang provides comprehensive and patient-individualized care to all kidney transplant patients and kidney donor evaluation. Dr. Tang has diverse clinical interests, including obese kidney transplant recipients, HIV and Hepatitis C transplant recipients, combined organ transplant recipients; pancreas and kidney transplants; glomerulonephritis diabetes.
Location: Ear & Eye Infirmary, Suite 2028, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8330

Name: Michael Tarkey

Name: Stefan Tchernodrinski
About: Dr. Stefan Tchernodrinski practices in the Division of Internal Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Tchernodrinski specializes in general internal medicine, hospital medicine, and point-of-care ultrasound. His clinical focus is on treating medical inpatients in the hospital setting.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 866.600.2273

Name: Fernando Testai
About: Dr. Testai's clinical interest includes the diagnosis, management, and prevention of both ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke. He is the principal investigator of several clinical and basic research studies pertaining to cerebrovascular diseases and has published important articles in his field. Dr. Testai was formally trained in biochemistry and received his PhD in neurochemisty from the University of Buenos Aires, Argentina. He subsequently obtained his MD degree and specialized in neurology and in vascular neurology. Dr. Testai is a Fellow of the American Heart Association and is board certified in Neurology and Stroke.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0150

Name: Rakhi Thambi
About: Dr. Rakhi Thambi is a board-certified in General Otolaryngology. Her clinical work is extensive across adult and pediatric patients with specialties in general ENT, allergy, deviated septum, goiters, masses in the thyroid and neck, salivary gland tumors, sinus diseases, and sleep apnea/snoring. She is Medical Director of the ENT Clinic at the University of Illinois Eye & Ear Infirmary and an Assistant Professor of Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Claire Thesing
About: Dr. Claire Thesing practices in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Thesing provides care to patients of all ages, and her clinical interests include preventative care, medical education, and community medicine. Her goal is to improve the health of our communities by treating diseases, working to prevent future diseases, and providing better access to primary care.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–South Shore, 7037 S. Stony Island Ave., Chicago, IL 60649, 312.996.2000

Name: Tiffany Thompkins
About: Tiffany Thompkins is family nurse practitioner at the Mile Square Health Center-South Shore location. Ms. Thompkins' clinical practice focuses on a holistic approach to primary prevention of disease, promoting healthy lifestyles, and reducing health disparities. She is currently working toward a doctorate degree in Nursing at the University of Illinois at Chicago.
Location: Mile Square Health Center—South Shore, 7037 S. Stony Island Ave., Chicago, IL 60649, 312.255.5590

Name: Veronica Thompson
About: Veronica Thompson is a clinical dietitian for the Solid Organ Transplant Program at UI Health. Veronica helps transplant candidates reach their nutritional goals to prepare them for transplant surgery. She also provides medical nutrition therapy and nutrition education for patients after transplant to aid in their recovery. Veronica enjoys working with patients one-on-one and with their families to improve their nutrition and helps them strive for a healthy lifestyle before and after transplant.
Location: Ear & Eye Infirmary (EEI), Suite 1000, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.7318

Name: Keith Thulborn
About: Dr. Keith Thulborn's clinical focus includes mapping of brain function in the setting of stroke recovery with BOLD contrast fMRI, clinical development of a rapid acute stroke protocol that includes application of sodium imaging to map tissue viability in the setting of acute stroke for planning strokectomy, and serial imaging of large arteriovenous malformations during staged embolization intervention.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 2 West/2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6840

Name: Anna Titcomb
About: Anna Titcomb is a registered dietitian specializing in weight management, nutrition education, and community health. Ms. Titcomb works collaboratively with children, adolescents, and adults to provide nutrition counseling around individual wellness goals. Her role as a registered dietitian is to provide both evidence-based nutrition education and clinical experience while supporting individuals in making positive behavior change.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Stephanie Tiwari
About: Stephanie Tiwari is a heart failure nurse practitioner in the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Ms. Tiwari specializes in treating patients with heart failure, and she works with a team of healthcare providers to reduce patient symptoms and improve their quality of life.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Daniel Toft
About: Dr. Daniel Toft practices in the Division of Endocrinology, Diabetes, and Metabolism at UI Health. Dr. Toft is an endocrine generalist seeing patients with all types of endocrine issues.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Mary Tomyanovich
About: Dr. Mary Tomyanovich is board certified in and neurophysiology and is a UI Health Neurologist assisting with EMG patient care. Dr. Tomyanovich is a UI Health certified neurologist who helps with EMG Care, a technique used to evaluate patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.4780

Name: Stephanie Toth-Manikowski
About: Dr. Stephanie Toth-Manikowski practices in the Division of Nephrology at UI Health. Dr. Toth-Manikowski cares for patients with kidney disease, and she has she has a special interest in women with kidney disease who are pregnant or interested in becoming pregnant. Dr. Toth-Manikowski also is bilingual (English, Spanish).
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569, 55th & Pulaski Health Collaborative, 5525 S. Pulaski Road, Chicago, IL 60629, 312.413.5569

Name: Van "Ann" Tran
About: Dr. Van Ann Tran (Ann) is an oculofacial plastic and reconstructive surgeon in the Department of Ophthalmology at UI Health. Dr. Tran specializes in ophthalmic plastic, orbital, reconstructive, and aesthetic surgery. Her areas of expertise include droopy eyelid surgery; eyelid malposition; brow and forehead lifts; thyroid eye disease; cancers of the eyelid and orbit; facial nerve palsy; anophthalmic sockets; lacrimal/tearing surgery; and non;surgical facial rejuvenation with neurotoxin and soft-tissue fillers. Dr. Trans is a dedicated educator and is a part of the Ophthalmology Residency and ASOPRS Oculoplastics Fellowship. She is an avid researcher with over 60 peer-review publications and 15 book chapters, and she has presented her work nationally. Most importantly, Dr. Tran's primary goal is to provide the highest level of individualized care for each patient. She strives to make sure her patients feel confident and comfortable and works together with them regarding their clinical care.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937), Millennium Park Eye Center, Suite 410, 30 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60602, 312.996.2020

Name: Gabriela Trifan
About: Dr. Gabriela Trifan practices in the Department of Neurology & Rehabilitation at UI Health. Dr. Trifan specializes in stroke, and her clinical focus is on stroke prevention and functional outcomes after ischemic and hemorrhagic stroke. She sees patients in both the hospital and outpatient setting, and her clinical interests include patients with sickle cell disease and stroke; stroke in young adults; and using neurosonology (carotid ultrasound and transcranial doppler) for a comprehensive evaluation of patients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Itishree Trivedi
About: Dr. Itishree Trivedi practices in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Dr. Trivedi treats patients with a variety of gastrointestinal complaints. Her particular area of focus is in inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), including Crohn's disease and colitis. She is part of a multidisciplinary team of IBD providers that includes physicians, pharmacists, and nurse practitioners who provide accessible, timely, and effective care for patients with Crohn's disease and colitis.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3800, University Village Primary & Specialty Care, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Andrew Trotter
About: Dr. Andrew Trotter practices in the Division of Infectious Diseases at UI Health. Dr. Trotter's clinical interests focus on the care of people living with HIV/AIDS, HIV prevention including PrEP, hepatitis B and C, sexually transmitted infections, general infectious diseases and infections in people with substance use disorder.  Gender affirming and LGBTQ inclusive care are central to his approach to patient care. Dr. Trotter has a particular interest in approaches to providing medical care to underserved populations and medical education both in Chicago and globally.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337

Name: Maria Tsoukas
About: Dr. Maria Tsoukas is the head of the Department of Dermatology at UI Health. Dr. Tsoukas specializes in the diagnosis, management, and treatment of patients who are at high risk for skin cancer and those with chronic immunosuppression or autoimmune diseases. She has a strong focus on non-invasive field therapies, photodynamic therapy, and skin laser therapy to treat benign and malignant skin conditions, and her clinical interests also include noninvasive skin rejuvenation using injectable botulinum toxin and fillers. Dr. Tsoukas' research focuses on photobiology/photodynamic therapy; laser tissue interactions and drug delivery; field cancerization therapies; and tissue repair. Dr. Tsoukas also serves as the Associate Head of Education Affairs and Residency Program Director in the Department of Dermatology.
Specialty: Diagnosis, Management, and Treatment of Skin Cancer
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8666

Name: Elmer Tu
About: Dr. Elmer Y. Tu specializes in infectious diseases of the cornea. He is widely viewed as having special expertise in the diagnosis and treatment of Acanthamoeba and other severe infections of the cornea. Dr. Tu's area of expertise also includes new and innovative forms of corneal transplantation and treatment of challenging ocular surface disorders.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Jason Tuite
About: Jason Tuite is a clinical social worker in Cancer Services at UI Health. Mr. Tuite works with patients and their families to navigate the difficulties that can surround cancer diagnosis and treatment. Diagnosis and treatment support includes connecting patients to counseling services, support groups, and other community resources to help cope with a diagnosis; learning how to talk with family members, friends, or co-workers about their diagnosis and treatment; and using advance directives in planning for care. Mr. Tuite also assists patients through the financial and logistical burdens of receiving cancer treatment, including finding affordable medical care, financial assistance, and prescriptions, and explaining social security benefits, disability benefits, and insurance coverage. He helps patients consider treatment options and how they may impact family, work, and other areas of life, including needs at home and connecting with other resources.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801. W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.0293

Name: John Tulley
About: Dr. John Tulley is an internist who specializes in hypertension, diabetes, heart disease, lung disease, and general wellness care.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Agnieszka Tyl
About: Agnieszka Tyl is a physician assistant at the Mile Square Health Center-L.P. Johnson Rockford location. Ms. Tyl focuses on family medicine and primary care services.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–L.P. Johnson Rockford, 1221 E. States St., Rockford, IL 61104, 815.972.1000

Name: Carissa Tyo
About: Dr. Carissa J. Tyo is director of the Internal Medicine/Emergency Medicine Residency Program at UI Health, where she facilitates the education of resident physicians throughout the health system through work in the Emergency Department and inpatient hospital wards. Dr. Tyo also is the medical director for the Observation Services platform at UI Health. While not available for clinical appointments, she may serve as patients' physician liaison for care.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60608

Name: Ivo Tzvetanov
About: Dr. Ivo G. Tzvetanov is chief of the Division of Transplantation at UI Health. Passionate about his role in patients' lives, Dr. Tzvetanov has a personal goal to provide the highest quality care using state-of-the-art surgical techniques, and he thrives to treat each individual patient with respect and compassion. He is board-certified in general surgery and is accredited by the American Society of Transplant Surgeons (ASTS), and he has an extensive list of original scientific publications on the topic of abdominal organ transplantation. Dr. Tzvetanov holds the Carl H. and Billie M. Frese and Gerald S. Moss Professor in Transplant Surgery
Location: Ear & Eye Infirmary (EEI), Suite 1000, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6771

Name: Lawrence Ulanski
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Terry Unterman
About: Dr. Terry Unterman practices in the Diabetes Center & Endocrinology Clinic at UI Health. Dr. Unterman's clinical interests include diabetes and general endocrinology, including thyroid, adrenal, pituitary disorders, and male hypogonadism.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.3631

Name: Alicia Uwumarogie
About: Dr. Alicia Uwumarogie is an outpatient physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Department at UI Health. As a certified manual physical therapist, Dr. Uwumarogie is trained in advanced hands-on techniques for the spine and joints of the arms and legs. Her background includes working with a variety of patient populations, including individuals after joint replacement and other surgeries; individuals injured on the job; and high school and college athletes.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Chukwuemeka Uzoka
About: Dr. Chukwuemeka Uzoka practices in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. Dr. Uzoka specializes in blood cancers, bone marrow transplantation, and CAR-T cell therapy. His research interest include improving patient outcomes following bone marrow transplantation and cellular therapies.
Specialty: Bone Marrow and Stem Cell Transplantation
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Kelly Vaez
About: Kelly Vaez provides primary care and support managing diabetes, high blood pressure, and high cholesterol. She also enjoys working with patients who are on the path to recovery from serious mental illness.
Location: Mile Square Health Center - Humboldt Park, 3240 West Division Street, Chicago, IL 60615, 312.413.7425

Name: Christen Vagts
About: Dr. Christen Vagts is a pulmonologist in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, and Sleep Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Vagts provides individualized care to patients with a variety of pulmonary diseases, with a special focus on interstitial lung disease.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3300

Name: Thasarat Vajaranant
About: Dr. Thasarat Vajaranant is an ophthalmic surgeon, physician-scientist, and educator at UI Health. Dr. Vajaranant's clinical expertise in managing complex glaucoma and cataracts, and she leads a wide range of research projects, including clinical studies and epidemiological analysis. Dr. Vajaranant serves as a site PI for a multicenter clinical trial investigating new glaucoma treatments. Her clinical and research interests primarily focus on glaucoma epidemiology; optic nerve aging; women's eye health; structural and functional testing of the optic nerve; and management of glaucoma after corneal transplant. Throughout her tenure, she has also had the honor of serving in multiple professional organizations. Present and past positions include American Glaucoma Society (AGS) Lead Ambassador; Editorial Board Member of Ophthalmology Glaucoma; a member of the AGS research committee; an American Academy of Ophthalmology Scientific Reviewer for the glaucoma section; and a member of the Prevent Blindness America scientific committee. She has been recognized by Castle Connolly as one of America's Top Doctors (10 consecutive years), by Best Doctors in America, and by Super Doctors in Chicago.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937), Millennium Park Eye Center, Suite 410, 30 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60602, 312.996.2020

Name: Tibor Valyi-Nagy
About: Dr. Tibor Valyi-Nagy is Professor of Pathology, Director of Neuropathology and Interim Director of Anatomic Pathology in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Valyi-Nagy's clinical focus is examination of central and peripheral nervous system tissues for diagnosis. His research activities primarily focus on the pathogenesis of viral infections of the nervous system.
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.1772

Name: Benjamin Van Voorhees
About: Dr. Benjamin W. Van Voorhees practices in the Department of Pediatrics at UI Health. As a clinician, researcher, administrator, and educator, the focus of the work of Dr. Van Voorhees is to prevent the onset of chronic disease in childhood and adolescence. His interests include adolescent depression, psychotherapy, mental disorders in children, and resiliency formation. He has developed multiple patient focused technology applications and directed more than five randomized clinical trials. He has a lifetime funding history of over $28 million in research funding, as well as more than 75 scientific publications and more than 100 scientific conference presentations. Dr. Van Voorhees is the George R. Honig, MD, Endowed Professor in Pediatrics and a Professor of Medicine. He is Head of the Department of Pediatrics, Physician-in-Chief of the Children's Hospital University of Illinois, Project Director for the CHECK Project, and Director of the TIKES Center.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Terry Vanden Hoek
About: Dr. Terry Vanden Hoek is the chief medical officer and head of Emergency Medicine at UI Health. As CMO, he oversees the medical staff and medical services for the University of Illinois Hospital & Clinics. Dr. Vanden Hoek is an expert in the biology of the heart and in preventing and treating heart attacks, particularly those leading to cardiac arrest. He has helped develop CPR guidelines for the American Heart Association, and he leads the Illinois Heart Rescue Program, which teaches bystander CPR in the community. He currently is conducting National Institutes of Health-funded research to investigate new biological agents that mimic the effects of lowering the body's core temperature, which can reduce the risk of long-term heart and neurological effects if provided during or immediately after the administration of CPR. Dr. Vanden Hoek spearheaded the development of the UIC CHAMPIONS NETWork program, a health system initiative that partners with nearby high schools to empower youth to improve community health and prepare them for careers in healthcare. He also is heavily involved with UI Health's Better Health Through Housing program, which places chronically homeless emergency department patients into permanent housing.
Location: Back To Top

Name: Peter Varga
About: Dr. Peter Varga practices in the Division of Pediatric Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Varga specializes cardiac genetics (familial heart diseases) and advanced cardiac imaging (CT/MRI). He also focuses the prevention of acquired heart diseases to reduce the burden of adulthood and aging-related heart problems. As many of my patients become adults, Dr. Varga continues to provide specialty care to patients with congenital heart problems, and he directs the Adult Congenital Heart Disease Clinic at UI Health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6606, 55th & Pulaski Health Collaborative, 5525 S. Pulaski Rd., Chicago, IL 60629, 312.996.6606

Name: Amanda Vevers
About: Amanda Vevers is a licensed clinical social worker with the Gender Affirming Surgery Program at UI Health. Amanda provides consults for patients experiencing psychosocial concerns; acts as a liaison between patients and clinical staff; and works to create partnerships with community groups, nonprofit organizations, and medical providers and facilities serving gender-diverse patients. Her background includes case management and housing advocacy for the LGBTQ+ senior community. Amanda's practice is inspired by a quote from civil rights leader Bayard Rustin: "We need, in every community, a group of angelic troublemakers." Gender: Female
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 12.355.6600

Name: Vladimir Vidanovic
About: Dr. Vladimir Vidanovic practices in the Department of Pathology at UI Health. Dr. Vidanovic is the director of Coagulation, overseeing operations in the laboratory and serving as clinical consultant in utilization/interpretation of various tests that are instrumental in diagnosis and management of bleeding and thrombotic conditions. He also serve as the chair of Laboratory Utilization Committee, a multidisciplinary advisory group at the interface between the laboratory and clinical services that reviews test-ordering practices, requests for new tests, and seeks continuous improvement in laboratory-testing process. Dr. Vidanovic is one of the attending physicians on the Blood Bank/Transfusion Medicine Team, which also provides services in Therapeutic Hemapheresis.
Location: Department of Pathology, 840 S. Wood St., Suite 130, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6727

Name: Mladen Vidovich
About: Dr. Mladen Vidovich is an Interventional Cardiologist at UI Health. Dr. Vidovich's clinical interests include cardiovascular diseases, coronary interventions, and interventional cardiology. He is board certified in Interventional Cardiology, Cardiovascular Disease, Internal Medicine and Anesthesiology.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 West Taylor, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Stephanie Vodopic
About: Stephanie Vodopic evaluates and treats patients in the hospital setting to restore mobility and function to allow for quicker recovery from medical conditions. She focuses on assisting patients to return to the community-setting following illness at the highest level of function possible and helps coordinate further need for physical therapy in the outpatient or home setting.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Suite C100, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3700

Name: Effrossyni Votta-Velis
About: Dr. Effrossyni "Gina" Votta-Velis has practiced pain medicine for over twenty years. She has expertise in all areas of pain medicine. Her research interests include the study of gene therapy for pain and mechanisms of neuropathic pain. She has received several national and international awards in addition to several research grants for her work. She has authored multiple peer reviewed articles and book chapters. Dr. Votta-Velis serves as a reviewer on the editorial boards of several reputed national and international journals.
Location: Outpatient Care Center,  Suite 4E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.0510

Name: Karen Vuckovic
About: Dr. Karen Vuckovic is an advanced practice nurse in the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Vuckovic specializes in heart failure treatment and research, and she has a special interest in helping patients improve their self-care activities, especially keeping physically active despite the constraints of their condition.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6481

Name: Katie Walker
About: Katie Walker is a certified nurse-midwife in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Katie specializes in low-risk pregnancy; well-woman annual gynecological exams with Pap smears; STD treatment; mammography; and contraception.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Back of the Yards, 4630 S. Bishop St., Chicago, IL 60609, 312.996.2000

Name: Jenny Wang
About: Dr. Jenny Y. Wang is the medical director of the Pediatric Critical Care Unit (PICU) at UI Health. As part of the multidisciplinary PICU team, Dr. Wang provides specialized care to patients with acute and chronic illnesses and those who have undergone major surgical procedures.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 5th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612

Name: Michael Warso
About: Dr. Michael Warso is an expert surgical oncologist with over 35 years of experience in treating patients with breast, skin and liver/GI related cancers. Dr. Warso also works closely with other physicians to ensure a patient's surgical care is coordinated with any treatment they may need prior to surgery (chemotherapy, radiation, hormone therapy, etc.).
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3F, 1801 West Taylor Street, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4300

Name: Frank Weinberg
About: Dr. Frank Weinberg is a physician and researcher in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. As a medical oncologist, Dr. Weinberg is focused on providing the best care for lung cancer patients, utilizing a shared-decision making approach between the patient, family, other providers, nurses, and doctors. He uses the latest scientific research and approved medications to individualize care for each patient. As a researcher, Dr. Weinberg is interested in improving outcomes in patients treated with immunotherapy, and he has made important discoveries in the fields of cancer biology and metabolism.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1625, 55th & Pulaski Health Collaborative, 5525 S. Pulaski Rd., Chicago, IL 60629, 312.355.1625

Name: Saul Weiner
About: Dr. Weiner provides primary care services to both adult and pediatric patients. His research interests focus on physician/patient communications to more effectively plan care based on both evidence-based research and each patient's life situation.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 7th Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4242

Name: Heather Weinreich
About: Dr. Heather Weinreich practices in the Department of Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery at UI Health. Dr. Weinreich specializes otology, neurotology, and skull base surgery. She has expertise in hearing disorders, chronic ear diseases, lateral skull base tumors, superior semi-circular canal dehiscence, and vestibular disorders of the inner ear, including Meniere's disease and vestibular migraine. She also is part of the Happy Ears on Taylor Street team that works with adult cochlear implant patients. Dr. Weinreich has specific clinical interests in vestibular disorders. Her research interests include clinical efficiency, models for healthcare delivery, and the role of gender in surgical education.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Christina Wells
About: Dr. Christina Wells is a board-certified family medicine physician who provides patient-centered care for individuals of all ages.  She specializes in both preventive health services and management of chronic diseases, including HIV care.
Location: Mile Square Health Center, South Shore, 7037 S. Stony Island Ave., Chicago, IL 60649, 312.996.2000

Name: Barry Wenig
About: Dr. Wenig treats patients with malignant and benign tumors of the head and neck, with the goal of eradicating cancer while maintaining quality of life issues such as speech and swallowing function. Dr. Wenig is a nationally recognized expert in robotic surgery as well, and serves as part of a multidisciplinary team of surgeons and clinicians who treat patients at the Head and Neck Cancer Center. Dr. Wenig is director of the division and coordinates care of head and neck cancer patients. He is head of the department of otolaryngology and also the Francis L Lederer Professor.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 6th Floor, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6555

Name: Catherine Wheatley
About: Dr. Catherine Wheatley practices in the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at UI Health. Dr. Wheatley provides expert obstetrical care for low- and moderate-risk pregnancies. She also specializes in gynecologic care, including contraception; the management of complex gynecological conditions; and benign gynecological surgery, including vaginal hysterectomy and in-office gynecological procedures.
Location: University Village Primary & Specialty Care, Suite 240, 1309 S. Halsted St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.413.3000

Name: Kelly White
About: Kelly White is a nurse practitioner in the Division of Hematology & Oncology at UI Health. She works directly with oncologists and hematologists that focus on providing care for patients with different types of lymphoma, leukemia, myeloma, and HIV/AIDS-associated cancers. In collaboration with the entire healthcare team, she provides care to patients receiving a variety of different treatments, including chemotherapy, targeted therapy, radiation therapy, stem cell transplantation, and combination-treatment regimens. She strives to build trusting relationships with patients and their families from the moment of their diagnosis and throughout their cancer journey.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60612, 312.355.1625

Name: Renita White
About: Renita White is a physician assistant at the Mile Square Health Center–Main location. Renita evaluates, diagnoses, and treats common medical conditions and performs basic and intermediate surgical procedures. She provides compassionate, thoughtful care to patients in every care setting, and she deeply enjoys interacting with all of her patients. With more than 15 years of practice, Renita has developed an impressive breadth of knowledge and a unique skillset, and she feels true satisfaction knowing her efforts can help her patient feel better and happier. She embraces self-care and the connection of mind and body in her practice of treating the whole patient.
Location: Mile Square Health Center–Main, 1220 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.996.2000

Name: Adam Wielechowski
About: Dr. Adam Wielechowski is a physical therapist in the Rehabilitation Services Program at UI Health. Dr. Wielechowski has an interest in working with individuals who are experiencing pain; symptoms after a concussion; pain related to the temporomandibular joint (TMJ); and headaches. He has advanced training in orthopaedic and manual physical therapy. In addition to his clinical practice, Dr. Wielechowski participates in teaching students and physical therapy residents and is a clinical assistant professor in the UIC Doctor of Physical Therapy Program.
Location: Physical Therapy Faculty Practice, Room 336, 1640 W. Roosevelt Rd., Chicago, IL 60608, 312.413.8049

Name: Jacob Wilensky
About: Dr. Jacob Wilensky, the Jacob T. Wilensky MD Professor, is a board certified Ophthalmologist at UI Health. Dr. Wilensky specializes in treating Glaucoma. He served as the Director of the Glaucoma Service at UI Health for more than 30 years until 2011. He has been named one of America's Best Doctors every year since the list was first published in 1989.
Location: Specialty Care Building, 1009 S. Wood St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.EYES (3937)

Name: Meredith Wilk
About: Meredith Wilk is a registered dietitian specializing in nephrology and renal nutrition. Her goal is to help her patients understand the role diet can play in preventing and managing chronic diseases. Meredith has a passion for public health and providing care individualized to each patient's unique needs. She enjoys getting to know her patients to help them better meet their nutrition goals and maintain nutrition-related quality of life while managing their health.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3D, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.5569

Name: Adrienne Williams
About: Dr. Adrienne A. Williams is director of Behavioral Science in the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Williams is a clinical health psychologist who specializes in behavioral medicine, sexuality and gender, and brief interventions. Her work in behavioral medicine allows her to collaborate with primary care doctors on a number of health conditions, including diabetes, high blood pressure, substance use, disease prevention, and health behaviors. Dr. Williams has subspecialties in sexuality and gender and provides therapy for PTSD, sexual dysfunctions, sexual abuse/assault, and gender affirming-care.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 866.600.2273

Name: Erik Wissner
About: Dr. Erik Wissner is Director of Cardiac Electrophysiology in the Division of Cardiology at UI Health. Dr. Wissner has a particular interest in complex heart rhythm disorders and special expertise in catheter ablation of complex atrial and ventricular arrhythmias. His research interests relate to the clinical assessment of novel mapping and ablation technologies. Dr. Wissner is committed to providing high-quality care and welcomes the opportunity to care for you or your loved one.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6480

Name: Matthew Witthaus
About: Dr. Matthew Witthaus practices in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Witthaus provides culturally competent primary care to patients of all ages. He has a special focus on LGBTQ health, including gender-affirming hormone therapy, and he also specializes in behavioral health, children's health, women's health, chronic disease management, and preventive medicine.
Location: Family Medicine Center at University Village, 722 W. Maxwell St., Chicago, IL 60607, 312.996.2901

Name: Kathy Wollner
About: Dr. Kathy Wollner practices in the Department of Family Medicine at UI Health. She provides care to patients of all ages, from newborns to elder adults. She has specific interests in addiction medicine, including medication-assisted treatment for opioid-use disorder, and reproductive healthcare.
Location: Pilsen Family Health Center Lower West, 1713 S. Ashland Ave., Chicago, IL 60608, 866.600.2273

Name: Karen Woodard
About: Karen Woodard is a nurse practitioner in the Sickle Cell Program at UI Health. Ms. Woodard treats patients in the Acute Care Center who are experiencing a vaso-occlusive crisis, also called a pain crisis. The Sickle Cell Acute Care Center uses multimodal pain-relief strategies to manage sickle cell pain, including heat, massage chairs, fluids, and medications. Her special interests include patient education and empowering patients to help them manage and prevent sickle cell crises.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, Room 516E, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.8666

Name: Karen Xie
About: Dr. Karen Xie practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Heath. Dr. Xie specializes in body imaging, breast imaging, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), and pediatric imaging.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 3 South, 2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor, Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.6840

Name: Janice Xu
About: Janice Xu is a nurse practitioner in Division of Nephrology at UI Health. Ms. Xu specializes in working with patients prior to and after kidney transplantation.
Location: Eye & Ear Infirmary (EEI), Suite 1077, 1855 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Gongyu Yang
About: Dr. Gongyu Yang in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Yang's clinical interests include general diagnostic radiology and body sectional imaging.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL  60608, 312.413.4900

Name: Cemal Yazici
About: Dr. Cemal Yazici practices in the Division of Gastroenterology & Hepatology at UI Health. Dr. Yazici specializes in pancreaticobiliary diseases, with a specific focus on pancreatology. He performs therapeutic endoscopy, including endoscopic ultrasonography (EUS) and endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) for treatment of pancreaticobiliary diseases, including pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer. Dr. Yazici's clinical interests focus on acute and chronic pancreatitis, pancreatic cysts and cancer, endoscopic ultrasound, and ERCP; his research interests focus on pancreatitis.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 1B, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4316

Name: David Yeh
About: Dr. David Yeh interests include combined modality PET/CT and SPECT/CT, nuclear brain imaging, pediatric nuclear medicine, and fluoroscopic defecography.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 7 North, 2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.3970

Name: Vijay Yeldandi
About: Dr. Yeldandi treats Infections in people with impaired immunity such as recipients of transplants or people receiving other immunosuppressive treatment. He also specializes in patients who have infections related to travel to India. His research is related to infections in recipients of transplants and HIV in India. He also provides technical support to the government of India for HIV related programs funded by US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.8337

Name: Akira Yoshii
About: Dr. Akira Yoshii's clinical interests include treatment of children with brain, nerve, and muscle diseases. These include Neurogenic disorders (especially, tuberous sclerosis complex, neurofibromatosis and other neurocutaneous syndromes, neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis and other lysosomal disorders), and epilepsy.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2E, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7416

Name: Annette Zacharia
About: Dr. Annette Zacharia practices in the Division of Internal Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Zacharia specializes in general internal medicine and hospital medicine, and her clinical focus is on treating medical inpatients.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 3A, 1801 W Taylor St., Chicago, Il 60612, 312.355.1700

Name: Trinnette Zahakaylo
About: Trinnette Zahakaylo is a nurse practitioner in the Department of Occupational & Environmental Health at UI Health. Ms. Zahakaylo has an extensive background in occupational and environmental medicine, and she provides comprehensive assessments for patients, including work injury evaluation & treatment; Department of Transportation (DOT) exams, fitness-for-duty examinations; and medical surveillance examinations. She also provides travel medicine services for employees who travel abroad.
Location: Occupational Health & Workers' Compensation Clinic, Room E-144, 835 S. Wolcott Ave., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.7420

Name: Fred Zar
About: Dr. Fred Zar practices in the Division of Internal Medicine at UI Health. Dr. Zar is a hospitalist focused on adult medicine, and his clinical interests include infections and infectious diseases. He is committed to serving Chicago's diverse communities.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.996.5014

Name: Morgan Zaranec
About: Morgan Zaranec is a physical therapist in the Department of Rehabilitation Services at UI Health. She works with patients with orthopaedic injuries and during post-operative recovery. She is certified to treat patients with lymphedema, and she has a strong interest in oncology care. She also has a passion for teaching and assists with courses in the UIC Physical Therapy program.
Location: Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.355.4394

Name: Fang Zhu
About: Dr. Fang Zhu practices in the Department of Radiology at UI Health. Dr. Zhu leads the Division of Nuclear Medicine within the department, and she collaborates with other healthcare providers to provide effective patient care. Over the years, Dr. Zhu has done extensive research crossing neuroimaging, body imaging, and nuclear medicine fields. She also has written over a dozen peer-reviewed publications and made presentations at various specialty conferences.
Location: University of Illinois Hospital, 2nd Floor, 1740 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612, 312.413.4900, Outpatient Care Center, Suite 2C, 1801 W. Taylor St., Chicago, IL 60612
